fv5N17SCXDN5Skv7RmCnuA.text: Solid Italian food spot in Summerlin :)  We started off with the Complimentary Bread with Olive Olive and Vinegar.  Good!  Pasta E Fagioli ($5 Cup): Cannellini Beans & Pasta. This was good overall. Heavy on the beans...it was not finished.  I would skip this personally.  Grilled Chicken Sandwich ($12): Chicken Breast, Roasted Peppers, Baby Greens & Goat Cheese. Pretty good! Good flavored chicken with lots of greens/veggies.  Fair portion size as well.   Veal Parmagiana ($16): Baked Breaded Veal Scaloppini, Marinara & Mozzarella.  This was good, with thinly sliced veal and lots of flavor in the baked cheese.  Recommended!  Penne Marinara was my side choice with entree. The pasta was under-cooked, and the sauce was a bit on the sweet side. I'd choose the steamed veggies or sauteed spinach next time.  Skip this too.  Give em a try if you are in the area.  I wouldn't drive all the way across town for it again though.

S5eC9phUuwocjLLHtzzPqg.text: I have never had a bad meal here. Tonight I had the seafood risotto. It was amazing. The calamari,scallops & mussels were cooked to perfection and so tender. Their Ossobuco is ridiculously good. Mastrioni's excels with their daily specials. But you also can't go wrong ordering off the everyday menu. The Veal Parmesan is excellent.  This is a go to spot for my wife and I for special occasions or just a spontaneous date night. For my money, it is some of the best dining in Las Vegas.

7MIzSzVxXSRtP85Pmqo_iA.text: This used to be our favorite Italian restaurant in Summerlin. Their eggplant parmigiana is always delicious as well as the rest of the things we order.  Service used to be exceptional. The last two times we have been, service was terrible. Tonight, we took our family there and was placed in the corner table. Our server either had too many tables or just didn't give us the attention we deserved. There was a birthday party at another table that were taken care of as we sat for an hour without food. Our appetizers came before our wine. They completely forgot about my eggplant parmigiana. Everyone else at the table was served and when we asked they said they forgot and were making it right then. While I was still eating (and it wasn't even hot), we ordered our kids dessert, so we wouldn't have to sit for even longer. I also don't remember them asking if we needed anything after our food was served. I'm just really surprised at the lack of customer service.

fC0XJlSr8ELnjrmXTMuEAg.text: The wife and I had a terrific date night here.  Great food, great wine.  Our waiter Kurt was the perfect server for an Italian restaurant.  We had linguini with clams and the ossa bucco special and both were tremendous.  Can't wait to go back

s078PZProx1u9jwqW2QGBw.text: One of the finest locally owned Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  Pete and his team unveil an unbelievable list of specials every night.  And, the regular menu is superb too.  Chicken Francese, Eggplant Parmesan, and Chicken Vesuvio are top shelf.

J4_hfI6NoMwIbDY4mosVQg.text: This place was great! I'm use to looking for restaurants on the strip when trying a new place, but this was a great choice. The shrimp and scallop vodka sauce pasta was delicious. Everyone in my party enjoyed their dish. I recommend Mastironi's to anyone who loves pasta and wants to stay off the strip!

mbD_3eSQ3ecOGyEVO13KVw.text: So I've been bugging my hubby to go to this place for like a year. And finally had the opportunity last night to go. It was amazing. The food was really good, deco was nice, the bathrooms were really clean and the service was amazing. I haven't had this great and attentive kind of service in years! The food itself was just as good if not better than most places but what got me was the fact when I was looking at the menu for desert and didn't see my fave, I told the waiter and he told me he might have one that they made and didn't put it on the menu that night. It was amazing! Probably the best creme brulee ever! Well done!

XHoJqRzbvrVPkPcVoQNYKw.text: Just had to post a review. Yes, as my wife says, I guess I am, and I hate this discription, a food snob. But no worries, on food, service and atmosphere, this is a real 5 star place. On our regular server, Kurt, he does an great job, has a good sense of humor and works to make sure you enjoy the visit.

cw9n8r9mqiAe0dSZKTTDHg.text: I've been meaning to review this restaurant for quite some time now, as it is my to go to spot here in Las Vegas for Italian. If you want simply the finest Italian food in Las Vegas this will be your spot too. The chef and staff are on point with excellent service.  I come here often and the key to finding the finest restaurants is consistency. Each and every experience has been five-star here and I would recommend this restaurant to each and every person I know... The atmosphere is quite pleasant and they also offer a lunch service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ooj3yCAZKUqq6oGlWeRK7A.text: I've been coming here for about ten years now so it feels like home. It's family run and owned and they are always so warm. The food is tremendous. The gallery of painted art on the wall is beautiful, I bought I piece for my living room there and it has been on my wall for 5 years and looks amazing. Thanks guys

Wc-u2v4AnCgATqhMuf6Jxw.text: Had the Sauted Halibut with Lemon & Capers.  Nice portion, well prepared.  Spinach and Vegetables were outstanding. Look Fwd to returning.

oKXd2AG1kQlJvrFpRXl7LA.text: When you're craving Italian  and do not want to dress up, this is the place to go. They've got great dishes to choose from. Prices were a little bit pricey but still comparable to  Maggiano's. I had the shrimp fettuccini with HUGE succulent shrimp! I definitely would order this dish again. Definitely a must try.

C4DA4A9Jp9tVy4W3WJWdaw.text: We eat here multiple times a week.....food is amazing.  We live chef Shawn and his staff. Wonderful atmosphere - saw Santana the other day.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A we some dinner

43RW8VcLmpCVNCBwfIfZ8g.text: I used to love this place. Recommended it to several friends and suggested this place for dinner last night with a friend. The service was horrible. Our servers name was Kurt. When my friend asked about the pricing of a bottle of wine, he said sarcastically "what does it say on the menu?" Really? Are you in the service industry? That was the first interaction we had with him. Then she asked if the bartender made a good Long Island Ice Tea.. he said "I wouldn't know." I've never had a server be so rude. I will never return or recommend. The food quality was also poor. Had the Penne Chicken Spinach. It was drenched in a sweet sauce. Barely touched it.

f2GWLojGUmI1m8MAmuH9hg.text: Ate here Monday night with another couple from out of town. We were the first in for dinner as the place was empty at 5 pm. The inside was nicely decorated and it definitely gave out an Italian flare. We really enjoyed our meals except for their chopped salad. Very bland as the dressing could have used some help. Chicken Marsala was excellent as was their Chicken Piccata. My wife had a gluten free chicken dish with Penne and said it was terrific.  We ordered wine by the glass and really enjoyed the selections. Our server was the best and made our evening that much more enjoyable. Would definitely come back, but will skip the chopped salad. I have to also mention that when we left the place was packed!!!

WhN-DjyFMy8ewvmxMPA1sw.text: The best service from Kurt! Went there for my birthday, he chose my entree, dessert, and drinks with an amazing confidence and chose wisely! Enjoyed the meal fully and had good laughs with Kurt! Everything was very delightful and delicious!

aUvL_8Y49kLe4I17QHpD8A.text: Nice restaurant but I was expecting much more in my meal. I ordered a simple Spaghetti with Meatballs but it was not a success. The spaghettis were soggy and the meatballs lack of taste.

lOi8dlGI8yMaVsTAyAfq-A.text: I've driven by this place many times and from the facade one would never guess how elegant the decor is inside. A hidden gem.  The service and food was very good.  A perfect little date night local, or simply wanting a quiet little elegant dining experience but without the huge cost or drive to the strip.  I would recommend semi-casual to dressy attire to match the decor and dining experience.

IuzSgdBOMl_ZCcA8ur1hJA.text: World class Italian in a very vibe way off the strip location . About 15 min drive from strip , Wil definitely return for a superb meal . You need a car or uber worth the  trip

bwRixajRoVv9lRBjOlNUkg.text: Love this place! Been here before with my best friend and had the osso buco and it was just as good as I remembered it! Best osso buco in town I think! My family and I sat in Kurt's section and he is just the sweetest! He made excellent recommendations, joked with us, and just an all around great person and waiter. Oh also had the cream puffs for dessert, don't miss out on those, they are just to die for!

FJapgLgDpJP-GYyK7uZ8JA.text: Pete, his wife, Curt and the chefs were fabulous.  Food, atmosphere and laughter were great and abundant.  Thank you Mastioni's!

b0DPyCB6XuXvnRyfwaRz6w.text: Great dinner. Awesome seafood risotto special.   Ask for Kurt he was a awesome. He was on point. Easy parking. Crab cocktail and Mastrioni's salad to start. I will definitely be back again real soon.

TMee_W6D__CclWlCu6TwgA.text: A bit on the pricey side but the food was really great. Had pork tenderloin and the sauce was delicious.

uNuRFAJ9bGaB0u8hV365fA.text: Went here last night with my parents. We were pleasantly surprised by the interior as we for some reason expected a pizzeria style atmosphere.  Carey started us with a wonderful glass of Shiraz, my dad, his usual Tanqueray and tonic with lime (which Carey brought out immediately upon his arrival) and appetizers of roasted garlic and Caprese.  As for entrees my mom had never tried vodka sauce so we both decided on the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka, which were delicious and my dad opted for the N.Y. Steak Grilled (medium/cooked perfectly) with sauteed spinach side MOUTHWATERING!  We finished off by sharing the Creme Puffs which were YUUUUUUMMMMY!  Overall it's a wonderful local Italian restaurant. Open about 6 months and will definitely be a regular for us.  Thanks again Carey for the wonderful service!  We look forward to seeing you again soon

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lHZJdrfCEZ3yFd9Z0qfbcQ.text: Greg, his parents and I all had another awesome meal at Mastrioni's!  I had Chicken Francese, Jerry had Veal Piccata and Greg and Dale both had the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka.  Everything was wonderful, and our server, Kurt, was the best!  Can't wait to go back!

8YZC-WcYvLbqs_UMfubMEw.text: Second time here and it keeps getting better! First, the service is outstanding, our needs were anticipated at every point. The salads were fresh with just the right amount of dressing. The linguini and clams had the perfect amount of sauce and spice, pasta was to the tooth. Highly recommend and a must every time we visit Vegas.

G0-q6OIkl9YJ03f23pPzDQ.text: I enjoy giving local businesses a try, especially since big restaurant chains can get a bit boring.  Upon arriving, I was impressed with inside decor.  Not bad for a strip mall restaurant.  As for the service, I was not that impressed.  Let me start with the bread, it's plain and not fresh.  I've had better from Smith's grocery.  The seafood appetizer was delicious, something I would order again.  It was the Combo Oreganate, a combination of shrimp, scallop, clams and mussels stuffed with bread crumbs and baked on top of butter and garlic.  That sauce was the only thing that the bread was useful for in dipping with.  The waiter was not very attentive, and when I ordered the entree and appetizer, he was quick to correct my pronunciation.  Yeah, I get it; I can't pronounce your fricken menu.  Thanks for the lesson.  My husband ordered a steak and asked for it to be medium-well.  I tell my husband to always just order medium, but he's just not a fan of getting red meat.  Upon getting our entrees, we both notice how burnt his steak looks.  I order chicken, so everything seems to be in order.  The waiter drops off our entrees and quickly disappears.  He never once came back to check if everything was ok.  I'm assuming he knew how overcooked the meat was and did not want to address it.  I understand that medium-well means a small amount of pink in the center, not charred and dry.  We had to track down another waiter to send it back.  So the waiter sends it back to the waiter that was helping us and instead of checking the meat, he quickly runs over and says, "What, medium-well is too medium-well for you?"  My husband was polite to respond, but I wanted to deck the guy for his attitude.  I'm not sure if he's an owner, a manager, or lead waiter, but his attitude was crappy.  He goes back and checks things out.  A few minutes later he comes back to apologize.  Gee, you think if you checked the meat out before you made such a comment it would have made the experience less dreadful?  We did not reorder the steak.  The bill was paid and we left with a bad experience.  I would give this place another shot if it wasn't for the comment the waiter made.  I was offended and have a feeling there was a pre-judgment made by the waiter based on our casual attire, but either way, it was uncalled for.  There was definitely a lack of service to correct the situation or for forgiveness to come back and try the restaurant again.

tMfxBI2V9bWKPFBD2WY-bA.text: I just returned from a Ladies' Luncheon at Mastrioni's. I planned it for 17 women and was helped by Emry. They couldn't have been nicer. The table was set up and four young men catered to our every need. The food was delicious. Several people ordered pasta, several ordered salads, a few ordered fish and I ordered a lobster roll, which had nice chunks of lobster and a lovely side salad. Their lunch prices are very reasonable for the quality. The bread is delicious, and so is the salad dressing. This is my second large luncheon at this restaurant and both times it was superb! They even let me bring in cupcakes, which they served to us. As a former cooking teacher and caterer (and Italian to boot) I'm very picky about food, and Mastrioni's gets a big thumbs up from me. Great for lunch, happy hour or dinner, Mastrioni's won't disappoint!

W_aMr4JrqFPyJxtbgrkiUA.text: I love this place. It's romantic and always so clean with great service. The food is always to die for. I recommend the shrimp scampi, ny strip steak, veal, halibut and the seafood pasta with white sauce. Best restaurant in town!!!

63LBAITYbLp10uUMJEkkLw.text: The food was above average . I will not return based on the  poor/slow service from our waiter Kurt. The hostess/manager  ( about forty dark hair pulled back)at the door seemed angry and was unpleasant from the minute we walked in. To summarize the evening: food was bought and placed on our table that wasn't even ours. It was then picked up from our table and served to the table beside us. All of our entrees were brought at different times,the last entree didn't arrive till the rest of the table were pretty much done with their entrees After all entrees were served ,eaten and cleared,we asked about the salad. It was brought at that time. The waiter Kurt came over to me and apologized for the really bad service.He brought over cream puffs gratis. He still charged us for the coffee that came with the cream puffs and for the salad that we had to practically beg to receive. I would have liked to discuss the bad service with a manager but we couldn't find one. This being my first visit I had great expectations i was very let down.

lwJOE6P-hEXBybsTiXG-eQ.text: I wouldn't guess it from the exterior, but Mastrioni's occupies a beautiful space. It's located in a strip mall and has the typical stucco outside. But on the inside the restaurant has high ceilings dedicated only to open air. The tables are nicely spaced apart and set with linens, art on the walls. Super classy.   I really want to like this place, but the food wasn't so great. I went with a couple friends for lunch. I think out of all of the entrees we ordered, mine was the best. I got the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka Pasta ($17). I am a sucker for a vodka sauce and this dish didn't disappoint. The scallops were cooked perfectly: to a supple tenderness, not overdone. And the scrimps were shelled all the way to the tail. I love that. The dish had a nice balance was nicely portioned.   My bf got the Veal Marsala ($16). I had a taste of the sauce and - holy crap (in a bad way). It  was way too sweet. My first thought was pancake syrup.   My mom got the Pork Tenderloin ($15), which she said was not so tender. She said the gravy was very tasty and hearty, but so hearty that she could barely taste the pork. Well, hot damn.   Both my mom and bf got a side of spinach with their entree. I thought the spinach was pretty salty. I love salt, but I love balance more.   They played smooth jazz -- Buble and Sinatra -- during our stay.    They tout a full bar. My mom ordered a Long Island Ice Tea. My bf noticed they only serve three Italian reds by the glass. Seems a bit under par for an Italian joint.   Mastrioni's is a nice place to chill and the service was great. But the food wasn't good enough to make me want to return.   #offthestrip #noncasino

aXLPUdHaR4LWunPU9MEfVQ.text: Awesome! Decided to celebrate my birthday here with the family... We went early on a Sunday night as we have a 4 year old who gets antsy. Every aspect of food, service and ambiance was excellent. I felt like I could've been back on Long Island in the neighborhood red sauce joint. Definitely becoming a regular here!

TYSvQXtJTYEGZtk5VQDnCQ.text: My fiance loved the penne with vodka sauce.  Good wine selection.

lHFjt9mZDIVZqR5ppUT5Tg.text: I LOVE this restaurant!!! The absolute best Italian restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas!!! Great food, Great staff, Great atmosphere.  You can see them cooking the food at the bar... I have seen people walk up and ask how things are cooked and the cooks are really nice and answer the questions. If you go, you need towalk to the bathroom and seethe history of the Chef.  He is really great!! I wish I could find something that I do not like about this restaurant but there is nothing, well actually I wish it was closer to my house but I do not mind the drive for such great food!!!

b5Z8nLTUnjdDxN3bqhjR1w.text: Mastroni's has always been a family favorite, but sad to say, the quality is slowly deteriorating, which is why they get four starts instead of five today. Love the atmosphere and ambience. It's not to quiet, but not very loud here either. I sat at the bar last night, which was a cozy intimate spot in front of the kitchen. We ordered a round of the clams, the cioppino, and the chicken Francese. The clams were a really good, if not perfect, appetizer with warm bread. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the Chicken Francese: my every time choice meal. It just wasn't that great; it was very bland with nothing to it. Had to much egg too. The sauce was yummy...with bread tho (lol). For the first time in forever, I didn't finish it or ask to take it home. Wah. The man ordered the cioppino, but it wasn't anything special either. Just okay... Sadly, it was his first time at Mastronis, so I'm not sure if I'll be able to convince him to give it another go in the future.Not really sure what's going on here (by the look of the yelp reviews) or if it was a bad night to dine with them, but probably won't revisit again for a bit.

JkGYn-D-abVxYrpiN-w3hw.text: We stopped here last night for a quick bite to eat. What a find! Top rate service, excellent Italian food, and the prices are not bad either. Even though its located inside a strip-mall type setting, the interior is very nicely done. Bar for a quick drink of finger food, semi-private area if you want to have a small party, and the normal tables are large enough to handle the portions. We had the shrimp cocktail (super), Palm salad (colorful, not too much dressing, just the right sized heats of palm), and the Chicken Vesuvius. Top that with a Blueberry martini which was not from some pre-mix but made from hand, and you've got yourself a fine fun meal. I'm sure their desserts are great too, but we were way too full to even try.  So, just a great place to eat and seems like a fun location to hang out. Glad we stumbled upon it.

toTb1y6TLkVcv7sJbBqHYQ.text: My boyfriend and I decided to come here tonight because we were craving spaghetti and meatballs. Our server came to take our order and was telling us about the specialty items on the menu. One of those items was king crab legs. We decided to order that and also get an order of spaghetti and meatballs.  Our food came out incredibly fast and we were incredibly happy about that. The crab legs were delicious. When we tried the spaghetti and meatballs the pasta sauce as well as the meatballs were incredibly bland. We decided to return it and get something else. The waiter brought us a bolognaise dish but ultimately it just looked like a smashed up version of the spaghetti and meatballs and practically tasted the same with a little more seasoning. We ate it anyways. We decided to order a creme brulee for desert which was really good. We had also ordered a $25 bottle of wine with our food. When the check came we had realized our waiter failed to mention the price of the crab legs appetizer before we decided to order it and the cost for about four (not even full legs) crab legs was $65. Despite our waiter being incredibly friendly and welcoming, he still charged us for the meal we returned and did not have the decency to comp the spaghetti and meatballs or at least the desert due to our dissatisfaction. All in all our total was about $140 including a tip. I was very disappointed in the meal and what my boyfriend paid for it. It was absolutely not worth the cost. We will not be returning to this restaurant.

16itNFA4n1J6lPzDJmY99Q.text: Nice, neighborhood spot.  Decided to go with a friend for an early dinner on a weekday.  Food was just fine and atmosphere nice.  We got a bit of a shock when the bill came.  Our dinner was 2 bowls of linguini with clam sauce, one side of spinach, one glass of wine and one club sold.  The bill was almost $80!  The food and service were fine but I think they have gone a bit overboard on their pricing.  Not a value at all.

PzCcFaBUoCbFexYc-DVhmQ.text: The only thing good about the visit was the food. The service was horrible, and they made us feel as if we didn't belong in their restaurant. I would not return to this restaurant, and even though the food was good, it was overpriced  for the quality, and definitely overpriced for the lack of quality service.

DB3eedzfEti7gl588rW2XQ.text: I had a hard time choosing the rating for this place since I had mixed feelings about the food and service. When I walked in there was no hostess at the stand. A waiter came to greet us and said someone would be right over. No one really came? Finally got seated after a while. The people behind me were irked that no one came to greet them and asked how long I was waiting.  Appetizers: eh sauteed calamari- thought I'd give this a try since you don't really see sauteed calamari on menus. comes in red or white wine sauce. The calamari was OKAY. wasn't great, wasn't bad, just slightly chewy. We ordered white wine and i SWEAR the waiter said he was going to bring a side of the red wine sauce for us to try but no such sauce appeared. The sauce was so plain and so watery. It literally tasted like they made this great sauce and poured water on it to spread it a little further. When I ordered this dish I imagined I would be able to dip the bread in the sauce. would NOT recommend caprese- this was good. no place can really mess this up. they also give you oil and balsamic vinegar on the side to top it.  Entrees: ordered all the specials seafood risotto- i enjoyed this dish it was filled with seafood. It came with about 4 large shrimp, lots of calamari, scallops, mussels, and peas. after eating the sauteed calamari i was calamaried out. this had a lot of calamari in it. there were also a fair amount of peas, if you don't like peas better ask for it to be left out. it was perfect! came piping hot, not TOO creamy and just the right amount of flavor. would order again! eating my leftovers for breakfast!! lobster ravioli- after all the hype via yelp we had to try the lobster ravioli and boy did it deliver. the ravioli was delish!! it was also sprinkled on top with more lobster chunks. the noodle was made with spinach or mushroom or something (the ravioli was striped) and a little bigger than the traditional square, more like a rectangle.  ate everything and then wiped up the sauce with bread. SLURP. bone-in veal- i didn't try this but my friend ordered it. He said it was alright and didn't seem impressed. he enjoyed the other two dishes more.  Dessert:  Cannoli- I loveeeeeeee cannolis and I haven't found a GREAT cannoli to rave about in Vegas. this order came with two, but not that great. would not order again Sauteed banana gelatto- this was... just banana gelatto. good but i was expecting more from the name. maybe like chunks of banana or something in it?  Overall they did a a good job with the entrees. The desserts and the appetizers are ones to forget. The waiter took our bread basket away to get more and then we had to ask for it 3 times to get it back. We ordered a specific year for our wine and was brought the incorrect one. Also the clientele there that evening were dressed very.... minimal... Not something you'd expect at an off the strip restaurant. Something to consider for those with children. I'm coming back to this place but going straight to the entrees on the specials!

aWllA8jQYDhcy7GbAh5gxg.text: Just ate at one of my favorite places in the entire valley again. The food is always great. The ambiance is great on the inside, even though it is in a nondescript strip mall. The service was great as usual. Thanks Garrett. I highly recommend this place.

kmb0r3hlRzF0KVdJdNPagw.text: You should be embarrassed of yourself. You took my money for a gift card and never produced the gift card since January. Still waiting. 2 1/2 months my friend is waiting for her happy birthday gift card. You keep telling me you're sorry, apologizing, and that you're looking into it. Terrible customer service. If it were me I would have immediately issued the gift card to the customer- period- then looked into what ever trouble was causing this in your company. Pathetic.

66aX4Udee9Oa-YApFjrVPw.text: Excellent food. I had the linguini and chop clams with white sauce. I will be back. Ambiance is excellent service is ok. Wine a very nice Pinot noire I had   The dinner I had was well prepare. I am looking for to coming back to try the lunch menu

r6N26BizxiFR4ziUgT7uYw.text: I went here for my birthday, which also happened to be the day that the Dodgers beat the Cubs and went onto the World Series, and had a fantastic time!   Whenever I try a new Italian restaurant, I usually always go with the Chicken Parm. Why? Because if you mess that up then I probably don't want to eat anything else on your menu. WELL GOOD NEWS. The Chicken Parm was delicious!! The portions are HUGE, so really you can share this between 2 people and order an app/salad and call it a night. But, if you want to go all out then the Sea Bass is sooooooooo good too. My friend had that and I think I ate most of her food, and well, mine. IT'S MY PARTY AND ILL EAT IF I WANT TO!   We also had about 5 bottles of wine, not too crazily priced. I would definitely come back here, even if I have to pay.

iElzeJqrmd_hf2Yju2wktA.text: My first time eating here and the service was superb. Very attentive with water refills, taking away plates and taking orders. Additionally, the food portions were enough to take home for almost 2 meals. I ordered the steamed clams/mussel combination for a starter for the table and then ordered the grilled salmon, with veggies. It was cooked to perfection and was easy to tear. Highly recommend. Went there for a birthday celebration as well, and they were kind enough to let us bring our own dessert and plates (I have food quite a bit of food allergies).

38lstFsg3ecwcf044wYvbQ.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurant I've been too since I've been to...sever was on point and the food amazing. I recommend this place to a couple of my coworkers and they loved it there. It had a great ambience and also very casual. Will go back again.

8s8bWT3j7qkpjBUVkrD4nA.text: This is a wonderful locals spot. So glad we  were introduced to Mastrioni's by friends. We had the lobster special and then two ordered of the Sea Bass. Everything was cooked to perfection. The lobster was sweet and tender! And their sea bass was delicious. Not over salted but tremendously flavorful. And love their Mastrioni's salad. So nice and lightly dressed with wonderful field green. Service is always efficient and all the meals always arrive hot and in unison.  Love that!  I have to add that our last trip here the fish was just not on par with previous visits. And  it is a bit spendy so don't be afraid to open your wallets!

ZASdhzXaeyFX3OxvZJji-g.text: One of my favorites in town.  Great food and service to match.  Without a doubt the BEST crab legs in town. We went with a group of 12 and not one left dissatisfied. A few had never been there and have become regulars. Great wine list (Prisoner Magnum!) and fairly priced but you can bring your own with a nominal corking fee. Nice ambience and for the location-no where near the Strip! Works for me ! Dined here in December of 2016.

7pyIRce9Okl7tl3G3L0Pmg.text: Boyfriend and I have been wanting to check out this place as we've been to the liquor store next door. We were disappointed from the start as neither hostess could acknowledge us as they were too busy in conversation with who seemed like a regular and he was more apologetic than they once discovered we had been standing there for some time. We were then told seating was limited but the counter was available.    The porter brought water and bread quickly. Pete was our waiter and seemed attentive as we ordered our drinks and apps.  The food came quickly. We ordered fried calamari, Caesar salad, chicken Alfredo and chicken piccata.  The calamari was great, the salad was below average for the $15 charged. Boyfriend was happy with his piccata and my Alfredo was bland and chicken way over cooked.  Pete also disappeared after our food was ordered. We wanted to order desert but didn't as we began to get agitated.    The bill, however was delivered quickly once Pete was found and we were disappointed to spend over $100 on a very below average meal and service.  You might be better off having a reservation and sitting in the dining room as opposed to the counter.    There's a great place around the corner called Chef Marc's that's a much better value for a comparable price. And you'll for sure get offered desert.

r7M3d0_ERn3Czy0OIYbw-Q.text: The food was incredible the service was fantastic. We celebrated a birthday there and it was a party of 10 and every dish that was ordered was top of the line for some of the best Italian food in that part of Las Vegas. The the owner Pete is the man!

AjZ30Tixbt5BjmxMNcZm9Q.text: For what we got, it was fantastic!  I came here for a date and it was romantic and modern and gave you enough time in-between courses to talk/sip on wine.  We got crab cakes for the appetizer which were filled with giant pieces of crab an were quite good although the tartar sauce was just eh.  The shrimp cocktail sauce on it was far better.  I got the shrimp fettuccine alfredo and it was decadent.  It was so thick and luscious and filling and although only 4 shrimp came with it, they were massive!  My date got chicken, sun-dried tomato, and mushroom pasta and from the bite I had it was really good as well.  I also had a glass of chardonnay from their extensive wine list.  I wanted to try so much more their!  I wish their prices were a bit cheaper but if the food is going to be that good, I will pay them.  The portions are more than substantial especially with how rich the food is.

-KYdWRrqfVxGT0yRBWJVWg.text: Great Italian Food!!!  Had the baked clams, seafood risotto and cream puffs....All superb...  All in all a perfect meal....Will definitely be back!

jhnKlDrIerBpI7L4v5b4Ww.text: The last time I had an Italian meal this exceptional I was in "little Italy" San Francisco. Food was hot and consistent throughout, from app to dessert. The crab cakes (loaded with crab meat) rival anything I've ever eaten in Baltimore. The veal marsala was amazing, tender and full of flavor. Even the creme brulee was on point! Complements to the chef!  Michael "our server" didn't miss a beat, even his wine recommendation was spot on.  I've been in Vegas for 28 year's and this is by far the best Italian seafood resturant in the valley!  Can't wait to go back, keep up the good work.

sopLZNeW9xmUO_RsGPPBsA.text: Love this place the best Italian food in Las Vegas and great prices. Promise you will love it! Pete the owner and chef Shaun what a team thanks guys keep up the great work.

gBzu-NfkJg8SI_1STdXSLw.text: Such a disappointing visit this evening.  We have been patrons of this restaurant many times over the years and always enjoyed our experience.  These last few years have shown a steady decline in the quality of the cuisine, the service, and atmosphere.  It is with sadness I state we will not be returning any time soon.  The salad was lackluster and presentation weak. The vodka sauce was watery and tasteless. The ice tea was completely flavorless.  And all the portions minuscule.  The service was... sporadic, uninformed, and uncouth.  Worst of all there seems to be no leadership. No maitre-d' or GM was visibly present and it showed. Never at any time were we welcomed, asked about our meal or thanked for our patronage.  Denying us any opportunity to share our experience and input on the meal and service.  There are restaurants in this town with far less complicated menus and less expensive price points that out this place to shame.

ua7JMCFRzS88N2ufQGqTcQ.text: Horrible food and service!  Iced tea was like drinking sugar water.  Waited 30 mins for a lousy salad.  Vodka sauce needed flavor.  Noodles were hard.  Will never come back.  Haven't been here in a few months and wished we stayed away.   Used to be a great restaurant, but now they don't seem to care.  No one even asked how everything was.....so here ya go!

3asaG-b0v0vyjcN5O7eTZw.text: Wow what an amazing place. You would never think a strip mall restaurant could be this classy and the food this awesome.   I am a foodie. I love everything about the process of prep and the profiles of flavor. If you want a great experience of this just sit at their bar and watch the chef work. You will appreciate your food more.  I had the shrimp app. Very very good. The New York steak was cooked perfectly rare. The tomato garnish was even amazing. That should be a menu option. Very impressive.  So don't think a restaurant can't deliver on quality because it is between a nail salon and a liquor store. This place is outstanding.

1L0TwPivzyQZTqTcex_tQQ.text: When the food came out, everything looked very unappetizing. My boyfriend's and I's entrees are probably the mist decent looking ones. My cousin literally got a gigantic slab of meat and that's it. No sides, just a slab of meat. Lol  HOWEVER, once you try the food, it is delicious. Kind of like the saying goes: don't judge a book by it's cover.  Everything is well seasoned and very fancy. One of my cousin had only four shrimps on his plate and that was the entire entree. Haha???  At least the food was good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X184mui69ZDoL4uuWDddlw.text: I have heard a lot great things about this place so I thought I would give it a try.  The decor is nice inside and the prices are reasonable for that type of restaurant however as someone who has been in food service for along time you don't drop 2 dinner plates and then wait 10 mins for the other plates to come out of the kitchen.  I know that may sound trivial but it creates awkward situation.

XGjI1ImLk5JXV3OtdReMQg.text: I really enjoyed my meal here. We were with friends and family.   Hey have a great innovative menu, and if you love seafood with a Mediterranean flair, this is the place for you.   My son had linguini with clams and it was perfect: al dente pasta and fresh clams. I had the Bouillabaisse. It wasn't as good as in southern France or northern Italy, but I was happy.   For dessert we had Tiramisu, and it was homemade, fresh and excellent.    Great beers and a nice wine list.  Service is great.

CmDQt9f_w2RKZlkA_DCH1Q.text: I was lucky enough to have this place recommended to me.  The menu shown online doesn't show the extent of what they actually serve.  My friend and I were dressed informally but neatly, as were most customers.  The place has a formal but relaxing feel to it.  I had Chicken Parmesan and my guest had Chicken Francese . Both were excellent and the portions filled the dinner plates.  The waiter, Justin, was very friendly and attentive, in a reserved way.  Mixed drinks were $8 and packed a punch.  This restaurant owner has it all together.  I will go back again for sure.

bDPUqgptlrHRPaySMxZrLQ.text: As good as it's ever been. We found this place when it was at the Rio, loved the home feel the place and the food was dynamite, especially the meatballs. Now it's at the Paris hotel they kind of lost their home town feel but the food is just as delicious. The hostess was a bit rude but Raymond and Francisco more then made up for it. Great place to eat when in vegas, don't decide what to order until you hear the specials.

regl2Vey7ngiEv-UW5-IdA.text: Amazing food. They squeezed us in for a reservation and accommodated my party of 8. I was so grateful since it was my dad's birthday and he wanted Italian. The veal special was for my dad and he loved it. The server, I think his name was James (a bronco fan), was so attentive and the entire staff was great. My daughter spilled her drink and they were so sweet to her and cleaned up quickly. I ordered calamari the penne with chicken, mushroom and sundried tomatoes and it was to die for. We had fettucini alfredo at the table with chicken and the sauce had so much flavor. Even the cheesecake for dessert was excellent. The o ly thing that wasn't great was the bruschetta, the tomatoes were not ripe and it could have used salt or balsamic in my opinion. But the rest was amazing!

wyt3ZQWxCLlakz0jb1g6DA.text: All I can say is excellent. Food cooked to perfection. Service impeccable. A must for any lover of seafood and Italian. Kurt was an excellent waiter making sure our wine glasses were never empty, our food was exactly how we ordered, and left us wanting for nothing. Even though it isn't close, I will make the drive for this place.

FiY5n4dH1orBkphT44aHMQ.text: Not only is the food great but our waiter Kurt was beyond excellent, great service and great food, what a perfect combination, give it a try, pricey but definitely worth it! Graci

-4_l3LPJrz5qZ1wyzEwc_g.text: Tonight was my first visit at this fantastic restaurant ! Food was incredible ! Kurt the server was beyond great !  He advised us of all the great appetizers they have as well as told us all about the awesome choices of entrees !  I selected the Salmon and may I just say that it was the best Salmon I have ever had.  My friend had the Veal which was out of this world as well.  Kurt was amazing! I have never in 53 years of my life had the type of service that Kurt gave us. From walking in the door till walking out of the restaurant Kurt gave us his un divided attention!  Hard to find service like this!  All employees seemed happy and customer service focused!  Defiantly a place I will go back to enjoy a great dinner!  I will forever request Kurt for our server!

IcyFKDyWS9ueEi8qHyaefw.text: Im so glad  I read the reviews on here and this could be hands down one of the best Italian restaurants on the West Coast. Ive eaten in North Beach, Italy, New York etc..  But this little gem in Vegas is no joke.

y6AoZYtBsPW1PA6MfUVgXA.text: Best Italian spot in the city. I'll never go to Nora's again. Maybe for a drink. Steamers, Ossobuco, the steak, the desserts, even the seafood is all amazing.

ZgIMX4iKQ6lItmpjxm9zMQ.text: **This was a take out order. **  This review is only in reference to three dishes, which are in my opinion are bench marks of simple Italian food and not about the restaurant or wine menu.   So, I'm half way through eating my spaghetti and meatballs and the first bite I had had high hopes and the hope melted like the meatball in my mouth. The meat was tender and juicy, however their was no flavor or spice. I felt as though I was eating the spaghetti and meatballs from a hospice center. What did help was the scrumptious garlic bread that I used to fill up on.   After the disappointment, I turned to my friend who got the shrimp linguini and he chowed down on the glorious shrimps first. With a grin on his face he dug into the linguini. Within a few moments I recognized the look on his face, it was the exact look I had when I first took a bite of the spaghetti and meatballs. The linguini and the sauce had a mild garlic butter flavor and he wasn't a big fan either.   I gave it two stars because of the garlic bread and the shrimp.

F2PyClp8hQcWb0yaSqweVg.text: Step above chain restaurants but I'm afraid not by much.  Need to learn to prep the steaks before grilling, I don't expect Peter Luger's but .......steak was ice cold in the center.  Ruined two steaks in one shot and no apologies; there should have been one to the restaurant owner and one to the customer.   Salad, same amateur hour here, drowning in oil, wilted to a point of being stuck to the plate.   If this is a chef owned restaurant, I commend your savvy on picking a market where you have a chance.  If this was a Batali place several heads would have rolled, I know that personally.  One in the BOH and two in FOH.  We all know mistakes happen, we all know how a good places handle them.

lH7MkaXxW1gOXFKBVK3m8A.text: Beautiful resturant, friendly waiter. Very good Italian food and good wine. I had the eggplant parm which was so delicious. It was a large serving and came with pasta. They have amazing sauce. I tried the lobster ravioli which is really good too, they put whole lobster pieces on top and it was so good and creamy. I will be back again for sure.

gAbT5l-WsEd5BLeZiNvqZw.text: Fabulous-- and if lucky enough to get Kurt as your waiter-- even better.  Get the gnocchi.  Best I've ever enjoyed.  The atmosphere- the location! Just the best.  Will go back again and  again!!  Wonderful for special occasions!

mnlXwUQNPCtXRY_KhqZExA.text: Justin, our server, was beyond professional.  He was very much on cue with customer service. Had the baked ravioli, baked ziti, and the special, King Crab Legs. Simply delicious. Got us right in at 6pm with no reservations. Thank you Justin.

tnCUGbj02tcxoIEwXBYvcA.text: We have been fans of Petes different locations for decades.  Tonight we had the most disappointing meal in our many dozens of visits to this restaurant. We ordered a stuffed calamari app special that had not too much taste. The signature cioppino soup was bland, it used to have a lot more zest. The cod special was also very bland, the mushroom juice had no flavor at all.  Such a sad situation with so many new and exciting restaurants opening in the Summerlin area that we will not be making a return visit.

cT3dF2Ld4Sx_ndtxAEPhwg.text: A nice quiet Italian  Restaurant, near Summerlin.  White tablecloths,excellent service. Great food, priced fairly  The veal dishes were excellent. the pasta along with it was fine.My friend loved the pasta with white clam sauce.  Was our first time, and it is a success.

qGQIuY39I8RzE2BMOjd03w.text: Post Christmas dinner w/friends. WOW - out of the ballpark. Food was to perfection, service too. Definitely my 'go to' place for amazingly delicious Italian. Worth the price. Delicioso!

v0fWRMVRLNM8s1kp7EcsiA.text: Update on this Mastrioni's 7-1-2016. I have since gone back and given this another chance.  It was super and back to the original service I experienced originally.  The owners are from New York and have made this place one of the best Italian places in Vegas.  If you like watching the kitchen and food preparation, sit at the bar and enjoy the show! Original review 6-3-2015 First off let me say this was my go to Italian place!  Ive gone 6+ times and have no problems with the price as long as the food is great and service is super too.  That being said...one of my favorites is the seafood over linguini....in the past it was awesome with a nice blend of seafood.  This last time...it was LOADED with calamari and they were as rubbery as hell.  I literally could not eat it.  I was stunned!  Usually the food has been SO GOOD in the past...I wondered if they changed owners or chefs. I ate what I could...then decided some spumoni pie with coffee would end the meal on a high note....well not so.  The coffee was good..but the ice cream spumoni pie was direct from the deep freeze and was HARD as a rock.  It was not edible until it defrosted for 30 mins....I was so disappointed in Mastrioni's.  I did mention it to the waiter...but he just shrugged it off saying it will get better when thawed...well no duh.  Then to end the evening...the wait staff do not seem to know what one is doing with the others.  The table next to ours....the couple left...and it sat for a few mins before they could clear the dishes.   Then another wait staff came over and removed the table cloths and napkins and placed clean a clean table cloth on. LOL then the original wait staff came over and  removed the table cloth thinking it was dirty...and proceeded to put another one.  It was comical.  Hopefully they will smooth out the rough edges.

nhhjfiZYYnibcPR92xn7Gg.text: Always excellent Italian food.   Knowledgeable servers.  I always get the shrimp parmigiana.  Great place to bring your out of towners if you want to impress!

5_7gUtEe482GnewTjOUs0w.text: This place is a must for locals and tourists alike. I've been here multiple times, with friends, date nights, and with the whole family and every time is exceptional. Fantastic service, food, and atmosphere.

1Jr2pfmpqVWfdVkMBO_KXw.text: My family used to frequent Mastrioni's when it was at the previous location.  Unfortunately, we are no longer in Vegas as often as we'd like to be.  Fortunately, the food hasn't changed.  Sooooo delicious...  I had the Veal Piccata, which was very tender and made perfectly sauteed with lemon and capers and served with a side of penne marinara.  I also had a taste of the Cesar Salad with Anchovies.  Yummy!!!  Our waiter was great and very attentive.  Will definitely head back the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini Scampi $24
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Piccata $22

GQuY2ybbzJVHMjnOGjXjSA.text: Not as good as it used to be.  Service was horrible and I didn't get my meal until after my husband was almost done.  Had sent it back because it was ice cold. Talked to the owner and he didn't do anything about it.  Customer service has went down hill fast!! I was very surprised with the lack of concern with the owner.

u-8Met_ZSrWQ1nzwEfuTLw.text: This place is fantastic! A local told me about it when I was there on business and I've been eating here ever since. The food is always right on and the service is spot on. The guys in the kitchen know all the regulars and it seems that every time I'm there a customer makes a trip to the open kitchen to compliment the cooks. They don't have Lasagna on the menu, but if they are not slammed and you asked nicely the chef will have someone make it for you. It is so good! The Halibut Picatta  is amazing. I've never had a meal there that I didn't thoroughly enjoy. A little pricey but worth every penny. If you like watching people cook, find a seat at the bar and enjoy the show!

V_xPantBSbu6-dy5zW-uFA.text: It's alright. Don't need to spend money here.  Overall 8/10 atmosphere 8/10 food 8/10 service 8/10  Food is ok not good not bad~

N9e-EkIoJtF0sbW2WHNPMw.text: Super cute authentic Italian food in Orange County. The decor is very homey & service is extremely attentive! The owners make you feel like family and make sure you are taken care off throughout your whole dining experience! Everything is homemade & you can def taste the difference. We saved room for dessert & it was well worth it! The cheesecake & tiramisu was delish!! Save room for either or both, homemade perfection!! Very reasonably priced & cute for a inexpensive date night.

ngIh4CfFW18AyR7jAo8v0g.text: Kurt provided EXCEPTIONAL service and dinner was absolutely phenomenal, as usual. I love having this amazing restaurant in my neighborhood.

2VYF1H-jwz-6qzml15Hppg.text: Been wanting to come here for a long time, a friend said it was so good. I ordered a glass of wine, they were out of stock, I ordered another glass that was good. Then we ordered dinner, I ordered the clam chowder and shrimp scampi linguini again, they were out of the chowder, the linguini had burnt garlic in it and tasted horrible. My daughter ordered the rigatoni and it was good, the waiter brought me a new shrimp linguini and it was excellent. Because I had to wait for a second meal, my daughter had already finished and was ready for dessert, but a dessert menu came way after the fact. When it came time to pay the bill, I was charged for the clam chowder that I never got! I left disappointed and won't return.

_Ng9LBEXu4EHloH4MpbInA.text: I tried this place in a different manner, I went there for dinner the place was packed! Definitely would recommend a reservation on the weekend,  it was really cute and datey. Perfect place for a small cute romantical dinner for two. I did not really order off the menu, so I cant speak much about how large their variety was. We asked to be sent things out to try from the chefs recommendations. Some of the dishes I never thought I would like  I was really surprised with and loved!! Most of the things we tried appetizer wise have a little twist in them which makes me a happy camper! I love the ambiance and the food, for sure I wana go back and order an Item or two from the menu and compare them to my normal liking!  But IF I can give a recommendation I would definitely recommend the tiramisu cake that is home made!!! Its one of the best I have ever had, LOVED it!!

h0lHkV3Itgn5FARzDrt8yA.text: OOOOMMMGGGG found my favorite Italian spot in Las Vegas ... The service the food all on point .. My wife had The clam linguini it  was so good not heavy very light and full of flavor . I had the chicken parmigiana w a side of penne marinara , the chicken for once was not a a big glob of breading .. So light and flavorful .. I can't wait to come back ...

TMzyW5KY5RRfjFTMW9KX8w.text: Went to Mastrioni's for Mother's Day dinner. As usual the food was amazing. I ordered the Pasta Fagioli so much flavor and my favorite the Salmon w/ capers. The food is always great, the service is fantastic one of my favorite restaurants.

r08IhgQFSkbb8rDy486LOw.text: My husband and I live right down the street from this restaurant and never thought to stop by, but my brother was in town for a business trip And we decided to come by for dinner! Everyone was so nice from the moment we walked in the door. It was myself,  my brother and my 16 month old daughter. Our server wss Kurt and he was great! We had the shrimp scampi to start, my brother had the grab legs which were amazing!!! I had the grilled salon and my daughter had the penne marinara with a meatball. We all loved our selections and I plan on taking guests to this hidden gem every time they are in town!! We will be back again for sure! Thanks again Kurt for your great service and being so friendly with my daughter!!

PGOgCdb7VDaEYtJHhOn2TQ.text: I was in the mood for Chicken Parm, came across this place thanks to Yelp. Food is great can't wait to go back.

3SG_ap7yXsDT4KQ9uSdkNw.text: This is simply one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. All of the food is delicious the service is great and you have to try the shrimp cocktail appetizer. Three of the six of us always order the eggplant Parmesan because it is the best anybody has ever eaten. All of the veal dishes are delicious the veal piccata and the veal Parmesan especially. The tiramisu is made there locally by one of the waiters and the service is outstanding.  How anybody could give this place one or two stars is beyond understanding.  They would have to own a competing Italian restaurant to give this place a rating like that.

EaHaJPQQww8vzu7aMJGiCQ.text: We celebrated a 50th wedding anniversary at the restaurant. The service alone is worthy of 5 stars. We were treated beautifully. We did not want for anything.  The antipasti and grilled vegetable platter were delicious. Generous portions.  I had the chicken Parmesan which I thought was done to perfection. I love when it has little crispy edges. My husband loved his cioppiino, he only wished it came with linguine. Two of the others had osso buco which was gigantic, I had a bite and it was very tasty. The veal cooked perfectly and tender.  I loved the decor, dark woods, low lighting, tables not too close together. They made the evening a great celebration for my aunt and uncle.

xxoaWZOj2viiD170_EmEig.text: Most people who visit Mastrioni's focus on the cuisine, as they should. However, there is another taste at Mastrioni's that should be savored as well, and that's the flavor of original artwork! The artwork that adorns the walls and enhances this wonderful environment, adds to the all around palette of 'great taste'.    Yes, the food is wonderful, but the artwork by Vegas' own, Lincoln Maynard, is absolutely 'favoloso'!  PS: If you're in the mood for a cocktail, there's always happy hour. Cheers! Happy Hour is Monday - Thursday 4 - 7 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paintings by Lincoln Maynard
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Painting by Lincoln Maynard

QNXI91pg0gfHqClsZnSNLQ.text: A Vegas institution.  A must go in Summerlin. The diver scallops were to die for.  The only reason for not giving 5 stars was service was a bit slow and inattentive.  One of the best veal dishes I have ever had

NfftehnMW3IToNbbE5wYZQ.text: Great food every time. Easily one of the best tomato basil soups I've had ever. Service is always fast and friendly.

L2iRiOICVx501cg3wtkJkg.text: Very good place to have a great dinner with your family. Or a date most definetly. The ambiance is just right. The waiters are awesome and know there stuff. So many things on the menu will not dissapoint you. Alittle pricey. But the dinner will make it up.

k1O-dnsD0bxCGYn0wbcWUw.text: Great food...got a gift card...used it and the food was great! Plan on going back again sometime im the near future.

iRGIdrvNIVyHfq384tZuHg.text: had dinner here last night with my family, we ran into carlos santana which was fun but the service was just silly....first our waiter forgot my sister's drink, then we waited 30 minutes for 2 dinner salads and 2 entrees for my sister to find a button in her salad!!! they didn't make us pay for her salad but wow.....what an interesting place this is. I doubt I will be returning unless my family wants another button in their food haha

19iaZpcg1CtkRM99UWAbLw.text: First time eating here. Ordered carry out. The baked ziti was very good. Definitely going back to explore the menu. :))

fVwuSK1W5pUuFD9ilZ_1Vw.text: Always great Italian food. As authentic as you can get. I have had Italian food in Italy and Mastrioni's quality is top notch!

xQVRHZTwPGoJWM3zlBm5FA.text: As good as it gets folks ! Best shrimp with pasta. their steaks are amazing. best meatballs and spaghetti. Everything is full of flavor and their service is tops in town. An easy 5 STAR rating. A must go to eatery.

zjH6_UdifUlRTms8QV3vXQ.text: We got a bowl of tomato basil soup, salmon and veal, which were all good. Sizes run on the smaller side, similar with any upscale restaurant. Spotted probably 3 or 4 doctors with families inside. Nice atmosphere, good for having a conversation, not loud at all inside and overall a quaint space. Next time would try some of the Italian food but it was definitely a bit pricier. If you have the budget to spare, it's worth going.

1CjN-kfhsmQxCVUA4lXK0Q.text: Great service and food at a great price. The waitress consistently checked up on us to ensure if our meal was good. The decor instead is very nice and gives it that Italian vibe. As with any Italian place, I'm a sucker for anything with carbonara as the sauce. Only thing I wish that they could work on is keeping a steady structure. It was busy so the food came out slow and so I heard and saw customers getting upset.

KjMkdgBIL-Gy8pOMM_K3-Q.text: The bar here is beautiful. So is the restaurant. The food is very good except the portions are small and way over priced. Nice place to meet people but if I'm interested in eating I will go to Roma Deli on spring mountain for Italian food.

LrfJErXk0GVxl8xoKc0lwQ.text: I had dinner with friends who were very much impressed with the restaurant.  The food is excellent along with the service.    The issue that I had was while looking at the menu the waiter also chimed in with the "SPECIALS."     While the menu prices are neither cheap or overly expensive, the prices are listed.  Hearing special, I am thinking some great food at a lower price than normal.  WRONG.  The special match the price of the highest things on the menu and only until I received the check, did I see the price!!!  FELT LIKE A CON JOB TO ME!!! I do not want to go out for dinner and have to been on guard for this kind of service.

aC0gKdmFnQRagavsHU9HtQ.text: Deliciously Decadent!! By far one of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin!! The BEST place for delicious food, a cozy environment, and friendly welcoming staff. This is the first place I bring my family and friends when they come to town, and they have yet to disappoint. I have probably tried everything on the menu but my favorite lunchtime order is the Summerlin Salad with Salmon...and a little tiramisu for dessert of course!

YApYL3Mg1ufPYSCzYQ-Xlw.text: I love this place. My favorite is the meat lasagne which is a special and not available every day. On their regular menu I love their chicken parmesan with a Caesars salad and garlic toast. Yumm.

a0iFA4Qcy93elZT-mQhDuQ.text: I will be honest, food was awesome but the experience - not so much. It was a special night as it was my fiance's bday. I called around a few Italian eatery's and decided on Mastrioni's once they confirmed they did something special for bdays. I made sure it was notated on the reservation. During dinner he opened presents and we spoke of his bday in front of server. When server asked if we wanted dessert I replied quickly with a loud, firm yes giving server the "eye" of 'don't forget his bday'. They had acknowledged at least 6 others birthdays at tables around us. When server asked what we wanted I replied with 'it's his birthday - he gets to choose'. NOTHING. They never acknowledged. It was disappointing. I requested and followed up and they did nothing. Not sure if we will return, even when food was great!  It kind of put a damper on th evening.

_GPOxqwBMe4vLk1PWPTivA.text: I was eating out with a bunch of medical professionals (11 of us) on 05-03-2018. We all ordered our meals and some of our meals came with pasta. Mine did so when a server put the pasta in front of me I started to eat it. I was halfway through the pasta when a server told me that I had the wrong meal so he took my plate and threw the food away!!! I told the server that I did nothing wrong. I simply ate the food that was put in front of me. The server just looked at me all pissed off and said "whatever" As a result, I then asked for the manager of the restaurant. It ends up that the jerk that took my food was the manager!!! Wowza. So the jerk that screwed up the food and then took out his frustration on me was the manager of this place. I will never never never go back to this place. The manager is awful. Go somewhere else people.

8-i58DHMimaS3Lv0PCnHCw.text: I'm not going to lie: based on the service, early on I believed I'd be giving this place 1 star. Our server, whose name we didn't catch because he never shared it, was seemingly less than concerned with our experience. However, the food was surprisingly exceptional. My husband and I each ordered specials: the ribeye and the osso bucco. They were delicious! The only thing not delicious was our server who would ask us if we needed anything and then not bring it, despite the fact that the place was only half full. Food = excellent. Service = needs vast improvement.

1diINKYmdpeLWoeQsbKHnA.text: Amazing food, great service and nice atmosphere. We have been to Mastrionis about a dozen times and have never had a bad experience. The food is delicious, comes out hot. We enjoy it so much it's a monthly dinner spot for us.

rn_YCopMVdMi1N0lqzF89g.text: A good friend had brought me here for dinner & I was superbly impressed by the dinner & service.  Nice assortment of wine & lot of choices for entree. Dessert was mediocre, but I'd definitely go back again.

W8ucjnpkecbyVSrsUHvZ-A.text: Service was great! We had crab cocktail it was good but not enough crab . Also had the meatballs and they were amazing and big . I had the lemon and capers with sea bass . And it was one of the best dishes I have ever had !

al63ZuELLmVaRkU74nSfww.text: Amazing experience. Food was wonderful and great service. Jered the server assistant was absolutely so amazing and helpful he was definitely on top of it. What shocked me the most was how he know about every bottle of wine on our table. Very educated for his age! Will be back.

Wn1tLskTMKyCYSvGQ57vNg.text: Seafood is the name of the game here at Mastrioni's. We dined here for lunch during a work lunch and I made reservations ahead of time. We arrived early and there was no wait but the restaurant filled up quickly.   Despite arriving before the crowd we were a little disappointed to get very little attention there at first. Drinks, menus and bread were slow to come.  Once we got the attention of our waiter it was still slow to get appetizers and entrees ordered but we were happy to indulge in bread as we waited.  Our entire table ordered fish dishes. I went with the halibut piccata and we shared the bruschetta as an appetizer. The bruschetta had a huge amount of tomato. It was delicious. The fish was well prepared. I enjoyed everything about my meal.   The service was lackluster but I am still excited to come back and try them again.

DMA5ObC8BkkGmBY9tUWWvQ.text: We entered the restaurant and were impressed with the ambience and the decor the server was polite and rattle off the menu verbatim and everything started out well, after that nothing went well... we asked for butter, we never got it.. we asked the cheese,  we never got it... we ask for bread,  we never got it... we were never given an opportunity to have glasses refilled and we did not appreciate the lack of attention by the server...we constantly had to flag somebody down to get whatever we needed including sugar for my coffee, the restaurant itself is very nice and high-end however our server (John) was less than attentive and lack of professionalism.

DmYNiEYzs9hmaBSNJXfxxg.text: John is a amazing! Treated with such care, he made sure for my birthday I got the lasagna which is out of this WORLD good. Handmade from scratch. PS not usually a pasta fan and this is extraordinary. Thank you John for making my birthday so special!

0bkA05yren667Jy7qZ8KuA.text: Excellent Italian food. We were able to get in without a reservation. Bread was warm and fresh with a high quality olive oil and balsamic vinegar. One of us had the spaghetti with meatballs, the other the baked ziti. Both dishes were amazing! Meatballs were huge and well seasoned. Spaghetti and sauce were hot and tasty. Lots of delicious cheese on the ziti. Portions were very large; I took a box home. Service was excellent! We'll be back!  May 2017 Update:  We tried here again and unfortunately, not a great experience. Biggest issue was LONG wait for food and mediocre service. Downgrading to three stars; maybe short-staffed tonight. Food was still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked ziti, excellent!

G4ZSBDwdNTIdJsMyFyiK5w.text: Love this little hole-in-the-wall restaurant.  Once you walk in you are embraced with a comfortable yet sophisticated atmosphere.  The food and service are very good.  I am new to the area and checking out numerous restaurants but will definitely go back!

ZTfj2wtJZaqcZXuO1H0Z3w.text: One of my favorite off the strip hotspots. I actually prefer this over the restaurants on the strip. If I'm ever craving Italian food this is the only place I'll go besides my family's own delicious homemade Italian.. Chicken parmigiana is a MUST try. Pete and his staff never fail to please me and my guests. I wish I could remember my favorite servers name... He's Turkish and has been working there for years, one of the best servers I've ever had. I will remain a happy, returning customer because the food remains amazing and the service is excellent.

ypBZm2LxKofzJKC03Xv47A.text: We were hoping to find a great Italian restaurant in Vegas, one well off the strip where the locals go. And man, did we ever find a gem! About 15 minutes from The Palms, Mastrioni's was every bit as good as any Italian Restaurant in New York. Seriously, I don't say that lightly! Our server was awesome, and the food was top-notch. The Shrimp Francese was billed as the best in Vegas, and it really was. The place was so good, we went back 2 days later for lunch.  We're not easy to please when it comes to Italian Restaurants, but we'll never do Vegas again without dinner at Mastrioini's. Don't take my word for it, see for yourself!!

vYgWp7aTTAqUSNSTGzkoEQ.text: There are 2 reasons why this place is getting 3 Stars from me. Reason number one is that i actually never physically ate inside the restaurant. I usually just order for pick up & eat it at home. So i can't really give it a full rating until i actually sit in and dine. I love their food. Their Ziti, meatballs & raviolis are good. My husband enjoys their steaks also. Now the second reason why they got 3 stars from me is because of customer service over the phone. About 90% of the time when i ordered i get the same girl on the phone. I don't know her name, but she sounds like she does not want to be there. If you ask her a question it seems like you're bothering her and she responds back with a bit of an attitude. She also tries to rush you off the phone. I will try to visit this restaurant in the near future and actually dine in so that i can update the review. Hopefully the service in person is a whole lot better.

bt22wev1pHTEpGArFqZUBA.text: Amazing Food!!! Service was top notch, prices are spot on, atmosphere was real nice... I can go on and on but just do yourself a favor and stop by. You will not be disappointed.

J_wfsc8nNB99F4Cc-p-q_w.text: Great Service and great food. Priced accordingly. We've never had a bad meal here. My wife had the seafood linguine and she is picky when I comes to pasta so it passed her test. The bouillabaisse is awesome as well with plenty of spice. The cream puffs are quite tasty too.

VTdd3FVuOV0dZDBoB4BvaA.text: My friend chose Mastrioni's for her birthday celebration.  What a rotten dining experience!  It was like a newly opened restaurant where the staff doesn't know the menu or specials and don't know their job duties.  After ordering, we realized we hadn't heard the daily specials and had to ask.  We ordered drinks at the same time but my two friends got their iced tea and I had to wait for water.  They brought two of our meals and it took another 10 minutes for the third one to be delivered.  My ravioli was boring.  The ricotta cheese was like eating it straight from the carton and the sauce was bland.  It was merely palatable.  The birthday girl's meal was not what she wanted so we sent it back to be recooked.  Most restaurants would tell the cook staff it was a refire so it would be a priority, not Mastrioni's.  We were done with our meals and her's still hadn't come.  We had to ask several times for a status.  Also, a waiter refilled one iced tea but failed to refill the second one, left the table to get more water for me and it took 15 minutes for a refill.  We asked him for the iced tea and he went to get it.  When he came back he forgot the water but asked my friend if he could take her empty plate and she said yes.  He reached for the plate and we asked about the birthday girl's meal, he said he would check on it and left the table with the empty plate still on the table. The we saw him breaking down a dirty table without a status on my friend's food. The birthday girl had to get up and go over to him because he never came back with a status. The birthday girl discussed all  of this with the manager and we never saw the manager again. Mastrioni's was a disorganized mess!

q8LJGf6yEXMzYL-z4TcH5w.text: Consistently fantastic food and service!  The chilled seafood salad is to die for and the bouillabaisse is as good as it gets!  We are definitely regulars!  Upscale casual dining filled with locals.  Well mannered kids are fine here but this isn't Olive Garden or Chucky Cheese.

tXAeXaQleyTITMMJljsM_w.text: Huge fan of the food & the wait staff.  The management needs a lesson in customer service.   Service was awesome...A+.  someone was always available to clear away, refresh drinks, serve, offer condiments or check on us in general.    The food was also spectacular.  Didn't care for the desserts, so only an A.   We split a salad (they kindly plated it in the back so no embarrassing scooping of food at the table!) and there wasn't a green morsel left. My husband loves spaghetti & meatballs and theirs didn't disappoint!  I had the scallops & they were delish!!   Like I said, desserts didn't wow either of us.    I wanted to briefly speak to the manager on duty about hosting a dinner for 45 people every quarter, but she was too busy to speak to me (no lie...that's what they told me) & the waiter brought some copies of menus with a handwritten name of who to call.  My husband said he'd like for the waiter to mention to the manager that we'd really like to speak to her very briefly...less than 2 minutes (to compliment the staff...we decided not to hassle her w/ the large party conversation).  The waiter came back & told us she said it could be a while...like 20-25 minutes or more.  I was speechless.  Granted they were busy, but what manager on duty doesn't have time for a customer....especially one wanting to give more business &/or compliment the wait staff.  Left w/ a very icky feeling & decided it was not a place I would entrust to do my quarterly employee awards dinner.  Their loss...there are tons of restaurants in LVNV w/ good food, good wait staff AND good managers!!

0nKudXdWbNVQgj2F0pIIfQ.text: This is a long over due review. My family is from Italy. This is the best Italian food! I never eat meatballs out because I'm always disappointed, Mastrioni's are the real deal! Tender,flavorful and cooked to perfection. Their seafood pasta is amazing....tender clams, mussels and calamari. Shrimp and scallops cooked perfectly.  Great harmony of flavor. The eggplant parm is the best in town! The atmosphere is inviting and the service was excellent ! I always look forward to dinner there and I'm happy when I leave!

nQFQuLFembPRdu_-kjRFGA.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant on the Westside. It has Strip pricing. You will see some of the city's notable personalities here. Semi-casual dress. Don't go in jeans unless you drive a Maybach, wear a mortgage on your wrist and face is on tv.

PjMFNy9cHAQcLt-gQWrgNA.text: Chef Pete and Xilan make you feel like you just walked into your mom's kitchen.    Not an extensive wine list but an adequate one.   The specials are always fresh and diverse.  Tonight they had fresh oysters from Virginia..We were pleasantly surprised of their size and taste.   If you come to las Vegas and want a very special spot off the strip come here.  Added bonus..Come after sunset and the elevated views of the strip are unforgettable.

11QAvmSJXPD6aEqM1qnGvQ.text: STEAMERS.. Good stuff. The Clams that is very good stuff. Oh yeah, tomato soup is pretty good too, but just get a cup not the bowl, very rich and filling.  Salmon Salad is good too !!

_7k97VvZjk8ae95meXiQLg.text: It is obvious why this restaurant is so highly rated and popular with the locals.........quality and excellent recipes.  The grilled veggie plate was perfect, the veggies were all still warm, and the garlic marinated peppers were so good.  The seafood salad was traditional and incredibly well cooked....meaning the squid/prawns/scallops were barely cooked thru so they stayed tender. Dressing was perfect balance of evoo and lemon with lots of micro-greens/celery/capers. It was a very large order enough for 4 to share as an appetizer.  The spaghetti bolognese was excellent, as good as I have had in a long time. I am an Italian chef and make this dish several ways and generally don't think much of most bolognese sauce in most restaurants because it is just not that great....often good but not great. This sauce neared perfection. What was amazing was they split it for us and came out with two large pasta bowls filled. The order was huge, great value for sure.  Our waiter Vince was excellent, so friendly and enjoyed talking cucina italiano well after they closed. Kudos to such good service.  We will be back.

FLsh0psz8AUV99IxTmq7Cg.text: Great food, good service, comfortable atmosphere.  An excellent experience on a Tuesday night in Las Vegas.

3ARAmTS862mGk-jLVugRmA.text: Attentive, good proportions, friendly staff, good food.  Leave the gun,  take the canolli..........

Ws8ZrZTAoCn76OBs4GnugA.text: Kurt was the best service we have had in a long time!  His recommendations did not steer us wrong.  The Sea Bass piccata is what we come back for time and time again!  Our new favorite spot!!

xKD5tWzI7RAzzyylVel3DA.text: If you're a garlic lover, go for the roasted garlic app.  $6 and ya get a whole bowl of roasted cloves and plenty of bread to spread it on.  Crab cocktail is nice lump meat.  Cocktail sauce pretty bland but, they'll give ya extra.  Shrimp cocktail nice too ... large (U15 ct) and well prepped ... not at all soft.  Have had fish 3x, and always enjoyed it. Recently tried seafood fra diavalo ... not on menu ... which was wery good.  Nice and spicy, and the seafood was added at the right time during the cooking process to insure product integrity.  Will go back again & again.

wSnwns48NTBBD5NWQapapA.text: This is not just italian.  Their seafood is superb.  I had the salmon picatta (heavenly), and my wife had their grilled halibut.  My wife's quote, "It was the best halibut I've ever had."  You cannot do better.

dIT1EW9F210fwbJgSVr_Kg.text: After hearing so many great things about this place, we finally made it for an early lunch. We were the first guests in the restaurant and the only table being serviced by our waiter. Outside of the over dressed caesar salad and the burnt garlic bread ( we did not complain), the food was very good. The calamari was hot and crispy and tender, the veal and eggplant parms did not diappoint and the grouper picatta was delicious. What spoiled the experience for us was our waiter. Even though we were his only table for most of our lunch, he seemed hell bent on ignoring us. It got even worse when he picked up another table of two. I would return for the food and hope that our poor service was a singular occurance.

Rwr6Dx9PKQxV6xvb35bUKA.text: The eggplant parm is fantastic. The service is inconsistent. The owner is always around and a great guy.

72tuXqGqoc0xlK7Hz2vZCA.text: This place is beautiful on the inside and just as delicious as the decor. The salmon is the best I've had in Vegas. Service is perfection, ask for Kurt! Yoda enjoyed his visit immensely.

2VY1xT6qLO89jrmTnBayIg.text: Oh the pasta here is definitely one of the bests in town by far! Great portions their huge! Very friendly staff and service was wonderful. Couldn't ask for more!

zZ-QD7vHIyd0jr1TbIgcwA.text: Never have had a bad experience here.  I enjoy sitting at the bar with my friends and chatting it up with the staff.  Everyone is super friendly and they remember your name!  Pete the owner... Sweet and kind. He gets excited to share his food and at times gives out chef samples. Nothing like a chain...smaller place and cozy.  I love how all the server staff is all males! Love love love that!  The food is full of flavor... I recommend shrimp scampi and lobster ravioli. Both amazing! Appetizer sizes enough for a meal. Pretty good wine selection and they always serve bread.  Give this place a try...you'll be back for more!
