-9Ag3NO3uaMGkJVwTvDhZQ.text: I ordered the Sea Bass Piccata, the best I've had, our waiter Kurt was amazing and delivered an enjoyable prompt dinner. Must go!

GW5vxWfZv-gNqiVfB9ni3A.text: I have been meaning to leave this review for a few days now and am just not finding time for it so unfortunately our server's name has slipped my mind. However, he (I believe his name may have been Austin but he had tattoos and was new) did a fantastic job! We were surprised to hear he is fairly new due to his menu knowledge and the food recommendations he provided. Hubby and I ordered a bottle of wine, he did chicken piccata that he raves about and I ordered the lobster ravioli. Everything was fantastic. The ambience was exactly what we look for in a date night and at no point during our coffee or dessert (cream puffs are amazing!) did we feel rushed at all. Bravo to the training team, the chefs and management. We will be back!

j-n4lqi-AC7EzYUWSqOENg.text: Ambiance, food and service overall good but food is terribly overpriced- $17 for fried calamarie appetizer and $20 for a small dish of chicken parm- bread terrible for an Italian restaurant- pasta is overcooked and clams are not fresh probably from a can- reluctant to go back.

1P-iqRxDR9bcdM6Pff5eRA.text: Mastrionis is without a doubt, one of the best and most hidden gems in all of Las Vegas, especially for Italian food. My wife and I have been coming here for special occasions including wedding anniversaries.  This place is easy to drive by, as its smack dab in the middle of a little row of businesses and could easily be overlooked like a typical deli or subway from the outside, and it's tinted windows make it difficult to see inside.  Once inside however, this place is very classy. It's well lit with a well dressed and well mannered staff.  The first time we went, for appetizers my wife ordered the bruschetta which was incredibly flavorful and obviously prepared fresh.  She insist it's some of the best she has had. I myself took the opportunity to order the crab cakes, which I am always hesitant to do as most places typically delivery small cakes that are not worth it. At mastrionis however, the crab cakes I got were large in size and full of flavor, a must have for any fan of crab cakes.  In addition to this the restaurant also serves bread with olive oil and balsamic which is just a great way to start your meal.  For dinner we again tried something different, I myself ordered the fettuccini Alfredo and added the shrimp to it.  The pasta had a rich creamy flavor with a thick sauce that can never be accused of being watered down. The shrimp were big and fresh and added that seafood taste to my dish that I was craving.  My wife ordered the Parmesan chicken, which was also large in size and fantastic tasting. You could actually taste the seasoning and flavor in the chicken instead of just a mouth full of bread. The dish also came with a side of pasta with a home made marinara sauce that was just outstanding.    Pros: a very romantic atmosphere for a date but also very family friendly. It's got a darker interior which I personally enjoy. Outstanding food, some of the very best I have had in Vegas or California. After eating here you'll likely never step foot into a chain like Olive Garden again.  This place also has generous portions on the plates and appetizers we have tried here.  Cons: Pricing. A dinner salad will run $10 which despite excellent flavor seems a little steep.  Adding shrimp to my pasta was about $4 I believe which felt a little high considering the amount they give.  This alone was the only thing preventing 5 stars.  When we went the first time we ordered two appetizers, tow salad, two meals and two drinks which ran us $100+. Salads should not be more than $5 and a few of the appetizers should be a couple bucks less.

r-_1MDGYO3ISl187XGqVhA.text: This place is off the charts!!! The food is sensational!! Our waiter Kurt is the best waiter I have ever had and I have had many fine dining experiences.

y8UX-rrJTInTWiYdEwcDMA.text: BEST Italian in Las Vegas.  The food is made fresh to order love sitting and watching them make each item at the food bar.  The food is ridiculous.  Beautiful restaurant but not over the top.  You can go in jeans but if you're headed out in a cute dress you won't be out of place.  Must tries - lobster ravioli, clams oreganato, eggplant parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs, and so much more.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The eggplant parm here is amazing. I always want to try something new but can&#39;t miss the chance to have the eggplant.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These clams. Ridiculous. The best part is sopping up the sauce with their bread.

6nD5Ox9SIXzNo4lUE4t1kQ.text: Very solid Italian establishment in the summerlin area. My family and I have been coming here for quite some time now. We almost always get the steamed little neck clams in the white seafood broth, seafood risotto(no longer on menu, but the chef will make it if you ask), veal oso buco, and occasionally the rib eye.   Overall, a great restaurant that I always come back to.
