DomDznC7KrhwfolNi0Sk8g.text: We have been here multiple times and always have a great experience! Last 2 times my husband and I have been here, Kurt has been our waiter and has recommended all amazing things. We will continue to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Partially eaten. Shrimp scampi appetizer 4.5/5! Delicious!! The sauce is perfect for dipping the bread in.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs with Bolognese sauce (spicy). 5/5!!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass Bruschetta 5/5. Perfectly flavored and perfectly cooked!

ho7eLUCpWr_495S3C3N_KA.text: So glad we happened to see this place on Yelp! Amazing service! The lobster ravioli was absolutely fantastic! Husband had the Chicken Parmesan and said its the best he's ever had.

EMJ447IgnWvkMp6XlILHqA.text: My boyfriend took me here for date night and I am so happy he did.  The service was fantastic.  Kurt, our waiter, described the specials to us before we ordered our bottle of Hangtime Pinot Noir.  Kurt made everything sound delicious! We chose the grilled calamari special with veggies; that was amazing! It was so tender! My boyfriend wanted the veal chop but they had just ran out (hence the 4 stars) so he went with the veal Marsala and that was delicious.  I had the seafood linguini combo (mussels, clams, scallops, jumbo shrimp).. Very tasty and it didn't taste like the ocean (salty). We ended our meal with their homemade creme brulee and a McCallan liquor. I definitely recommend this spot.  Great food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled calamari special

CL-FIv7OTx1ww5kRx8KAvw.text: Had high expectations for this place, but left really bummed out.   My family and I initially were set on another Italian place, but we left since the hostess said it would be a 45 to an hour wait without a reservation. Since we already had our hearts set on Italian food, we decided to go to mastrioni's since it seemed to have good reviews. We got there and , to our delight, were seated immediately. Service was prompt and decent, but the food was realllllly blah.   For starters we had the combo oreganate. It had baked scallops, shrimp, mussels, and clams stuffed with breaking. It was okay at best. The sauce was bland, and the whole thing just lacked flavor. My son and I shared the chicken fettuccini Alfredo, and my husband had the lobster ravioli. The lobster ravioli was quite good-- sauce was light yet creamy, and there was a substantial amount of lobster in the dish (albeit a little overdone). Now the chicken Alfredo was an entirely different story. The pasta tasted like the dried pasta you get from the supermarket, and the sauce was no different. Seriously, it tasted just like canned/jar sauce! The chicken pieces did not have any seasoning and was very rubbery, and overall was just very unpleasant to eat. I normally scarf down my food and very rarely leave left overs, but I even surprised myself with how reluctant I was to take more than 5 bites of this dish. I feel like the taste of the food we ordered did not justify how much we had to pay for our meal.   Who knows, maybe Alfredo just isn't their specialty, or maybe the chef was a just bit light handed with the seasoning tonight. Since it is an Italian and seafood place, maybe they just specialize more on the seafood, and not so much the pasta. Many thoughts come to mind as to why our experience was less than stellar, but will give them the benefit of the doubt for now.

-Zr5D4zmPbog8kmM84vb-g.text: First off, Italian food is probably my favorite type of meal to eat 5 days out of the week!! A buddy of mine that's Italian and from New York told me that this was the place to eat some real Italian food so of course knowing where he is from I took his word for it. Definitely delicious and we'll worth the cost. We had the shrimp cocktail, beef carpaccio, spaghetti and meatballs and the rigatoni pasta with meat sauce, and cheese cake of course.   I tried everything we ordered and loved everything but the beef carpaccio. The shrimp were fresh and huge, loved the horseradish it came with. The beef carpaccio was Ok,  I have had better. The spaghetti and meatballs and that was awesome, the meatballs were tender and juicy.  I absolutely loved my rigatoni pasta though, it was full of flavor and the portion size was huge!! The cheesecake is made in house and was amazing!   I have never had authentic Italian food that i know of (lol) but i wohld think that this was because of how fantastic it was!! Service was excellent and fast!! Definitely one of my new favorite spots!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

ngBtySIWnr_9RoXLu5OOSA.text: This is such an Italian establishment for us. We celebrate birthdays and many special events here, and have created many happy memories here! The linguine and clams (mix of chopped and whole) are the best. I haven't been able to order anything else in the 6 years we have been dining there... grilled veggie appetizer is a favorite too. As others weather cools, there is nothing like a hearty Italian feast!!!!

q0nXFv8G_pJvZSndI_qE3Q.text: Very good place  Appetizers are little overpriced ( its why only 4 stars) but very good food

xP2BQx5E3NUwj4aM7kEytQ.text: So I've been going to Mastrioni's since I was in high school and can honestly say I've never had a bad experience or meal. However, tonight when I went their with my gf for the first time we were treated to an amazing evening; in part thanks to our awesome server Kurt. From suggestions to our appetizer selections, wine, and entrees, he certainly made the evening all the more enjoyable. Great energy and fun to talk with. Everyone whose ever been here knows what you have to look forward to when you walk in the door! Tonight was made more special because Kurt was there.

zqU0nU6UApbxu4IJR7jVdA.text: Our party of three dined here last night. We started with the shrimp scampi as an appetizer along with a bottle of wine. We ordered one special (steak, lobster, mashed potatoes and deep fried brussel sprouts), halibut with vegetables and the penne chicken, mushroom and sun dried tomato dish as our main dishes. Everything was great!  Best of all though was the service!!  Dane was our waiter and he was great!

wATN2n5XBPduvnC9DBd35Q.text: Went for the first time last night with family after my Italian cousin who recently moved here from Jersey had been a few times and recommended we take our other cousin from Jersey here to enjoy her last meal before flying back east. I am a tough critic of Italian food in Vegas and can not believe I haven't heard of this place sooner. Kurt was our waiter and he was superb! I joined the table after he took everyone else's drink order and he asked what I like and recommended a great wine. Based on his personality, I trusted his judgment. He was super friendly, understood our east coast sense of humor and made great recommendations. This is the type of place where you can tell the servers love what they do, are well trained, know the menu and have experience. Or at least this is the impression Kurt left. I can't really speak for the other servers.We had 4 kids with us and he was super patient as well.   We ordered calamari and cheese salad as apps which were both delicious. Calamari tasted fresh with a crispy breading and tender inside, not chewy at all. Sauce was really good. For meals our table tried ziti, raviolis, meatballs, scallops, and I had the Linguini and clams in a white sauce. Absolutely delicious with a huge amount of clams. Most places tend to be stingy with the clams. I forced myself to eat every bite, as i did not want to waste any and bringing it home wasn't an option last night. The baked ziti was like what I'm used to back east that most Italian restaurants can't get right in Vegas. This place is the real deal. I tasted the scallops and they also tasted fresh and delicious.  I can't wait to go back and try the eggplant parm. I was reluctant to try it on my first visit, as I like a traditional fried, layered and baked and have not found a restaurant in town that does it the way they do in New York and Jersey. Kurt promised I'd like it, so I will be back to try that.  For dessert, we tried the tiramisu, cheesecake and kids had gelato. The tiramisu was on point. Tasted homemade and fresh! I don't really like cheesecake but this was excellent. Again, tasted very fresh and homemade. I failed to mention sooner, it's a very comfortable nice looking restaurant with a good atmosphere. The bar area looks very nice as well. It's a good sized place with enough room for several large tables, but small enough to feel cozy, like a neighborhood family owned restaurant.

QaFuDgGyQm4iwnpj1FaYOA.text: My wife and I were hooked after the first visit. The decor is very relaxing, the aroma embraces you as soon as you open the door.  We were bowled over by the Clams Oregenata...first that a place in Vegas had them, and second that they were so delicious!! The calamari was terrific as well.  The only reason that I gave it four stars instead of five was I felt the drinks were a bit over priced...$10 or $11 for a well vodka and soda was out of line, otherwise a great dining experience.

VT_8Gj89akYCcN5AEENa8A.text: Went here for the first time on Monday. Food was phenominal - had the grilled Sea Bass that was excellent. Well prepared with a touch of olive oil.  Dominic was our waiter/server who went well beyond the call and provided excellent explanations, service, and brillant customer attention. Well done - we shall return!

u1TgDWrLR81cupR0mWLocg.text: If you are looking for something really good in the Summerlin area then you have to make a trip to Mastrioni's. I've yet to have a bad meal there! Start with the Mastrioni's salad and you can't go wrong! Ask them to split it when you order, it's enough for two people.  An amazing salad with Gorgonzola, walnuts, pears, cranberries and vinaigrette dressing. Mussels with red sauce are excellent and I highly recommend the seafood linguine combo. The special on one visit was linguine with clams, mussels and shrimp in a red sauce. Excellent! The shrimp are huge and fresh! Service is attentive.

2b4iMUqVRDAjMBA1DubZ2A.text: Came here for a early dinner and they were expanding half the restaurant. (Business must be good). I had thought this was a cafe since i have driven by it but it turns out to be a a little more upscale than thatt. The decor is modern and trendy. They start you off with hot french bread dipped in oil and balsamic vinegar. I had the house salad which was not worth the $8 price tag. There was no meat, just field greens, tomatoes, onions and dressing. My bf had the spaghetti with meatballs which the sauce was extremely runny with no flavor. The rigatoni bolognese and theseafood pasta with vodka sauce looked like much better options.

HOsMsX4Gb3xIRvVybygCoA.text: First impression was being greeted, or should I say NOT greeted by two, (why two?) Hostesses.  They were both very unprofessional, dressed in casual, old stretched out sweaters, snobbish, did not feel welcome at all.   The server, however was great, he was fun, full of info about the food, and business of the restaurant, and very attentive.....until the end.   The place looked clean, tables were set nicely....but the food ? "Meh"  I've had better Italian at a Pizzeria.  The pasta was undercooked, the raviolis were frozen, the sauce was very bland, (canned?).  The price of the food did not match the quality at all, high priced for frozen and canned.  At the very end we were left sitting and waiting, .....and waiting for the server to come back to our table to take the check and then to return with the receipt...that process took 20 minutes all by it's self....made us feel like we were just not very important at all...Not acceptable...We will not go back, and we are sorry we spent over $80.00 for dinner for 2 there.  Our mistake.

VO665jFNg-dWOx75j6TkeQ.text: The first few times I visited Mastrioni's I thought it was a great place. The food was good, service great and the best Tiramisu in town! Then it started to fall short. The last couple times I went I was less than impressed. On my last visit our server disappeared half way through our meal and we were told by the next server that his shift had ended. Never came to let us know, thanked us, etc. just took off. Never seen anything like that before. The pasta was ok, I honestly have made better at home. I feel the food and the service both have gone downhill and I definitely won't be rushing back here again. If you want to go to a great Italian restaurant where the food and service both are consistently excellent try Parma. It's one of the best Italian restaurants in town!

YAroZFxUmNZWHzG5Wo08SA.text: Nice neighborhood place.  Been here a few times.  It's kind of hit and miss though...  Stick with the pastas!

ho3nl_AJ1OuCvYrtc-zLmw.text: Incredible Italian food. My boyfriend had the lamb and it was delicious, cooked to perfection. I had the tilapia and it was incredibly flavorful. Even my kids enjoyed it! They had the fettuccini Alfredo. We've been looking for a great Italian restaurant close to home, happy to say we've found it!

1NxtucQY1hw18Z3p6zFYig.text: I don't tend to go out and order pasta much, since I prefer to make it at home. Call me narcissistic, but my carbonara is legit. It had been over a couple years since I had ordered pasta, and on this particular day, I was really craving fetucinne alfredo.   The pasta was underwhelming for me. It lacked flavor, so I had to season it myself. And I guess it is super simple. For the price, I wasn't too stoked.   I think the salad I had was quite good...loved the dressing.  I'm not sure I'd be back here though.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mastrioni&#39;s salad. Field greens with Gorgonzola, pears, and candied walnuts in vinaigrette. 5 stars. Best part of the meal.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken- 3 stars. Okay.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti bolognese- 3 stars. Was a bit bland and lacked flavor.

yf3s93F6v92caBZwMHq4OQ.text: Always drove by this spot, since it's near my house, but never actually went in. Tried it today finally with a cousin  and it was great! Ordered veal marsala, fettuccine alfredo, tomato basil soup, two cannolis and pistachio ice cream. Everything was spot on a delicious. Will be back.

Idd6nuKHDt52LvV_u8vfIA.text: That is one giant meat ball!  The food was delicious and the service was delightful. Will definitely come back to this place.

kXc8gE7dOHm3xiy7I7jsag.text: I love this place.  A couple weeks ago, I ate here with my family and two employees. The food was so good. I had the chicken francese. It melted in the mouth. So good! This is a gem for us west-siders.

3OgmzCrMqtntpxGiesjYwA.text: Wow !!! What a hidden gem is this place. We when here with my fiancee for our one year anniversary. I didn't expect to be as good as the review said they would be. But it delivery greatness in our meal.  I forgot to try their garlic knots, but will most definitely become a regular. Reminds me of a nice joint I used to go to in Hollywood California. Anyway. This is what I had.  We started with shrimp scampi the shrimp was jumbo shrimp. It was hugeee ( trump voice ). Very savory. Followed by bruschetta and end with our entree she had grill salmon with spinach and I had chicken penne spinach with pink sauce which I think that's they're home made sauce. I can't wait to go again and try other appetizer and entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grill salmon with spinach

vAiGyfdHxsi-7dh47KxOkg.text: Been a few years since I've been by, but they're going strong. Busy Saturday night was bustling and very nice. The kitchen does seem to take awhile - so try not to fill up on bread, lol.   Caesar salad pretty good. The bits of anchovy are optional, and ideally, I like to be entrusted with the whole fish. Still, it's better with than without.   The tomato basil soup is good and very rich. I like it, though I think it sets the tone for a heavier meal.  The pasta fagioli wins a less-complicated endorsement.   Entrees: I tried and loved a mushroom risotto with bay scallops. Crimini and more mushrooms were good, not overwhelming at all. The risotto was perfectly cooked (though not very hot temperature-wise), and the scallops were delicious. Orbs of oceaniac joy are beached atop the risotto.  Desserts: Let's definitely talk cannoli. Hard shell, good crunch with perfect ricotta filling and stuffed with chocolate almost-chips. Better than chips.  Party also had and enjoyed the tiramisu, but I was otherwise engaged, and will simply have to take their word for it.  Hats off to the servers, who do a great job. Loved that the Front Waiter steered me in the direction of a wine I wanted -- not the one he might have necessarily wanted to sell. Cheapest of the Sauvignon Blanc, and it was delicious (Sea Glass from Santa Barbara).  Call ahead for the busier nights and times, if this recent Saturday night is any indication.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Risotto with Bay Scallops

U4s9aXzQczHY9AnYSqa_Xw.text: This place was recommended by my husbands coworker and what a treat the food was delicious, service was great. My husband got the lamb special and I chose the chicken Marsala.   The only thing that is not their fault is the parking sucks.   We will return for another delicious meal.

L40YO_8adFbLRsu-ITh2eQ.text: This hidden gem is amazing, they have a great friendly staff, and the most delicious lobster raviolis I've ever had. They offer a great lunch menu as well as a great selection of wine for dinner.

AT805VKtjhQTSxadtHS67g.text: Best service and consistently amazing food:) Make sure you try the cheesecake , homemade recipe!!!

0v5LkGft3ermmdAoqiU8pw.text: We have been going here for years. Food is always great as is the service. Last night I was a little disappointed. Not because of the food because it was great. We decided to bring our own bottle of wine and we were charged a $35 corkage fee. Don't get me wrong, I understand they are in the business to sell there own wine. But, we literally have been to this restaurant 100 times and purchased over 100 bottles of wine and this one time I bring my own I get charged $35 to open it? I will go back 100 more times but I won't bring wine.

ljJ20tE7LlsuVkT3MUIjzg.text: Can't say enough good things about Mastrioni's.  EXCELLENT food.  My current favorite is the Salmon Bruchetta.  Hard to believe that You can find a fish dish this good hundreds of miles from its' waters.  Better than higher dollar "gourmet rooms" down on the Strip.  Thank you Peter Mastrioni for bringing your excellent establishment to Summerlin!

9BeI3mDFo7sxMDtVMA5T6A.text: Consistently great. Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys excellent Italian food coupled with great service.

pZYtrXF5rAcXiDhktDnk1Q.text: So happy we found this restaurant. This is the ONLY outstanding Italian restaurant that I know of in Las Vegas that .......  1. is open for lunch Monday through Friday 2. has outstanding service 3. has FRESH seafood 4. has a beautiful decor with appropriate music 5. has a wide variety menu that is very reasonably priced  And of course, excellently prepared authentic Italian Cuisine

lq5TNWgdQAhgFQvd-DgOxw.text: This place is in an interesting location but one of the best dinners I've had in Vegas. We ordered the house made clam chowder for appetizer which was one of the best We have had. My boyfriend ordered the clam linguine which was amazing and the chef doesn't skimp on the clams at all! I ordered the halibut which came out so flavorful and fresh along with perfectly seasoned broccoli and the waiter was great with giving me more options for my side. Service is great, atmosphere is cozy/fancy and not too intimidating but still gives you a nice date night feel. Will DEFINITELY be returning and I have a feeling this will be our new go to for delicious good!

eGGdE28stgWDXr0yXSJnHg.text: I celebrated my birthday here in fine fashion.  I had the cioppino and my boyfriend had the lasagna and both were great. The wine selection was good, as well.  The service was friendly and efficient. Two thumbs up!

tb6Nc8NI1u9EgwSZy_4Omw.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.   Great local Italian restaurant. High quality at an affordable price. I wouldn't necessarily say it's neighborhood pricing but the portions and quality match the price and then some. Entrees range from about $17-$25 on average with meats a little pricier. Appetizers are really expensive in the $15-$20 range but are larger, family style offerings.   We had a chicken Parmesan and a seafood penne with vodka sauce. We also had a bottle of wine for a great price and the caprese. The caprese was enormous and easily shareable - a nice starter. We ordered our entrees extra extra spicy and the chef did not disappoint. The sauces had some type of pepper that really burnt the lips - perfection. The dishes themselves were fantastic for entrees and the spice level was perfect. Props to the chef for delivering on spiciness as we hoped for.   Mastrioni's has takeout options as well as a nice dining area with a bar and a few tvs. Staff is great and alcohol prices are very fair. Open for lunch and dinner, this place is a great local Italian option in Summerlin for a meal.

cSve4uOayRvBoCMzsFulcw.text: Really enjoyed our dinner here. The service was great. Our waiter Kurt was fantastic, he would make my mouth drool as he explained the specials. He also was able to make me items that were not on the menu. Don't hesitate to ask because I think they only put half the food they offer on the menu. I looked on yelp pics first before arrived so I knew what dishes they were able to make. I had the lobster ravioli and was not on the menu. It is fantastic, beside lobster in the ravioli there are lobster chunks in the sauce. Can't wait to return here. It's a neighborhood gem. I will be requesting to sit in Kurt's section again because he the made the experience that much more better.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli yum
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side order of spaghetti marinara and one meat ball

97KF-lK0EZB9kR9usUK5ZQ.text: Nice place great service but I expected better flavors , me my wife and two daughters went for a dinner . my daughters love spaghetti's but this time they didn't like it at all the meatball was bad and so me and my wife didn't care much for the flavor maybe because it was really busy . We love Italian but we where a bit disappointed . Not going to lie I'll come here again and will give it another shot .

DCJIW1yKym6PUgS9yEzwzg.text: Grabbed dinner here when visiting Vegas. Our waiter was awesome. Super friendly, very accommodating and very attentive to our table. I wasn't very hungry so I only ordered a Caesar salad and  ordered some Parmesan risotto they had as a side for a special! I was so glad they were willing to do that for me. Everyone was very pleased with their dishes. we'll probably go back and hopefully I'll get a real dish next time!

hVKSivwZB8syxrGMCWCkog.text: I don't eat meat so I am super picky about my seafood and this place is da bomb!! We've been to Mastrioni's at least 6 times and my go to favorite is the Seabass Picatta but I also love the Eggplant Parmagiana. When we get a table or booth we always ask to sit in Kurt's section, he makes the evening super special and a real professional but it's also a treat to sit at the bar and watch all the kitchen action. Chef Shawn is a master at what he does and the Cioppino or the Boullibasse are 2 items not to be missed. Easily the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

AYH0S_f-9msVeDPzVPxX9A.text: I would give 10 Stars if I could. Nice stuff and delicious food!!! Plus a very fair price. Love it here

MTsw90AGZUWuV-vL761Xog.text: Nice clean restaurant, service was good, but food just ok, seemed like a small portion size for the price  Garlic bread was great

WJP8ymuQvT0JLMBAjMn0hA.text: It's a lovely small place; nicely decorated dim lighting for intimate dining.  The lobster ravioli was delicious -  a slight hint of mango flavor unless my taste buds fooled me.   Staff friendly and attentive.  Decent wine list.    I had a glass of Reisling. I would definitely dine there again and try other dishes. Parking is limited.  Seating is also limited - make a reservation.  There's a full bar and looked nice from where I was seated - for a bite to eat solo or meeting a friend.

xMnYi_FLktEDtts9Gg-5cA.text: I'm knocking this restaurant down a star after a few more meals here since my last posting. The latest meal here was just so-so. My Palm salad was over-dressed....drenched....in oil and whatever else was in the salad dressing.  My veal Milanese was pretty good but the side of penne with marinara was terrible. Store bought pasta, for sure, cooked to a gummy, mushy texture that no serious chef would allow out of the kitchen. Awful.   Another irritation at Mastrioni's is that when you arrive at the appointed time for your reservation...or early...or late, the hostess always, every time, says, "it will be a few minutes."  Even when the restaurant has plenty of open tables and waiters standing around looking bored.  The hostess has you wait, maybe two minutes, maybe ten, before you are seated. Why do they do this?....it's NOT something fine restaurants do. The hostess also gives off a distinctly unfriendly aura.   One other specific complaint: when I sat down at the table on my most recent visit, the bread plate had a half used Tic Tac stuck to the plate. Disgusting, only made worse when the Seater said it looked like a tooth.    Lots of diners there in shorts and t-shirts.....really diminishes what is positioned to be a fine dining establishment.  One final complaint.  Mastrioni's should allow reservations via Open Table. Calling for reservations in this day and age is old school and annoying.

GHhEjWCr9Fap1PFTf3EgTQ.text: This is another one of my favorite Italian restaurants. I wish I could remember about it more often when craving Italian. It is a little secluded but well with the trip when you discover it.

W-zndE5g6SCHgIEhollGCw.text: I love their Palm salad unfortunately it's hot or miss. Sometimes it's amazing and huge and fresh and other times the salad is wilted and slimy.

7udYVpXnpy1JEVL95XB5Sw.text: Great Italian close to home. Service has been great for the most part. Food has always been amazing. Their warm bruschetta is a favorite. Osso Buco is fantastic, just not always on the menu. Perfect date night spot.

MTfWZjB3NhY-jxWa1J7b7g.text: Have been here often but last time was about a year ago and have not gone back because food was average and cost was silly. Went back 2 weeks ago... likely won't be back. Lots of waitstaff buzzing around but busy chatting amongst themselves and not really paying attention to tables. Wine was delivered fast (yay) food was just average tasting  (chicken artichoke dish and chicken parmagian) had to ask for basil. Oye it's an Italian restaurant no?? One waiter took my knife and I could not get the attention of our waiter and ended up reaching across to another empty table and grabbing one because after 10 minutes of getting our food our waiter never showed up to ask how anything was.. Our waiter showed up near the end with the check without asking us if we wanted dessert. We ordered gelato. It was the best thing we had.

e5PPMjeJCo3Om8FeDRg4iw.text: Really good food!... Nice vibe... Definitely going to be a regular.... Prices reasonable

VrDaaWjtz20RG_YP1fmZpw.text: This place is way up there in price. Oh yeah. I am not much for Italian food, but I had the best crab legs in the world here. They were "HUGE"  So delicious. My friend is Italian and this is his favorite place. So with that said, he would know since he has traveled all over the world and has eaten at many Italian restaurants. If he rates their Italian food up there with the best then it has to be; even though I don't eat Italian Food. (I know I have to be the only one, right?)  Enjoy, but make sure you bring a whole lot of money to this one. Seriously. First class dining so you don't feel too bad going home broke.

Me9oBAy5PK3T15dwrkPl5Q.text: We love this place! Everything was so delicious. We had an array of specials, all off the menu, and each was better than the next. Can't wait to go back and try actual menu items. Yummmm

d-L-0BCFCh3zLyacOnvBFg.text: We were visiting relatives in LV and they took us there for dinner. I had the Shrimp Francoise and it was the absolute best I've ever had.  Service was great too but I can't stop telling everyone about the meal. Shrimp were Hugh. Had sauteed spinach instead of pasta. Best meal I can ever remember having.

pUE6plVBdx3-aFYvQpQlxw.text: A must if you love Italian food. Highly recommend if you come to Vegas. Chicken Marsalla was excellent.

fljDlTeC6DUqbGnIThMF4Q.text: Kurt was a blast. He's hysterical, the food was delish and if we lived here, we'd come back often!

SbeHWDrBopYxzY8zRgVB3A.text: I ordered the rigatoni bolognese, the pasta is from box and not fresh. I guess I shouldn't be surprised since it doesn't state fresh pasta anywhere. It was very disappointing. Taste worst then when I make it at home. Meat sauce was watery as well. Will not be coming back.

ARuX9IREPWkRoWFKdU56Bw.text: Kurt was an excellent waiter along with the entire staff. Everybody is friendly and it truly gives a very nice homey feel to the experience. My family and I have gone several times and have never been disappointed by anything we have ordered.

KqeLYb1dZz3rkVW-hVKKog.text: Food is OK but expensive.  They are open for lunch but again lunch menu is pricy.  Service is good.

pCSnjLqK_lMWpyZWgEL1YQ.text: I have been on a quest for two years to find a decent Italian restaurant in Vegas. On or off strip, only to be disappointed. And believe me, spending at least two weeks every year in Italy for the last twenty years, I know what I'm talking about.  I think I finally found what I was looking for. Upon arrival we were greeted by our waiter Kurt who was professional, attentive and knowledgeable. I had the linguine vongole (clams), and it was excellent. Pasta was perfectly al dente, broth had just the right amount of spice and clams were fresh. My wife had the spaghetti with meatballs. Even though not a True Italian dish, (you'll never find pasta with meat balls in Italy, unless you're in a tourist spot frequented by American tourists), the meatballs were awesome, and the sauce tasted like it was made at home. The ambience of the place is great, and we really enjoyed our lunch. Needless to say, were are going to be regulars. Can't wait to try the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with clams

ePxBBxCttR6HHNHv5LzEQQ.text: This IS the off strip Restaurant of Las Vegas. Everyone posts the pics of the Italian food which is great but it needs to be known that they have some of the best steaks known to man. Hopefully someone will beat me to posting the steak OR  the King crab legs special. Step it up weak sauces and show the rest of the menu some love with some pics!!!

6865hpq4uWD4A6jMKMV_jQ.text: Excellent meal for our anniversary. I would describe Mastrioni's as an upscale version of your typical family Italian joint. They have typical preparations like piccata and marsala with higher end ingredients like veal, salmon and seabass. They have classics like pasta and meatballs and alfredo so if you want the classics they'll have something you can sink your teeth into.  That said they have a very nice contemporary and comfortable restaurant. The night we were there we saw prom goers dressed in tuxedos and dresses as well as the well healed and well dressed crowd of Summerlin. You would feel comfortable there in slacks and a button down shirt or even nice jeans. You may feel self conscious in golf shorts and a t-shirt.  The food was tasty and there was plenty of it. We shared the crab cakes which came out in a pair and could have been an entree they were so big. They had a nice balance of lump crab and not a lot of filler.   My wife had the shrimp and scallop penne with vodka sauce. That's a creamy tomato based sauce. She loved the fact that they had taken the tail off of the shrimp. Both of us shake our heads at shrimp tail shells. Take them off restaurant people!  I had a side of fettuccine alfredo and my main course was veal marsala. The veal was tender and came in a nice sauce that wasn't too thick. There were four  large cutlets and the typical mushrooms. The alfredo was creamy and decadent with shards of fresh parmesan on top. It was well seasoned and just what I was craving.  Unlike a lot of casual Italian restaurants, Mastrioni's has a nice wine list. There are plenty of wine by the glass choices and prices are more reasonable then the strip so drink up.  We were so full we passed on desserts, but a few chocolaty gooey things went by that we might need to try on another visit!

H385wPD18aj8kOB9_jm-bw.text: So haven't been here for years so decided to try again. One of the reasons was the attitude of the staff. Well I have to say the took about two seconds as soon as I walked in.  Host "your a little early (5 minutes) and your table isn't ready" Me " there's all kinds of empty tables they are just sitting there who knows how long they will be" Host " you're right let me sit your party over here" Host a few minutes after we are all sitting and having drinks "sorry that table was reserved I need to move you over here" Us "no way we are getting stuff in the corner give us this table" Host "well ok". Note we moved over one whole table   About 20 minutes later and lots of empty tables still the party who's table that he supposed sat us at partially arrives. Less than 5 minutes later they did not like that table so they moved to another.   REALLY. WHAT THE HELL!   Sorry bad move bad service your ass should be canned.   Oh as far as the food it was good but I have had much better eggplant that didn't taste like bread and side pasta that was not rubbery

R8xdMl2jmHusi1z6stp1dQ.text: My mom and I went there the other day..I had shrimp scampi and it was delicious..my mother had halibut picatta and she said it was fantastic..service was perfect..finally a good meal

pSsNzzGCWIt9w_dAMjzM3g.text: Everything was done with precision and flavor.   Sit at the open kitchen and watch the team work.    The little details make it outstanding.   Sliced roasted garlic, perfectly cooked scallops , oysters that are not just fresh but meaty!    Calamari fried with the ideal crunch .    Defiantly a must when visiting Vegas.

shwLPuVTPwCNa4GV-EkpNQ.text: Celebrated my family's 26th wedding anniversary here tonight. Not only was the food amazing, so was the staff. So accommodating to our needs. Did whatever it takes to make sure our dining experience was nothing but amazing. I would recommend Mastrioni's to anyone that is looking for amazing food and service.  Chicken Marsala, Calamari and chocolate gelato = 5 stars.

jHTTkkjewFYHB-BwIxKnUA.text: Wow! First time at Mastrioni's. had a crazy craving for Italian at lunchtime and they totally delivered and then some. Wine (it's Friday, give me a break) was perfect, garlic bread TO DIE FOR and the Mastrioni's salad perfectly wet with balsamic. Linguini with whole clams and white wine sauce YUM! My partner had the halibut bruschetta and devoured every bite. Our service was perfect. Definitely coming back!

CXiWmOP3q3nBzJCISAgTzQ.text: The food was excellent. Our server was lukewarm but the table next to us had a great server, I heard how he was talking to the patrons, and I really wished he was our server! He sounded so excited about the food he had great suggestions I wish I would've had him as a server. The young lady who seated us gave obvious attitude when I asked if we could be moved to a different table than the one she first offered. Waiters and second waiters were helpful and attentive. At these prices I would've expected every server to be excellent as the one at the table next to us.  Ambience is very nice, however, why does every restaurant, even a really nice one like this, have to have the big screen TV with the sports on? Seriously folks, can't we take a break one night from Sports and go to have a nice drink or a nice dinner?  Back to the food, I got the shrimp fracase and my daughter got the chicken piccata. Grandson got fettuccine Alfredo off the kids menu. All very good and I'm trying to post pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So pretty
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another view, linen tablecloths, and linen napkins
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t see enough of these pictures of what the inside of these restaurants look like seating is comfortable

3kKX1eNtIdptcpJxLY1NEw.text: I was pretty excited to try something new and within five miles of my house. We had friends over and decided to order take out. My hubby was jonesing for some pasta, I thought this would be perfect! The pics and reviews on Yelp were favorable, so I thought.. So, I may have had an extensive order, but the hostess repeated everything correctly, so I thought we'd be good. I ordered two appetizers, garlic bread and crab cakes. One fettuccine Alfredo, lobster ravioli, veal Parmesan, and baked ziti.. first of all, we immediately took everything out of the bag upon our return home to find that our $20 crab cake app was missing.. I called the restaurant and the gal (Stephanie) apologized. I'm sorry, but a simple sorry doesn't cut it. I told her we'd be right back to pick it up.. My husband went inside after driving all the way back and she didn't offer anything for her mistake, not even an apology to him. He mentioned having to drive another almost 10 mile round trip back and she said he could get a free crab cake next time we dine in. Hmmmm thanks. My husband tipped this girl to simply place our food in a bag, but that couldn't even be done correctly.. So, 15-20 minutes later we get back to the house... all of the dinners are basically lukewarm by now. The garlic bread was inedible. I tried one piece and practically broke my tooth it was so overdone. The lobster ravioli was ok..it was packed kinda weird...the meat was cold and separate from the ravioli and sauce..it was also very fishy. The veal parm was pretty good, I'll give be them that.. the fettuccine Alfredo was not great..it was basically buttery noodles, not an Alfredo by any means... the baked ziti was probably the most basic yet decent dish we ordered. I may give them another chance, we do have the crab cake credit to redeem...but it won't be anytime soon...

R8jKN5nnsNNEYCf8cqYymw.text: We visited for an early lunch, service and food was delicious. Portions are just right. It's a bit overpriced but I would definitely keep this one my list of Italian places I would visit again.

iioh_q_MBXEftxB1Zifzwg.text: First time trying and I am in love! Superb cuisine!!Kurt was the best! Gave amazing descriptions on all of the food and drinks. He was very attentive and so friendly. Definitely will be back.

QYIQT-UPjZRr36LwYLwKRQ.text: The hostess was completely incompetent.  We arrived promptly for our reservation. Our dining companions were a few minutes late. There was one other party waiting to be seated. She seated that party and then everything stopped while the waiting area completely filled up. There were plenty of open tables but for some reason she wouldn't seat parties unless everyone was there. Even the full parties didn't get seated while she stared endlessly at the seating chart as if in a trance.   Except for one group that walked in and she immediately kissed them and whisked them past the huge throng to their table! Pissing everyone else off.   She assured everyone that their tables were available and being held but inexplicably wouldn't proceed with seating. Is this Outback? Even Outback is more efficient. The food was pretty good with a few missteps. Carpaccio special was excellent as was the Boston chowder. Clam pasta was gritty with the clams obviously not being cleaned thoroughly.  So sad that by time we were seated we were irritated and cranky. How could any restaurant overcome that start?

maR0xLFbjs56XzBqlaKnxg.text: Nicolas Cage sat next to us.  Good Alaskan crab legs, best ever.  Excellent chicken parm.

u0uQfFO2lyZS8oZtOQlqSA.text: Went there tonight for my birthday dinner and wasn't all that impressed unfortunately. I was really looking forward to trying the lobster ravioli and even though it's not on the regular menu they were still able to make it for me. Maybe they shouldn't have because it was such a let down to be honest. From the pictures from other people's reviews it looks so fresh and yummy with a decent amount of lobster. The tiny bit of lobster that was on mine was dry and tasteless and the portion was way too small for the price. It was also kinda bland. My boyfriend had the chicken Alfredo and his pasta was undercooked and gummy and my mom's grilled chicken was dried out. We did make a reservation since it's a Saturday and they gave us a nice table with no wait even though we were a couple mins early. Our waiter wasn't super friendly...he provided decent service though. For $100 I think we could have had a better meal and experience elsewhere so I probably won't be back.

_QBMNR4esTv3MqrTJziJew.text: Just left Mastrioni's on Sat. Oct. 8th. We love the food however, we waited an hour and twenty mins. for our food. We are regulars there. The manager on duty handled it so poorly. All he would say is sorry. He never tried to make it right. Usually a restaurant would at least comp. one of the meals or gift certificate for next visit. Terrible service. It sad that the waiter had to pay the price for the poor way the manager handled our complaint. Wayne L.

bVuRNNHgNCZo9Bp5tRt4Qg.text: Fantastic overall Dining experience!! Theee best oso bucco on Las Vegas!! Eggplant parm very very good too... Ask for waiter Justin D and make sure you get the homemade Cheesecake!! If my exwife made cheesecake like that I would have never gotten Divorced

yxLNHirMIphBthzZHemQxA.text: I had gift certificates for this place for a while and finally cashed them in! What was I waiting for ?  Hands down THE BEST Osso Bucco I have ever had.  Our waiter Justin said it would be the best according to Chef and it was!!! Perfectly cooked, seasoned almost perfect ( I would have added Kalamata Olives ) pasta that was paired with it was perfect.  Portion was on point.   Now back to the appetizer, a very fresh calamari with broccoli rabe and peppers, tomatoes and potatoes in a beautiful sauce.  I don't even eat octopus anymore because I discovered it was very intelligent so I made a conscious effort to stop eating them however I may have to eat that calamari once a month along with the osso bucco. The Tiramisu was great just a bit soggy/juicy for me but great!  This place is as good as any place on the strip for Italian food. I was so impressed went and shook the Chefs hand after meal well done. Gordon Ramsay would be proud and not have much to say except "Brilliant and clearly passionate about your restaurant"

sPg7cD7y7tGn7B8p5HmR4w.text: Just went here last night with friends and what a treat!  Food is exceptional and service was terrific!  I would highly recommend this wonderful place to anyone!

Cxhyl68QewKZvsIuPTXePg.text: Italian food is my favorite! I am always on a search for great Italian food and after all this time... I finally found one! Food was so amazing that I forgot to take pics. I finally found my linguine and clams exactly the way I love it!!! Finally finally finally someone does it right!!! Yay!!! Service was wonderful. They are on it!!! Definitely my #1 Italian spot! Can't wait to come back and try something else off the menu...

_ks1N3imb8B2lDNFwNHLoQ.text: Haven't been in for awhile but delicious pasta dishes, chicken Francese and deserts. Nice atmosphere. Great for dates and celebrations!

kKmJ7YjRRWvVV4QZTaMiIA.text: The service is great. The food is very tasty. The atmosphere is cozy. My wife and I really enjoyed everything. We will definitely be back.

B_XWySHcKYhHpVfnM1P4Fw.text: Once again an awesome experience. The quality on the food, the selection of menu options, the great service and fair price is on point with anything one could expect. Our server, John, was wonderful. Made great suggestions and treated us like valued customers. Thanks!

KHF79jNXEebqdVf6PERWfA.text: This is one of the hidden gems of Las Vegas.  Tucked away in a small strip mall.  The food is out of this world.  They always have amazing specials and they have a tremendous wine list.   The best part of this place is the staff.  5 star service at prices that won't send you to the poor house.

h2crE5DQU8SHJaWE7DZC_g.text: Not a fan, I can't even remember what we ordered. We came here for my partners birthday. I just remember that the servings were small for the price. (which is very expensive) We asked for a bread basket that was never brought to us. Probably better off making your own pasta or better yet... olive garden.

3AeRSg78AKzmZ-x4Es2J7g.text: The friends we were visiting while in Summerlin took us to Mastroni's on our first night for dinner. They come here all the time and said it's their favorite local restaurant. When we arrived, I could see why they like it so much. It's a pleasingly intimate restaurant and during dinner hours the ambiance is somewhat romantic. This is a great community place for couples and families to enjoy. I ordered the Seabass blackened. The Seabass was prepared perfectly, broiled and lightly rubbed with Cajun spices. I went with the Penne marinara as my side option, it was a little bland, but a pinch of salt made it a decent side. Everyone at my table was very happy with their meal, which would not have been complete without a few glasses of wine.  Overall, I enjoyed dining here, it was very relaxing and a perfect place to enjoy good food and conversation with friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass blackened with Penne Marinara

oSWJKkoUJghxXzeJAmCZSQ.text: This place is a cute hole in a wall fancy Italian place. The service was great. The food was good but kinda too pricey in my opinion.   Seafood linguini was nice had good pasta to seafood ratio but the portion could be larger  The corn and soft shell crab chowder was very delicious not too creamy or salty. The soft chill crab had a nice crunch/bite to it.  However it was not with the price and he portion could be larger

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab corn chowder very delicious and tasty it was the chef special! Also wished portion could be larger
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood linguini with the white wine sauce. Very tasty! Wished the portion was larger

ZoCK8XXP2dYOZIHSByywkw.text: If you're coming to eat dinner here you can't go wrong, their food is delicious and the service very good. We've been coming here for years.   If you are getting food to go make sure the waiter shows you that you got everything you ordered. Two of the last three visits I've been missing an entree and that's very frustrating. We don't live nearby so that means at least 30 min or more to drive back and have it prepared.   If you're wondering why I didn't check myself this time, there was no list of items attached to the bags and it was tight quarters at the bar. I had given the waiter a $40 tip on a to go order and surprisingly he wasn't the one who presented the 3 bags with the items in it. The gal who gave it to me had no idea what was inside and unpacking at that point would have been difficult so I trusted them. Mistake.   Bottom line, I didn't get to have dinner with my elderly parents and my family as I didn't want their food to go cold. Waiters, you have one job, please do it. The kitchen staff works their butts off there (and they don't get the tips) and does great work.   I'll go back because I really like the place but I'll be wary.

xfObxo74G0ZcX58YW8RsLw.text: Friday night date night! It was a very romantic Italian restaurant! And, there was so much art that it looked like an art museum! It got me thinking that I should paint something new very soon! We started off with the crab cakes, were pretty good. A little bit too much filling. I guess that's why they were fat and big. I had the shrimp & scallop in vodka sauce. It was pretty good but the pasta was a little too al dente for me. And then there was barely any sauce. I think if there would've been more of a creamy sauce that would've made it better. He had the Osso Buco. He said it was pretty good as well. I guess both of the entrees were pretty good but not excellent are over the top. For dessert, we had some delicious  creme brulee! That was very tasty and perfectly done. I also had 2 martinis, one LemonDrop & a very berry one! He had some wine. The drinks were strong and came right away so that part was good. Overall, it was a beautiful restaurant and the service was good, but the food... even though it was quite quite good it wasn't amazing. But, nonetheless, I would definitely give it another try in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crabcakes were pretty good but had a little too much filling. The drinks were nice and strong.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He had the osso bucco and I had the shrimp and scallops in a vodka sauce. It could have used more sauce.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crème brûlée was excellent!

47HeOrok8fnZxdbpwZZD2A.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. A good family owned restaurant. I've been a customer of theirs since their old location 18 years ago. The food NEVER disappoints. They cook the old school way like back in NY. Great service and a real pretty place. I always recommend to friends and they always tell me it was delicious.

Xvsdxr80Wgh5_oGZTjVrGg.text: Best chicken francese I have ever had in my life. Melts in your mouth, huge portion (which unfortunately I ate by myself) Great salads and soups. Excellent service. Decent prices for the size of the portions. Calm location away from the strip. I may have to book a trip just to go back. Outstanding.

PW6CM1AAB9WVHYvppeGzgw.text: I have previously reviewed this restaurant and it was complementary. After several recent visits, I have decided to re-review. In my opinion, for me, this restaurant has collapsed. I won't say it is not busy, it's is. But I am asking myself why? Convenient, a quick dinner? Probably. The food has been a disappointment the last 4x we dined there. Watery tomato sauce, blah chicken parm, blah pasta etc. etc. The waiters were not attentive and I often received the wrong order. Can you imagine? Restaurant 101. Get your orders right! Oh well, I hope things improve because just because you may be busy, that doesn't mean diners won't catch on and go elsewhere. Anyone heard of Downtown Summerlin?   Oh and you might want to try Chef Marc's Trattoria. Now that's Italian!!

zGI5buCWAxeWvEQ7nJV9ZA.text: I may have to give it another chance, but $12 For a Caesar Salad is ridiculous! And $23 for so-so eggplant parmesan and bland side of pasta is crazy.  It was not worth the $100 check.  The meatballs are frozen,  reheated and not good.  Nice atmosphere and the place was packed so I somehow missed what it's all about.  Our service was great, so no complaints there.  Stay tuned for an update and hopefully more stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M4mi43eXhHUDBOIyMs1f1Q.text: Just sat down with a to go order from here. I know first hand how some to go orders suck when you get them home.  Not from here!!  Omg! My salad is fresh and crisp with no wilted lettuce what so ever! Lots onions and tomatoes. The salad is big enough to share.  The Salmon Piccata is cooked perfectly, salmon isn't over cooked, perfect amount of lemon and capers! I just couldn't wait to start eating and I forgot to review my vegetable medley, they were perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not much left!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sk1NFTC1oTBwWmoJl8MUig.text: THIS. PLACE. IS. ACTUALLY. SO. GOOD. I was a little skeptical at first. I was going with a group of friends to this place and I wasn't really feeling like eating Italian. The wait was a little long, but I didn't mind because they gave us fresh bread with balsamic vinegar (Which was so delicious we had to get another order). I ordered the chicken parm which did not disappoint. I recommend ordering it with pasta (of course), but I made the most crucial mistake by ordering a side of spinach so I didn't have anything to eat the chicken with. I still ate it though cause it was that good. The food was so perfectly seasoned. Usually Italian restaurants are pretty salty for me, but this was so perfectly seasoned I was in heaven. I tried my friends spaghetti, and I realized at that moment that I was so jealous of her. The spaghetti was heavenly. The noodles were indescribable. The meatballs were the best part. Although they were a little more salty than the rest of the food we ordered, the flavors were such a great combination. I basically ate my friends dish for her. Anyways hope this helped!

xcYzkDe7JCFo7kqgVR1Ccg.text: I came here for a friends birthday dinner and I can't believe I haven't been here more often! Waiters are friendly, food was great, and loved the intimate atmosphere. We had separate checks, it was painless and seamless to pay. (It was group of over 20 people) It was packed and busy but worth the wait.

I4f1rgDbgDKh1rQwSYJ_Gw.text: The food here is always delicious but today for lunch the service was not.  We dine here at least 6-7 times a year.  The restaurant was very empty, I think maybe 3 other tables when we came in.  The server seemed to forget and had to be reminded to bring requested items more than one time.  Also since when is a house wine $13 a glass during lunchtime?  We usually get a bottle for dinner for $35.  Was shocked to see a $26 charge for my two very small pours of wine.  This was double the price of my lunch entree.  Hoping next time will be better.

tCx6dNSRBLTIQlTp8ZCORA.text: Not good at all. No idea where all the 5 star reviews are coming from. Got take out to see how They were before dropping a couple hundred on a family meal.  Ordered spaghetti and meatballs... No better than olive garden if even. 15 bucks or so...fine but only one meatball? And super tight on the sauce.  Bread was nothing special like everything else. It just wasn't good and it wasn't any value. If it had been good I wouldve been dissappointed. Overrated big-time.

RYA87yDwk7H_fVlBZFmk9w.text: Slow service. Tasty food, but not sure it was worth the wait. Parking is a little tough, which is so unusual in Las Vegas where we often find parking quite easy.

5moTmrAqM8Oc_OfNPc2H9Q.text: I went here for Valentine's Day. Good thing we made a reservation. Our server was Garrett, and he was fantastic. The food was so good. The dessert menu looked good, but we were full from dinner. We will definitely be back!

y1kI-ev-BO86wxewPsKR0w.text: Went here for our 21st wedding anniversary. The 2 go to dishes we ordered was the seafood linguine and lobster ravioli. Both were delicious especially the lobster ravioli. Crab cakes were crispy on the outside and lots of crab on the inside. The canolis and tiramisu were on point. The service was very attentive and welcoming. Overall excellent experience.

tE1kQF01xoy_8mosQdKXLg.text: This strip mall location Italian restaurant has some really incredible food! We came on a Sunday evening and they were busy! I was glad that I had called earlier in the day to make my reservations. We started with the Fried Calamari, it was good, not great, but was prepared well and was fresh. Our Entrees, on the other hand, were great! My husband had the Osso Bucco. This was so good! Fall of the bone tender, flavor for days with a delicious 'gravy' over linguini. My Entree was on the guidance of our waiter, Kurt. I told him I wanted spaghetti, that spaghetti is one of my favorite foods and I  was hoping their version would "wow" me. Kurt suggested I get the Spaghetti with Meatballs, substitute the marinara for the bolognese and get it spicy. He said a lot of their "regulars" order it like this....... He was right on point, one of the best spaghetti dinners I have ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Meatballs, and Bolognese Sauce
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Bucco

_ZQgpc-uGQ9kg5PWSwh_hA.text: 5 stars isn't enough, perfect small restaurant, with big portions and great quality! This restaurant is good I am definitely coming here again. Flavor was fantastic and meats were very juicy. The crab legs were pre-cut, which made it convenient! I love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Ziti

4eytKCNV8cMHBH698CURvg.text: So torn on this review and this place...2 1/2 stars.   Most of the food was delicious. The service was horrendous. It is way overpriced.   I had pasta fagioli soup. ($8) There was not one single piece of pasta in it. Hmmm...what a misnomer? Regardless, it was hot and flavorful. Hubby had linguini and clams. ($22) I had a shrimp and scallop vodka pasta. ($26) My pasta was cooked perfectly and it was nicely seasoned. Very good. My pet peeve, happens all the time, is that I had to dig my fingers into my pasta with red sauce, while wearing white, to surgically remove the tails from my shrimp. It is not appropriate. The customer should not have to do the food prep on this. Remove tails. My girlfriend ordered sea bass ($35). It was totally mushy and improperly thawed. She did say the spinach was tasty though.   Our dirty dishes sat on the table for the entire meal. We asked multiple times for bread. We never got more water. Our server never checked on us and our food. Service was poor.   The price point makes no sense for a neighborhood Italian place.   Expect tasty food but expect to pay more than it's worth. Maybe service was a fluke. The table next to us was equally as irked. They cancelled their food and were visibly upset with the server.   Needless to say, I won't return.

-IF3MIe3e7lU-FknxvvwQA.text: The grilled halibut with grilled veggies was phenomenal. Server was really great and even got a visit from the owner and chef Peter Mastrioni. Great restaurant. Great food.

hTmjdFRZILgh6hYMubX3mQ.text: This is around the corner from my postal address (so I collect my post there a lot) and en-route to my attorney. I stopped in with my kids-it looks very unassuming so I figured my toddler could eat something and my infant wouldn't be disturbing a "high class" restaurant. Well luckily she didn't!!! It is pretty classy, excellent wait staff, top notch really, amazing menu and food good enough that I broke my diet for the veal!!! Highly recommend.

2IPE7n_B0sSHXTYQ8zjIBQ.text: Wow, I entertained a small group of business associates tonight and everyone at the table was extremely happy. Mastrionis is probably one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. If you are staying at the strip jump in an UBER and make your way to Cafe Mastrionis. Sea Bass, Osso Bucco, seafood appetizer and penna vodka was off the hook. Price was very reasonable also.

d8DlEOhxJrfDGOHV16FaCA.text: Made a 5:30 reservation as it was our anniversary and we wanted to beat a Saturday night rush.  Arrived at 5:30 and were promptly seated.  Right away, we were given fresh bread and our drink order was taken.  Our waiter came right behind to state the specials, one of which I ordered which was Osso Bucco with lamb.  Our appetizers were excellent, I had a bruchetta with very thick toast while the wife had the 3 tomatoes/mozzarella plate that was so fresh it was like cream. My wife's entree was a shrimp alfredo with very fresh shrimp and perfectly cooked pasta.  My lamb was falling off the bone as it was so tender and juicy.  We were full but I had to try the creme brulee which was outstanding, again just a soft texture.  The atmosphere is light and not stuffy, plenty of staff working to handle the rush and there is a bar with several televisions which had the basketball/hockey playoffs on.  Unlike a lot of restaurants in Vegas that charge high prices, the total for our dinner including tip was only $165.00 which also included an alcoholic drink for each of us plus a glass of wine.  I also ordered a slice of cheesecake to take home for our babysitter.  There are many restaurants in Vegas but this is one not to be missed.  We will be back and wholly recommend to anyone.

vUP5ifUrrH-e2Md9o_3o5g.text: The food was so amazing. Service was the best I've had in a very long time. Or   name was Kurt. He was friendly funny. Very informative on the specials. Oh and what was on the menu. I would recommend this restaurant. To anyone I know. Definitely going to go back here.

-XVUZjuCd63Rttfz-S2HBw.text: This place is absolutely horrible, service and food.   I really really hope they pay plug on sports radio.   I had reservation and upon checking in the hostess and the manager seemed annoyed. 15 minutes after my reservation time, I went to host stand to check how much longer. It was as if I asked for their first born child. They were appalled that I even went up there. We ended up waiting half an hour for a table.  Once the server saw that we were not ordering a bottle of wine, we were ignored the rest of the night. We had to continuously ask the busser for refills and even had to ask him to fix one of our entree orders since they forgot our side of pasta.   The food tastes like it was frozen. None of the pasta is fresh. The sauce tastes like it comes from a can.

z1Blv7ILpOOie0cNZq0Vuw.text: This place is not only very good but the staff is very friendly and considerate to any of your needs. Justin was our server and out of all the experience I've had here in Vegas he was above and beyond the best server of all. May I add that their osobucco is amazing it reminded me of my childhood thank you for such a peasant experience

wlbAsD2DkVdyqJIVG47c6w.text: Just a fantastic evening.Kurt was amazing very knowledgeable about the food and a great personality the food was spectacular. My wife an I both left saying it was one of the best meals we have had congrats to the whole staff Merry Christmas.

KU6IErKXQSS4fP8QMdnSdQ.text: Best Italian food I've ever had.  Hubby had the shrimp fettucine and I had the pork tenderloin.  Both were excellent.  You can dress casual but this would be a great place for a very special dinner.  Service was great, wine was fantastic.  Love, love, love this place.

soXyZTQIFZ9O3OMTdrUSrg.text: Great food in the Summerlin area. Specials are always really good. Sit at the bar by the kitchen fun to see the action. Want Italian then this is your place.

DXh00pKVJoVRxF3Aj7tNLA.text: We sat at the bar, for a more adult experience. Ordered the bone in ribeye...it was rancid, could not finish it. So figured crap happens its a nice quiet atmosphere so I'll just stay and enjoy a 95.00 bottle of wine.  No not happening, they sat a table of about four ten year olds right behind us...AT HIGHTOP TABLES IN THE BAR AREA pretty sure that is against code.They were loud screaming and yelling, fighting. Now our entire experience was awful..My bill was 500.00. We will NOT be going back!

Q9f5TfcbRYv2y3T8YgUlkA.text: We have been going to Mastronis for the last  25 plus years, of course at different locations. Pete, who is the owner, is a great chef and has trained his staff well. The food is consistently good. Everything from shrimp cocktail to all the fresh seafood and his pasta dishes are excellent! The veal Marsala and chicken piccata are great. For desert try the fresh cream puffs, to die for!!

wZT7ve0yDXA_Huwqz9GZPA.text: Not my family's kind of restaurant. We look for good food, good portions, good price. Mastrioni's is okay food wise, but the other two points are lacking.   Service itself was fast and efficient. Almost to the point we felt rushed because they are busy and we aren't ordering a 3+ course meal. They did a great job getting us bread and water refills.   It is nice enough to do for a special dinner date night where money is no object but if it comes down to tasty expensive food to splurge on, I would go back to Lotus of Siam.

w_ZFJscg8wuooB9xwoXppg.text: This is my second review for this neighborhood restaurant.  We eat here on average once a week because the food is always really good and sometimes it's great.  Last night it was great.  I ordered the simple dish of Pasta E Fagioli soup instead of my usual rib eye or crab legs.  The flavor was fabulous and for such a simple dish, very satisfying.  I thought it was one of the best I've had in the city.  As always, the wait staff was impeccable and in spite of the chef not being present since it was his night off, the kitchen staff performed seamlessly in concert.  My husband and I enjoy the friendly neighborhood vibe combined with professional service and delicious food.  I gave it 5 stars this time because after dining here weekly for 3 years I have never had a bad dish and almost always, the food is great.  It is one of the shining stars for locals and the Summerlin restaurant scene.

SSu1qtkQbX5wbao6zJu95g.text: The food at Mastrioni is always excellent however the thing that really keeps me and my husband coming back is the exceptional service. All the staff is very detail oriented and makes sure you have the best experience possible. Kurt is one waiter who stands out and always makes our dinning the best. Kurt has a very likable personality and never lets us down. I would recommend this establishment to everyone who wants excellent food, welcoming environment and awesome service.

HUOgNrRQs6EQstzvLy5qWg.text: I wish there was an Italian restaurant as good as this in southern California. The alfredo sauce is homemade. The chicken was chopped into perfect size pieces and cooked to perfection. The pinot noir from Sonoma County has a great body and aftertaste.   I tried my girlfriend's chicken parm and realized that it was, too, probably the best I've had.   If you're near the red Rock, come to this place.

4Jhq1CB0Rl2ynYuE373P1g.text: Pretty good!  This is one of those neighborhood restaurants where the servers know practically every customer.  So it did feel like we were crashing a party.  Still, the baked clams (oreganate, whatever that means) and eggplant parmigiana were both amazing and the service was good.  And they serve red wine at the correct temperature (slightly chilled).  Amazing!  Interesting dessert options that I did not get to try.  Roasted banana gelato, for example, sounded yummy but we were just too full from the fried food.  Full liquor license but I didn't see an actual bar.  There is a bar that overlooks the kitchen but I couldn't figure out where the alcohol was coming from.  The hostess looked like she wanted to kill me in my sleep, though.  That was a little awkward.  Still, a good neighborhood joint.

RMnHUxUEdq3wnwBu-YiO0Q.text: Good service, good place to eat to get your Italian fix. I've had the chicken piccata and spaghetti with meatballs and both were great! If they had home made pasta, I would give it 5 stars. Great ambiance.. Modern interior, easy off strip location. I recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs

1babKLHzAd1nYkEGdms0TA.text: This place is right around the corner of my house and I cannot believe it took me this long to try this place!  Had my birthday dinner here and they were able to accommodate 20 people without any preset menus! (AMAZING) This place is a lovely place and has an intimate ambiance. The waiting staff was attentive and did well for such a large party. The food was delicious! I had the veal Marsala and their Marsala wine sauce was perfection. We had a few separate checks and the waiter maid it so easy and seamless for my guests! Thank you to the great staff for making my birthday dinner so memorable & fun! Will definitely be back!

8RGC6V6QJyOQd-TLWmZD2g.text: Great food and great service First time in  Recommend by a co worker  Had the seafood linguini. Very good

mzrj7MNzvnSP5HocITITdg.text: Celebrated an anniversary here last night. 5/5 would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anybody. The atmosphere was very quiet, and romantic. The music was classical, and set the tone for an overall good night. The wait staff was amazing and very sincere, one of the waiter always apologized for interrupting our dinner for simple drink refills. Our main waiter was very personable an was able to answer our questions, and make suggestions as well.  The food was delicious was served hot and fresh. We ordered just dinner, and desserts. Before we had even ordered food they brought out oil & vinegar, and warm bread. That was delicious, for our main courses we ordered chicken parmigiana, and eggplant parmigiana. The food came rather quickly, both came with a side of penne pasta and sauce, surprisingly it was quiet on a Wednesday night. Usually packed on the weekends. The eggplant was to die for, wasn't to bitter or to sweet, and very well coated in breading and cheeses. The chicken was perfectly browned and crispy around the edges, but soft and juicy inside.   Then came dessert we ordered the cannolis, and the cheesecake. The cannolis looked amazing overflowing with filling and covered in chocolate chips & chocolate sauce. The Cheesecake was absolutely amazing one of the best I've had. It was very rich, creamy, and had a hint of lemon. It usually comes with a berry puree but I ordered plain due to an allergy.   All in all it was a great night with great food. We will be back with out a doubt!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever tried
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant is bigger than it appears

yz12Lumuf-XYRRw50UJfjw.text: This place deserves five stars - period. We meet our friends here for all our celebration dinners and lunches. All the food is made from scratch from a family run restaurant. The owner is a chef who obviously loves to cook and only sources top shelf ingredients. The Osso Bucco and bone in Veal Chop are melt in ur mouth. Caesar salad with whole anchovies filets that melt like butter. Walk in and smell the butter, garlic, wine, salt...every single experience and bite is 5 star. Let me shout out John our server from NOLA, he's a foodie that recommends every dish with passion. Our dinner was exceptional again. No, seriously ask for John.  Lastly I eat KETO here with ease.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Chop Marsala
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Bucco
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Franchese

d5VtyTKVLhjDKLHCooHQtw.text: Wednesday May 8th 2019  9pm  I walk my neighborhood route from Twain and Grand Canyon and cut through the backside of the plaza around 11am.  I can't remember our waiter's name, very New York accent (we're from R.I.) but he was fast. Our drinks were full and he checked every so often on us. Even everyone else that worked there seemed like polite. I felt valued bringing our business here.  We were dressed up for our 11th anniversary and our waiter made it very special and all the other staff that stopped at our table. I went with their Chicken Parmesan, it was homemade and delicious. I honestly was surprised how reasonable pricing was for some of these amazing dishes and their special sounded amazing Lobster Ravioli.   Dessert was a hard choice I went with a Cannoli and it was awesome. I had one at dinner and boxed the second to have tomorrow they're a good size portion. It was much better the next day even. I like them on the soft side and to their defense it is homemade everyday.  Anywhere from $15-30 for entrees and desserts were $10.  Way better than any chain and right in our neighborhood. I have no choice but to come back, I'm a tiramisu snob and I'd like to try it! ;) This is much quieter during the week so I'll be back.  I'm Portuguese but happen to love Italian food growing up 5 miles from Federal Hill (West Providence, Rhode Island).

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli was $10 and good size portions.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan $20 with penne pasta

099cRAOa-8D3A0zvTJGefw.text: I came here hardcore craving pasta and left very satisfied! The interior is dark, intimate, romantic and great for a date night. My partner and I were seated and given complimentary bread with vinaigrette. For being free, the bread pretty good and was served warm.   We ordered 2 pastas and 1 entree. The veal parmigiana came with 3 breaded pieces of veal with melted cheese on top and covered with tomato sauce. I feel like as an entree by itself, this would not fill me up since the pieces of veal are pretty thin.   The Fettuccini Alfredo was pretty good. The sauce was standard to other Alfredo's I've had, but it definitely lacked some acidity, pepper, or brightness and was just a bit too creamy and one dimensional for me. I actually added the veal parmigiana to this dish which made it so much better. I did really like the al dente way the pasta was made.   The Penne Chicken Mushroom and Sun Dried Tomato was my Absolute Favorite of the night!! Not only was the sauce super delicious, well balanced (some creamy/acidity), but it came with a larger sized portion that was much more filling as an entree especially with the generous amount of chicken it came with. The sauce was so yummy I kept making comments about it. All in all, everything was delish and the service was 5 stars!

FY0HJKOnsBLw1JLOcwsKLw.text: Went for lunch, hostess rude, set a table, 10 minutes no one came by, left, won't be back. First impression.

5inaQv1a_U5-Au67IUvF_w.text: Best chicken marsala in the world. Sit at the bar if you want to see the kitchen in action. Great food, great service.

EOr77qJgrNEMhX7SLEq2Og.text: Great service, nice ambiance, delicious food and perfect portions! 5/5 would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli 5/5

V8lledXgvgAc3ikixmkzrQ.text: Not sure how I have only been to this place once. Called on a Saturday night and they had a reservation, no problem. The hostess was very nice. We got there a little early and still seated us.  It was very busy but the service was great. The waiter came right over and got us started on our wine. We ordered the Caprese salad and the salad came right out. It was huge and since I am allergic to peppers they added extra tomato, very nice.  The bf ordered the seafood special pasta and I ordered the John Dory. The food came out pretty quickly and the portions were huge. The John Dory was so delicious. It came with sun dried tomatoes, artichokes and a side of spinach. I also ordered a side of pasta and that was also very good. The seafood special was insane. It had so much seafood on top. Tons of scallops, 2 lobster tails, mussels, shrimp. They were not stingy with the seafood. There was so much, he took it home and had it again for lunch.  The dessert menu looked amazing but we were so full from dinner. We will def. be going back to Mastrioni's for dinner again.

ZRg2vibVEC47TBji5HYJ8A.text: I hate to give poor reviews but this place was a horrid nightmare of incompetence, bad service and lousy food . The waiter was a giant ignoramus who did not understand how to set a table properly and I was missing a knife and took 15 min to get a new one . They screwed up my salad and it tasted like it was lying in the bottom of a dirty, filthy sink for 2 weeks .  The peon served the main course for one couple and not the other. lol   had to wait 10 min for our main course .  Then my food was beyond horrid that I could not finish it . I had far better food at an airport in the Midwest that this filthy , dirty food that is not suited for a horse    Never going back again and neither should you !!!

Lq9PGx9FNJduVsrCaLM5FA.text: There aren't enough amazing things I can say about this place, the atmosphere is nice and romantic, service was extremely efficient and professional.  The quality, freshness and flavor of the food was excellent, I'm a big fan of Cioppino and this was made just right! I'm in love, I'll be back in heartbeat!

GF4jhKdr1GH7q7mnfarY2g.text: One of the best authentic Italian food in town. My husband and I ordered from their specials. I had rack if lamb and my husband ordered their veal shank. Both are so delicious and huge. We  ended up taking some home. The restaurant's ambiance was okay. It's nothing special. Peoe were both dressed up and down. I don't know why the price on Yelp was $$ it should rather be $$$. My dish cost $65, my husband's$45. Obviously, specials cost more and I get that but  still everything on the menu ranges from $20 and above. But a really good food and experience, will come back soon.

-AYO3rCrhtQ3AcSqrTbwIw.text: Our waiter Austin advised us to share our salad since we both wanted the sauteed spinach and I also wanted the penne pasta with my entree. He was right. The delicious mixed greens were plenty to share. The balsamic dressing was a bit bland. The lemon vinagrette was a bit tart for our liking but the greens were tasty and crisp.  We each ordered a Parmesan dish; she selected the eggplant and I the chicken. Both were really good. My chicken retained some crunch even under the delicious marinara and cheese. Her eggplant had a more generous serving of cheese and was very tasty as well. She rated it excellent. No room for desserts but no regrets either.  The meals were fantastic.

The shrimp cocktail and spumoni dessert were exceptional. Our side, a pasta dish with marinara, was al dente... something I learned to appreciate and expect after spending a year in Italy. This pasta was a little too al dente.  A great selection of wines added to our dining experience.  My quest for a veal parmesan orgasm will have to continue.
