mkLRhgZG9TaXtNxIuN-ZEA.text: On a mission to find monster meatballs and pasta to satisfy my italian craving, i eagerly scouted the assistance of old faithful YELP.   After a few minutes i narrowed it down to a few locations (primarily targeted by distance) and proceeded to make a final call. The deciding factor? 2 things. A picture submitted by a fellow yelper showcasing a beautifully crafted, softball-sized meatball & a picture depicting the interior of the restaurant, Mastrioni's.  And boy am I grateful for YELP and it's users' pics. I admit i wasnt sure what to expect. Mostly positive reviews, a picture that resembled a half way decent restaurant, and a close proximity to home drove my willingness to explore new found culinary options.  Mastrioni's did NOT disappoint. From the moment i walked in, i was impressed. The decor, the lighting, the ambiance, the welcoming faces. It all screamed authentic italian dining experience.  Food was I-N-C-R-E-D-I-B-L-E. I love me some italian food. Im not a professional food critic. But i do love food. And i do love to eat a delicious meal. And i will now be a repeating regular here at Mastrioni's whenever im in town. The Chicken Parmigiana is HIGHLY recommended. It's my favorite italian dish and this restaurant does a fabulous job on a staple meal. The meatballs, oh the meatballs. A mountain of meat easily the size of a softball is moist, flavorful and cooked to perfection. I ordered 2 on the side and didnt even make it to the 2nd. The portions are pretty big so bring ur stretchy pants and appetite. You're gonna need em....both.   Service 9 Food 9 Atmosphere 9 Overall 9  Recommended: HIGHLY

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers to a wonderful dinner @ Mastrioni&#39;s!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmigiana with side of Meatballs. Fetticine alfredo w/chicken.

xGPtonxJfKocEErL8akMmQ.text: We came here for a family dinner last night. Overall, everything was fine; nothing exceptional, nothing poor. My Veal Picatta was bland, I like a zesty burst of lemon, garlic and wine in that dish. This preparation was buttery as the foremost flavor. My husband had Linguini with Sausage and again the main impression was that it was a bit bland; mild sausage. The rest of the party had basically the same opinion with their pasta dishes (spaghetti and ravioli). Taste, texture and serving size all okay. Service was good.

esSpnpBec2_thx6xnxdY7Q.text: Delicious Italian food!  This is an excellent option if you want to dine off of the Vegas Strip; it's a bit more relaxing and low key.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers and entrees and shared family style.  My favorite dish had to be the lobster ravioli... it was smothered in a delicious white cream sauce and filled with succulent lobster chunks!  I also loved the grilled sea bass... the toasty grilled flavor was slight but what stood out the most was the tender flakiness of the fish.  Perfection.  The accompanying bed of sauteed spinach tasted wonderful with a squeeze of lemon juice.  Clam linguine was alright-- the pasta was al dente, and the sauce was quite light.  The clams were of a generous size, and it was quite convenient having the small seafood fork to remove the meat from the shell.  The crab cakes were a bit dry.  Perhaps they deep fried it for too long?  It wasn't moist.  Also loved the tomato bisque-- it was served very hot, and stayed hot for awhile!  The creaminess of the soup balanced out the acidic tomato taste.  Very good combination.    Expect the seafood entrees to run around $30-35.  The appetizers run anywhere from $8-15.  We were here for quite awhile... and I noticed that the longer we took to eat, the slower the service got LOL.  So slow, that when we wanted to order dessert, it took FOREVER for them to come back, until we finally just said we'll have to pass on dessert.  We had a show in downtown LV to catch!

xeDmAS83MGLw1Mh0Mx25iw.text: Truly the best fish in Las Vegas, the halibut piccata is beyond amazing!  The Caesar salad is excellent!  Service and atmosphere are 5 stars!

t0a58GjffNrVvRDoDteSLQ.text: As good as it gets for us New Yorkers out West!  I brought my wife here and we make it a point to dine here at every opportunity when we're in town.  The service and the ambiance are amazing.  We both love the pomidoro sauce.  It is the most flavorful tomato sauce I've ever had.  The seafood selections are superb:  I've had linguine with clams in the past which reminded me of back home.  This time I had one of the specials of scallops and linguine.  The scallops were yuge!  This place never disappoints.

cUQ_1tpYCh2Guq6Z-af3fA.text: So disappointed with the service. I ordered fish and it looked odd. I asked the server and he said "it's the lighting" Really? That was a huge turn off, and ruined our experience

Xst5f94uGJO21I5gbx7nAg.text: Overall, great Italian food in a random Las Vegas strip mall. Don't let the lack of curb appeal fool you, this place has some of the best off-the-strip Italian food. The ambiance of the place is great, the service was attentive and quick, and food was tasty!  We were sat and quickly received bread with oil and vinegar. The wine list was great and my wine quickly came out with a generous pour. No complaints here! For an appetizer, I ordered a greek salad and also had the stuffed clams for the table. The greek salad was really great and the clams were sinfully good. I recommend dipping the bread in the clam sauce, just a hint from a fellow foodie ;).   I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs for my entree and told them to make it extra saucy. It came out extra saucy for sure! Their red sauce is really tasty with just the right amount of spicy. The meatballs were huge, but could have used a little more salt or flavor. When I cut a meatball open, I like to see herbs and spices and there was only meat in these. But the entree was good and I would order it again.   My husband got the chicken parm which he orders anytime he sees it on the menu. He said that the chicken parm was really good, but not the best. However, from a chicken parm expert, a "really good" is saying something!  We will be back for sure.

vcVkexZB6Aurq6TRRVtlRQ.text: Good food is always better when great service is provided also. No complaints about the food. I love the baked clams,just like I had when I was a kid in Bensonhurst Brooklyn,soak up the wonderful garlic juices with their fresh bread. Our friends had the veal shank,it was huge and fell off of the bone,never tasted anything like it. I had the Marsala,chicken this time but the veal is great also. My wife had the eggplant parm this time,tasted like a  light cheesy eggplant dream.  Another plus? Carlos Santana was here this evening at the counter,a regular from what we've been told,and it was a pleasure to meet and talk to him.

3kd_XbDokiD9l5LneNnRhA.text: Fabulous seafood linguini, eggplant Parmesan and several others and the atmosphere is upbeat and relevant!

CZNY9CfAQpmYb6kUb3Gw9w.text: Two years later...and Mastrioni's is still dynamite. Went last night with three others and we all had pasta - chicken piccata, shrimp scampi, linguini and clams, and sausage and peppers. All four dishes were fresh and delicious. We just about licked the plates clean. I have eaten in a lot of Italian restaurants, and Mastrioni's is still at the top of my list.

MQMkxVqBdB86pIx13zq3vQ.text: It's located in a strip mall and doesn't look like much, but the interior is sleek, modern, and beautiful. On the Sunday night we were there it was surprisingly busy with most of their tables full by 7pm.  I got one of their specials, a seafood risotto ($30) full of squid, scallops, mussels, and shrimp. There was rarely a bite without seafood. Unfortunately, it was bland and forced me to do what I rarely do in any restaurant -- reach for the salt shaker. I had to use it several times to liven up the dish. The portion size was huge, but it also lacked the creaminess of a great risotto.  If you're a fan of chicken parmagiana, the one here is bound to please with a zesty and full bodied sauce. I can't remember having a better version anywhere in town. It was accompanied by a huge side of spaghetti, which made for some great left overs the next day.  They do have a kid's menu with a few pasta options.  3.5 Stars

8nlebdw1fV627TLayawTEA.text: Kirk is the best at taking care of us. Never did we want for anything.  He was very attentive and a real classy guy. This just tops off the best Italian food in Vegas. When our family comes in from New York we always bring them here. We love this place.

O1UQu736J3meEADwx2HfGg.text: I've eaten at Pete's restaurant more than 40 times and I'm finally writing him a well deserved review.    The seafood is amazing and everything is priced perfectly.  Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and welcoming.    My wife and I are looking forward to our next trip to Vegas so we can dine here several more times.

wDVsxIw0oI2wp7xVofkgAA.text: One of my families favorites we met last night for dinner. I would recommended making a reservation for the weekends.   Manhattan straight up was great. I ordered the Shrimp and Linguini combo by far my favorite. Featuring shrimp, scallops, clams, mussels and calamari in a red or white sauce over linguini. Make sure to get red and highly recommend the hottest they can make it. Its not overly spicy and it does not cancel out the flavors.   Also make sure to get an order of their cream puffs they are amazing. Great menu, atmosphere, and service. Highly recommend it!

n1iUjWtEIFTh80u6BvDWnw.text: Wine was good. All four of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals and apps. Overall a great experience plus wonderful service.

tVfy2X7hz4XE2rT2t_DxPA.text: Also, their dishes need updating! The food was served on what was clearly a very old white plate with hundreds of scratches and marks everywhere. Kind of throws you off eating a meal and at the same time thinking of all the other people eating off that same plate!

gGaE-pVBgA3bA1Ksm4iUKQ.text: Awesome food , first time there.  I didn't know what expect. I was relying on yelp review hoping that I will be embarrassed in front of the guest they came through they did a  great job. Will go back for sure .

r4MRJKqHHUvUfrpm7zqGxw.text: 6 of us came here for dinner and it was pretty good. I've yet to find an italian place that is better than what I make at home, but, that's normal right? We had several appetizers, the calamari and clams, as well as clams oreganto. It was pretty good. For dinner, we ordered: eggplant parmesan (very good), 3 seafood and pasta dishes, ziti and meatballs, and shrimp parmesan. Everything was good, but nothing was great. Service was excellent though, which always makes a meal better. I'd definitely come back, I did enjoy myself.

qhvHcZpt6CN8t8P-heIb2A.text: So this being my first yelp I couldn't be happier to say not only does Mastrioni's never fail to deliver their is amazing (especially their special grilled calamari) but Kurt is my favorite. He makes everyone feel like family and the food makes you feel like home ( being Italian myself) so all in all it's a win!

0Dj9-NTR2HHBemMlvzMETw.text: Had the Bolognese, it was excellent, service was great.  Last time I went, I went for the seafood, which turned out to be boring, but the italian is spot on.  Definitely recommend.

5L104kII3ByyWVMOSZGXnw.text: I just recently heard of this restaurant and have only been there twice, but both times were amazing! Make sure to call ahead because the restaurant is not very big so it fills up fast! First time I got the eggplant Parmesan, which was amazing but huge! Which helped my decision to share the chicken Parmesan the second trip! Definitely recommend sharing both of those dishes and if you tell them you're sharing they'll even split it for you ahead of time. For appetizer we had the crab cakes which were delicious. Crab cakes are my favorite appetizer so I order them at almost every restaurant I go to that offers them and these are definitely on the top of my list. I also had a bite of my friend's halibut which was also very delicious and the portion was more reasonable for one person. And last, but definitely not least... the dessert! I am not a big tiramisu person, not that I dislike it's just not my first pick on a dessert menu, but we were told it was a must try and it definitely was! By far the best tiramisu I've ever had! I love that the kitchen is in place of the bar, I think it makes the entire experience more personable when the chefs and the owner introduce themselves and you get to watch them prepare your dinner. It is the perfect place for a date night as it is classy but not one of those overly fancy places that make people like me feel awkward and out of place! LOL! Overall, the service, food and atmosphere are all perfect!

b-JvsgnKMjHnDBHEQtdlBg.text: I'm not sure if I'm lucky or if it's super dangerous, but Mastrioni's is a few blocks from our new house and after seeing it on Yelp we've been anxious to try it out. Decided to go on a whim for my Mother's birthday after she asked for "hole in the wall" Italian. Well, there's nothing "hole in the wall" about Mastrioni's... it's a classy little joint in a non-descript strip mall on Hualapai. We have a two year old, which is the main reason we haven't been here sooner since it's not really a "kid-friendly" spot,  but I figured a Wednesday night would probably be slow and safe. Not so much. By 7 o'clock this place was jam packed! Thankfully, the little criminal behaved wonderfully and we got to enjoy one of the better Italian dinners we've had in a long time. We had calamari and crab cakes for appetizers, calamari was good but the crab cakes were excellent. Mom had the bone in rib-eye, hubs had the seafood linguine and I had linguine and clams. This is your tried and True Italian, better than probably any other I've had in Vegas and would rival any of my favorite spots in California. I'd say it's more like $$$, but they are very generous with the portions/seafood. Dessert was excellent as well and service was on point. We will definitely be back and will probably become our new date night spot.

c38-JoYqnre_fib_z-a8-g.text: As a long time local, I've passed the billboard on 215 West near Jones many times and decided to give it a try with out of town visitors. The ambiance is lovely and very conducive to visiting so perfect when leisurely is in order. Since the space is small, a strong smell of fish hits you at the entrance but becomes unnoticeable once in. The menu is diverse and offers many options. While I wanted to fall in love, I fell into hmmm...maybe...kinda sorta. Service was fine-hostesses were charming unlike many locations, and the sea bass piccata and summerlin salad were very nice. My companions were lukewarm about their salmon entrees as the darkness of the underside seemed to be a deterrent, but my main issue was the plating and lack of fullness for the price. The salad was $13 which is firm for what it was, but sea bass at $36 with a side of room temperature vegetables was too much. For $36-there should have been a small amount of roasted potatoes or such  and the presentation would have been better if the included vegetable side had been on the plate so the bass wasn't so lonely looking. Flavor was fine but in competing with the big boys at big boy prices-up the food presentation and include a carb side to fill out the plate as I am home now and snacked a bit after dining out.. and promise I'm not a giant :)

proIg0RDdeyZc1yBevCVJA.text: Had dinner tonight at this nice little Italian place.  Arrived at 6pm and waited about 15 min. for a table.  There were people waiting in line to get in.  Unusual for a place way off the strip, or for a place not located in Town Square or Boca Park.  We had a young lad serving us that was quite pleasant and efficient.  I ordered the house salad with balsamic dressing that was excellent.  My main dish was just a basic penne with meat sauce.  I thought it was very average.  The restroom was very clean.  The customers were well dressed. Young blonde hostess was nice.  I got kind of annoyed every time the front door to the place opened, a strong odor of cigarettes came in from the smokers outside.  Not much they can do but I hate the smell of smoke while I am eating.

FDTsLtglOiCeIfQy3G2IYg.text: Mastrioni's has amazing Italian cuisine!  Their pastas and salads are consistently delicious.  The penne chicken spinach is my favorite and my husband always gets the veal parm.  It is family run and the service is excellent.  Our first visit there, the owner came out to meet us and gave us free tiramisu (which was amazing).  Whenever friends or family come to town, this is where we take them.

iKIxrFowYrjJ8KUM1bXjOQ.text: Last night, we went to dinner at Mastrioni's Cafe on Hualipai.  We were in a small group and were seated quickly by a caring and pleasant Hostess.  The ambiance of the restaurant is quite striking with art works displayed on the walls.  The kitchen is open and the smell of roasting garlic was wonderful to behold and hopefully a promise of the meal to come.  Sadly this wasn't what we experienced.  Dishes ordered included Caesars Salad  for 3 couples for sharing.  When they were delivered, the wait staff hadn't a clue as to how to serve each of the 6 plates to the 6 guests who were to receive them.  The salad consisted of limp wilted lettuce (Iceberg not Romaine?) with barely enough dressing to moisten the sad pile of greens below.  The salad was quite tasteless and a big disappointment.    It certainly was not worth the $10 cost. The bread that accompanied the salad was tasteless as well.  It was perhaps white bread toasted.  The server (or was it his assistant) put some olive oil and balsamic vinegar on the plates in which to dip the bread.  The bread and the balsamic dip were gone in a few moments and never replenished.  Being a large group the members ordered a variety of entrees and represented a good cross section of menu selections.  I ordered Eggplant Parmagian that was accompanied by ziti in a tomato sauce.  (Or was it tomato water?) The ziti was cool not hot, the individual pieces of pasta were stuck to each other and quite gummy.  The sauce was runny and tasteless.  The Eggplant however was plentiful and tasty.  Unfortunately, the sauce on the eggplant was anything but plentiful and far from tasty.  There was barely enough to cover the food below.  My wife ordered a dish of bowtie pasta with broccoli.  It was warm (not hot) and quite tasteless.  Both of these dishes were, most assuredly, not worth the $18, $16 respectively.    in this town of plentiful eateries how this restaurant serving mediocre food at grossly inflated prices can survive especially with the current economy is a mystery.  Hopefully they will improve over time

rnazlWx7uDeb6dHUZt0jZw.text: In Vegas for a trade show and a "foody" friend who lives here suggested we go "off the strip". Coming from Miami where there are many great restaurants, Mastrioni's did not disappoint. Dominic our waiter, straight out of Brooklyn, is the brother of the chef/owner. He "knew his stuff". I had 2 appetizers, both were specials and my dinner companion had an incredible seafood salad to start and linguine with clams for his entree. Wine menu had well priced selections. Espresso fudge pie for dessert completed a most delicious meal.

Crd_-HakV7WBP5sjp6-otg.text: Mastioni's is beautiful inside and has a nice ambiance.  I was here for a work event and we sat in the back room...may make for a different review.  The service was great and they were very friendly and courteous.  The food was just average, but this may have been due to someone ordering the family style for us.  My favorite part was the puff pastry dessert and the ravioli dish.  Although not memorable for me, I'll stop by and give it another chance, when I can make the menu selections.

M7UeuGuPNPDq1RWimViCgA.text: The best Italian food I have had in years! Their meatballs were delicious, chicken parmesan and osso bucco were also excellent. The prices are very fair for the quality they provide. I will be returning to this establishment in the very near future.

IVKtt-sQeNL08hf2acwVYQ.text: The food here is very good. I would give them 5 stars but the atmosphere is a little stale. The pasta fagioli soup is amazing. Their fish selection is impressive too. Service was above averagel reasonably priced wine selection.

6j7O8LTpWrwNEU0Lx1PwSg.text: Tried to give this place a second chance and even though the service was better the meatballs failed on this experience. The wine was great, the garlic bread yummy, but some how they were able to screw up a meatball. When the plate came to the table the meatballs looked hot and delicious but then I took a bite and wanted to spit it right out. It tasted like cardboard filler and rotten spices, maybe the meatballs had past its prime and someone forgot to check the expiration date...whatever it was it left a bad taste in my mouth. My mom also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs...she won't be back again. We tried telling someone about the meatballs but it fell on deaf ears. So I will NOT be recommending this place to anybody or giving this place a chance again.

_Be3neT0d8CTDHTy32-Ifg.text: After driving by Mastrioni's several dozen times, we decided to try it after reading the other reviews on Yelp.  We went on a Sunday night and the exterior of the restaurant is rather plain and unassuming but, once inside the place is very modern and nice.  We started with crab cakes and fried calamari.  The crab cakes were better.  The chicken piccata and the chicken marsala were excellent.  Service was very attentive and personable.  The noise level was just right, not too loud or too subdued.  Since it was our first visit we gave it four stars but we'll make this a regular neighborhood place to dine and see if the other items on the menu will bring up our score.

BB3t8wjgiHlxt-UIuk4-YQ.text: my friend lin was visiting me from albany,ny and after picking her up at the airport, we stopped by about 6 o'clock, before going to my home close by. the food was good, chicken marcella and chicken parmizon. we waited and waited and waited for bread and water, however, we were met by too many attendants (3-4), each watching and switching plates of butter, glasses,etc. the main server came by too many times, and i was ANNOYED by him!  was he wanting a higher tip? the prices were too, too high for this kind of strip-mall place.   2 dinners were over $40, plus a small tip.  will not go back for this kind of treatment. however, my friend (who was starving, made a pig of herself, by slopping the hard bread lots of times in the chicken sauce.  hope no one saw her (she was in the middle of a divorce.

qy5BdxNi8wYzUSMtGHfNQQ.text: Been looking for good  spaghetti for quite a while. This is the best so far here in LV.

6UaB3yjdlUFVAaqxzakP9g.text: I would rate this as a one more in a long line of mediocre (at best) Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. I dined with a medium sized group  and had a chance to sample several appatizers, entrees, and deserts; as well as hear comments and view the reactions to the food quality.   The evening started on an extremely low note and thankfully went up slightly as dinner progressed. The hostess that greeted us at the door was rude and discouraging, and the first person to greet us at our table was even worse- disheveled, rude, uninformed, and just plain insipid.  Thankfully he was just the assistant waiter or bus boy, and our regular waiter was much better (although in all seriousness, the bar was set VERY low). Our table started off with a variety of mixed drinks and appetizers, as well as the bread that was served  automatically. This was the absolute low point in the evening- the drinks were poorly made at best and took entirely to long to get to the table, two of the 3 loaves of bread brought to the table were stale and had to be replaced (even the second set didn't taste very good) and everything seemed to be a hassle to get. I put 100% of the blame on the assistant waiter. You have to understand this guy left you with the feeling of absolute incompetence.) Once the appetizers came, things picked up only slightly. If garlic and salt  sledge hammer flavors are your thing, this restaurant is for you. Of the several apps that I tasted, only the bruscetta was worth going back for, but I grudgingly give a nod to the steamers (white wine sauce and heavy garlic) and the crab cakes (very meaty but not much flavor... how?). Avloid the overcooked calamari and the absolutely boring ceaser salad (really, even a sports bar can get these right)  Dinner was thankfully better, but again the slovenly assistant waiter and overwhelming flavors marred a good, if basic, Italian meal. Of all the meals I sampled, nothing actually stood out, but nothing actually tasted horrible either-  just mediocre and overwhelmingly seasoned.   The veal chop I ordered was tender and very buttery in texture, and everyone that tried the roasted potatoes was in love. My partner was absolutely disappointed in her dish, unfortunately neither of us remember what it was exactly (a pasta with spinach and chicken) Everyone else seemed satisfied but never wowed by their food, and only two plates went back clean- two plates everyone at the table heavily partook of- the veal chop and a mixed seafood pasta   Desert and the wines served with dinner were the highlight of the evening. I ordered a house Chianti that was very good for the price, and several  others at the table shared a bottle of Chardonay. The regular wine connoisseurs at the table seemed very pleased w/ the wine selection.   As for desert I was once again able to sample several thing as well as take note of other peoples reactions. Several deserts were ordered and for the most part passed around. Of important note- the cheesecake (rich, dense and creamy but still light,  w/ a hint of lemon flavor) and espresso ice cream pie (very rich and creamy if slightly freezer brunt, but still one of  the table faves)  were most remarked upon and devoured in their entirety, while the tiramisu was almost completely ignored. I took a small bite and what can I say- flat, dead, dull...pointless? This is desert that every Italian restaurant should ace at, yet along with the several coffees and gelatos ordered, nobody had anything good to say about them (all of the coffee drinkers commented on an "off" taste)   So, to sum up- nothing horrible yet nothing stellar;  the service was OK in some ways but atrocious in others, the food was either serviceable or entirely forgettable, and the bar is a complete failure. Another completely mediocre Vegas Italian restaurant.  Will I go back? Never.

ByyZi6spqIrg1ezIESRcbQ.text: This place has good quality food. Came here on a Sunday when I tried to go to Rachel's Kitchen but didn't realize they closed at 4. Glad I gave it a shot. Will be back when I come to Vegas again. The pasta was really tasty and service was good too.

qTRIKAY1P3srSYY2rp1h6g.text: Cool place, you can sit at the counter & be part of the kitchen. Tried the pork loin & it was very good. Wine was good. Ended the meal with tiramisu (this is my fav dessert) it only gets 2 stars. It needed more cheese & coffee flavor.  It was homemade but they used a cake instead of lady fingers. Would not recommend it :(

H4UdknLHC-tppoL_WYAH-Q.text: My son and I went for an early dinner. There were two others at 5pm. I had high hopes after reading the good reviews but was disappointed. My son ordered a regular Bolognese with spaghetti noodles. His meal was good, nothing to rave about but decent. I ordered the seafood past at $29. It was a good portion that would fill you up. There were two large shrimp and 4 clams and 4 mussels in their shell. Then the filler was tiny squid. All of this looked great, but I've never had such a poor dish. Either they forgot the wine in the white sauce or there was too much water in the pasta... I don't know which but the white sauce tasted like buttered water and nothing else. It was quite disappointing. And I was starving so just about everything should have tasted good, but after this dish, I have decided that I'm not trying it again. My son's spaghetti plus mine was $50 without gratuity... Sure the waiter agreed to make me something else, but if you have the most expensive pasta dish delivered without any taste... why would I want to try anything else...Not going back.

9iHn9pD7RHF6GVjDWaUq7g.text: Love love this place.  Best Italian  food in Vegas ! We visit Vegas every 5 to 6 weeks & always make it a point to eat here. Great food, service, & owner very personable makes you feel welcome every time.  Highly recommend it

Ze-4l6Bh8iDjV3Gz-dv1QA.text: What a great meal.  Went with 12 other people for a birthday party, had stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, veal, salmon, chicken, Caesar salad, house salad, too much good stuff.  Wine selected by staff was wonderful... I would HIGHLY recommend.  Go for any kind of occasion --you will not be disappointed. Promise.

ehuUfG8sHthEENi7sHdS_Q.text: WOW... a little disappointing... We (3) went for dinner on Wed., the 26th;  the "hostess" didn't know what the heck to do with us...  the service was fair, and the food... ...We ordered 4 entrees... the great and famous Lobster Ravioli in cream sauce was salty... the sauce, that is... I wondered if it was bisque out of a can...  Did I guess right, Mastrioni?  The meatballs were flavorless...  too much breadcrumbs in them...  and the sauce on them was almost just canned tomatoes.  Not horrible,  ...most folks would like the food, I guess, 'cause they do a lot of business...  it is certainly a cut above most...  Louise R.

JKPfHXW8-azYxHK6AZUwFw.text: I brought my friend to Mastrioni's for lunch on her birthday. Kurt took excellent care of us. He was attentive and delightful. The Caprese Salad was beautiful and tasty. The sea bass was delicious, tender and cooked to perfection. I love to bring friends and clients to Mastrioni's because the food, service and atmosphere are consistently exceptional.

ytMXC5WPbRx6p930ahNMww.text: The food is awesome. I've been driving by this place for years and wished I had stopped by sooner. Kurt was great, very personable, and suggested some really good dishes. The service was excellent,I'll definitely be coming here more often.

tnkcoA_jSW7PLM2C65xg2Q.text: Great dinner. Had some customers in town and wanted to take them near their hotel. Mastrioni's was highly suggested by a colleague of mine. We were very pleased and not disappointed at all. Kurt took care of us and we went with all his suggestions! What an incredible dining experience. We will definitely be back to try different things on the menu.

66xf8jcO1PCeDg62-MPd5A.text: Great local place. My husband and I dined here recently and received professional and friendly service from the wait staff. Food was tasty and although we were the last table in the restaurant, we never felt rushed. Great place to check out.

t9guRXDxHsq8vAFS_RRmdg.text: Still delicious!  I have no clue why we don't dine here more often... I live like 5 minutes away!  We had: *Lobster Ravioli (special of the night) - TO DIE FOR!  Very generous on the lobster.  *Cheese Ravioli - A classic done right!  You can tell the pasta is homemade.  *Crab Cocktail - AWESOME!  Fresh crab and the cocktail sauce = money!  *Tomato Basil Soup - Another classic done perfecto.  Had a couple of great glasses of Chianti to accompany dinner.  We had to box up a few things and they wrapped everything very nicely- including the soup!  The leftovers were SO GOOD!  I wish I had room for dessert- hopefully next time.  Service is great and everyone is very nice and attentive.  What a great local place and they take reservations!

zG3IwPxP9YHWB8f69SP7_g.text: Baked ziti to die for! Great service. Atmosphere is very nice. You wouldn't know from the outside how nice this place is. Our side dish with our entree was the garlic oil penne! So good. I ordered the veal picatta. Wouldn't order again it but preparation was very good.

gx9zB6nTQGb1CnYwS9_5sw.text: We experienced good food here before but tonight was not good!  The bread was rubbery feeling and boiling hot.....like it just was reheated in the microwave!  Then, I get chicken marsala and it was a watered down, buttery sauce, no idea where the marsala was!  I hope this was just an off night and the quality will come back up.

nVoO32CE5JnfnAvA9XgC2Q.text: The ambiance was very welcoming and made me feel like I was back in little Italy in New York. We ordered the brushetta and Caprese Salad as appetizers and the quality and freshness of the ingredients were unlike any Italian restaurant in vegas. It was our first time here thanks to the gift certificate we received from T bird jewels and without a doubt we will be back and will recommend this fine establishment to our family and friends. Our server Dane was very prompt and friendly and never let our water glasses go empty. The service and food were second to none. This will be our new go to place for special occasions. Thank you for making our first experience from the appetizers to the main course out of this world. The stuffed ravioli and chicken marsala were incredible. Will be back soon.

tlnSxjtgU2bfJ-pP0IqlKA.text: Just ate here for the first time and my experience was excellent! The ravioli was delicious and the staff was attentive and polite. Wonderful Italian food!! I will be back!

UQKQuAeNVyJxs-z4k6xfbw.text: First off, they were closed when we got there for a Saturday lunch. However, they were hosting a private party and said "hey, we're open so come on in". Not only did they let us in, they offered the lunch and dinner menus.  Owner (Peter) made us feel like family and the servers were incredible.  I probably don't have to mention that the food is amazing!!

tOogJFcP2FTi2BIw47cueA.text: Great Italian food in Summerlin. A little out of they way but well worse the trip. We have eaten there now 3 - 4 times and the food is consistent great. The other day we tried the King Crab special (not usually on the menu of an Italian place) and is was unbelievable fresh and well prepared.

RoK9rTD4IUSrai7xoGiGCQ.text: First time here tonight and it was amazing.   Scallop special was to die for and service was wonderful.

w2KR-DTanRza0PfEZCiO3A.text: This is a favorite of ours. ;) This place gives you the 'back-east" Mom and Pop feeling the minute you walk through the door.  In fact, we enjoy the food so much, that we bring our out of town visitors here to dine with us-thus avoiding the strip prices with the same- if not better quality of Italian food. For an extra special experience, sit at the bar and watch the chefs in action.  They often put on a funny, unscripted show-full animation while busting each others chops.   You can't go wrong with the following: *Seafood Risotto (usually on the special list) FULL of succulent seafood and rice cooked to perfection. *Chicken Marsala- tender and flavorful *All of their delicious salads-especially the Summerlin salad *The veal  *Their pasta gravy  (almost as good as mine!)   We think  the overzealous owner and crew deserve a pat on the back for a rare find in the desert. Salute!

egyySLrX7fj5nz0ZeXs3Jg.text: Food is unbelievably delicious. Great service. A bit pricey but that comes with the quality of food and service

8qPD6PhOShvzbWlLTjCt4Q.text: Best up-scale Italian steak and seafood on the West Side.  Been there three times, never disappointed.  A bit unassuming from the outside.  ....but so was Nora's.

Mu_Ox9ncy88WxMj8O7xsBQ.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas! Love the Clams Oreganata!  The service is always great!

nPxORAnsO68lSd9O7qj1Aw.text: We just moved into the area and were looking for a good Italian restaurant...this is not the one.  We started with a chopped salad...not good in, fact terrible, unless you like brown salad and not really chopped.  The main course was OK, just average.  We should have gone to Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill, that has better tasting food and costs less. After a bill of $100.00 that included a $27 bottle of wine, we were not impressed.

lhn9vzJKRIFctASFwub2cA.text: Kept hearing about this place on espn radio. The guys keep raving about the food there and thought i would take my fiancee here. I ordered the scampi shrimp and the seafood linguini (it advertises as fresh seafood). Biggest mistake ever. The seafood was not fresh at all. All of it had that fishy taste that old seafood gets. The shrimp was cooked well but it tasted horrible. The calamari and mussels were bad too really fishy taste. I just went there tonight and will not be going back. I get that its vegas and there is no ocean here but this was laughable. The total check was 150 after tip @ 20 percent. The service was good and fast but goodness was the food awful. I cannot recommend this place. I have had better food at olive garden.

Z-mPRoqHdu8v7Rqkfoa7Zw.text: Not only was the dinners we ordered superb, but Kurt's service made my birthday dinner over the top. What was particularly appreciated was his attention to detail for all seven of us, including the children. The chef even came out to greet us. My hats off to Mastrioni's. We will become regulars.

wqGQBmGJbDCHtTL68KayrQ.text: Really good food. We ( seven of us) came for my wife's birthday and when we pulled in my sister hugged me and said this place was her favorite. Ha ha Shrimp parm was really good and the shrimp cooked perfectly. Only downside was our server.... She was absent most the time and absent minded even more. Forgot my nephews soda and the high chair. Has to ask twice for both. Then when it was time to get the check, she was at someone else's table for what seemed like 5 minutes

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp parm

tOUq30Vxt0n5goGpJVFa2g.text: My boyfriend and I dined here for my boyfriends birthday. We loved the ambiance. Sitting at the chefs counter was amazing. The kitchen is a well oiled machine and it was fantastic to watch. From the calamari to the veal parmigiana and tiramisu, everything was to die for. Kurt was on point and very knowledgable. Downfall, the pasta isn't house made and that was kinda a bummer. All in all, a great place to dine. Can't wait to return!!

-FGT-2BhxKXAB1c7__eqYQ.text: From start to finish,  we had a great dinner. Food was excellent and service was great. We had the Osso Bucco which was excellent, meat was so tender! The combo oreganate was also terrific, with the big, fresh scallops, shrimps,clams, and mussels in a delicious sauce! Will definitely be coming back!!

10lhANePWIeols0e5RBzIA.text: Every time my husband and I go to Las Vegas (about 4 times a year) we have at least 1 of our dinners at Mastrioni's.  My husband is especially fussy about Italian food and we both love the food here.  The service is also great.  I can hardly wait for our next visit to Las Vegas next week.  Guess where we will go to dinner?  We have even seen some local celebrities at the restaurant.

malTthTitExHNmcG4Co1lw.text: We have been wanting to stop in and try the food for a long time.. finally made the reservation.  The food and the service did not disappoint.. amazing is an understatement.  We will definitely be back many times.

EJhuk68OzyL7fH7KOBvncA.text: Meh, not 5-star dining. It's Italian food with a touch of fancy. Nothing on the menu seems to vary off the Italian traditionals. It would have been nice to see a touch of innovation and use of more varied ingredients.   The service was subpar. Our server was what my wife called "abrupt". He seemed to come and go very rapidly without actually seeming to care about our dining experience. I got a beer and the chilled glass that came with it smelled (and made my beer taste) like bleach, so I requested a new one. The server poured a little bit in then basically slammed them on the table as he was already mid-stride to do something else. The second glass was similar so I drank out of the bottle after the initial bleachy-tasting pour was consumed. The waiter saw me sniffing at my glass again and just came by and collected the glass and took it away - not even asking if I had a repeat experience (which I did).   The wife got the Seabass PIcatta...it was an okay size piece and it was cooked well. The picatta sauce (lemon and capers) was entirely too lemony. Would not recommend the picatta.I wouldn't call it a $36 dollar dish either.   I heard Osso Bucco was one of the specials and I can never turn that down. It came out looking great atop fettuccini with a good sauce. The Osso Bucco itself was good but could have used a little more braising to make it more tender as the meat was a little firm. Overall it was below average comparatively. I was a bit surprised when I got the bill and it was $42.

HpmGZlNYK9QkN1uQunIoEw.text: In town for Thanksgiving and friends suggested Mastrioni's for dinner.  The four of us had various pastas that were very good. I'm a big fan of Spaghetti Carbonara but it was not on the menu. I asked if the chef could make it for me and he kindly agreed to accommodate me. The pasta was fabulous.  Each dessert was enough for two or more people.  An enjoyable dinner and the restaurant is highly recommended.

ljzzOlfMgl4ew98jlUuhHg.text: Mastrioni's continues to provide excellent service and delicious food. Our server Kurt has a great personality and is knowledgeable of the menu. The Boullibasse is one of the best in Las Vegas. All of the seafood was perfectly cooked. The broth was tasty with the right amount of spice.

xKP6qqXFCu2hrpIFKpEeqw.text: I love this restaurant.  My husbands family come here every sunday when they're in town.  Its your typical italian place, lots of pasta, a few steaks and some sea food.  Being a pretty good italian cook (if I do say so myself haha) I an be pretty tough on italian places.  I wouldn't put it past mine, but its still great.  The staff is always wonderful, Nick is our favorite server.   I have also worked with Shelley, the owners wife, on coordinating a 20 person private party, she was great to work with and very accommodating.    If you're ever in the south summerlin area give it a try!

2qjVLXIeb11MJr-b3PR8nA.text: Very mediocre red sauces and pasta. The shrimp were excellent, but I had the ciappino stew and there were only 2 shrimp and 2 scallops. Mostly calamari. Soup broth was very bland. Service was OK but not exceptional. Everyone in our party felt same. Food was just OK, prices very high.

H9vIyWJf_wyOrTDJzS5Htg.text: We had a gift card we needed to use , for the longest time we've been wanting to dine at Mastrioni's , we finally made it last night and sadly to say it was extremely disappointing ... we weren't dressed to the nines nor were we ghetto .. just in between , but the look we got from the waiter was like we didn't belong ... Anyway ... we started off our dinner with calamari it was extremely bland no flavor  whatsoever , it needed some serious seasoning or something ,  the marinara sauce was just as boring ...next we order dinner I had the shrimp and scallops with vodka pasta,  it was the most boring dish ever ... ZERO flavor , do they not use salt or pepper? I mean the scallops were tasteless ... my son had the spaghetti and meatballs ... the meatballs were tough and hard like baseballs , dense and dry again no flavor ... my husband had the steak , he ordered it way too rare (for my liking ) but he said it was just ok. I think had he gone maybe med rare instead of raw  it probably would've tasted better .. the service was so so, we had cocktails after dinner , those were the best thing we had ... sorry to say we won't be returning ... I was really hoping this place would have worked out for us ... Oh well ... we'll just move on...

dW37xSyS41VAhLndqyUTLQ.text: Love this place!! Came for first time recently to celebrate my mothers birthday and experience was excellent.  The food was excellent staff is realy nice and attentive couldn't have asked for more.  This is home made  Italian food here you won't be disappointed. Will definitely be back soon..

MkvDwZ2s5cJm9ajV44cQuA.text: Love this place! I live very far from Mastrioni's and the Summerlin area, but it's worth it for the food. I had the salmon, and it was AMAZING. A five-star experience all the way.

LC8ve3hSzNPhkatygRcRMw.text: I can't get enough of the delicious food, and friendly staff. The extensive wine list is another reason I love this place!   There's always a debate between which appetizer to get, there are so many good ones! On nights likes tonight, when I am not feeling seafood, I order the bruschetta appetizer. The best bruschetta I have ever had. Ever. I usually do the clam oregenate, crab cakes, or seafood salad!  I had the Penne, Chicken, Mushroom, and Sun-dried tomatoes. It is probably my favorite pasta dish, of all time. I also really love their Penne, Shrimp and Scallop Vodka.   My friend chose the delicious Ribeye, cooked to a perfect medium rare. I kept stealing the parmesan potatoes that came with it.   For dessert, we shared a scrumptious slice of homemade cheesecake and Creme brulee. Because who can resist mouth-watering, fluffy, perfect cheesecake?!  Definitely a must try! They get busy on the weekends, but are usually good about quickly seating you. I still recommend making a reservation   They offer catering and have a room available for private parties, along with family style menu options for parties of 16+ guests   PS The food comes out fast, fresh, and hot!

Prg8OLCQOLWwrUImyNuzCQ.text: Had the seafood linguini and it was delicious. I split a side salad and good thing I did because it was giant. Others had chicken parm, giant crab lags and chicken piccata. Everyone was happy with their meals and atmosphere a plus.

32GHwGRpPMrQaT-f0XGCBg.text: Wonderful meal. Don't know why I waited so long to return. Crab cakes, pasta fagioli, salmon. All delicious. Attentive and friendly service. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

AbAPXyo7cfxFiSo6N0PrIw.text: Food taste good..I normally 2 times a month order food to go..Tonight I sat at the bar overlooking the cooking station..I watched a cook have a towel in his hand to pick up hot pans.He would then keep his tongues in the same towel..He would pick up raw chicken, veal and other food with them and put it back in the towel.He then wiped down the counter with the towel..I called over the server and told him..He saw him do everything I saw.He told the chef..The cook never changed and kept doing it.I will be calling the health board.

4HDAJet3DXzdh8KJtz4Gpw.text: Ambience: 5 stars. Quality: 5 stars. Staff: 5 stars. Only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of how expensive the place is and the quantity of the plate. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli for $25 and only got maybe about 6 pcs. Sad to say I wasn't even full. My bf got the Veal Milanese for about $26. You get 3 pcs of thinly sliced veal with a side of pasta. Very good and juicy but same thing, just not filling. Would probably not come back just because it's to expensive.

Pmr-nPf6E9ALvBGe6k1ugQ.text: Looking for EXCELLENT Italian food?  This is THEE place! I'm originally from NY so the bar is set pretty high, Mastrioni's is by far the BEST I've had in the 6 years I've been here! The ambience is just great! No corny "figures" no gaudy "Italian" flags etc. Our server, Dane, was friendly and had all the specials memorized. He was very friendly and attentive, every need was taken care of. The food was Stellar!!! I had the Chicken Marsala, which was fantastic & a good one is definitely hard to find in Vegas! My 4 other native New Yorker's were impressed with their meals as well! If you're looking for REALLY great Italian food, Mastrioni's is THEE place to go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I usually prefer the &#34;red&#34; sauce, but this was off the wall!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parking is a little strange, but it&#39;s worth it.

E1UoBuclEKmRanEjF5souw.text: When it comes to food, my husband is the ultimate snob. (There is no excuse to be a snob doesn't matter how well the person can cook!) Anyways, this is a classy yet low profile Italian joint that actually pleases him every single time. The vibe is always pleasant in here. My personal favorite is the Veal Marsala, and calamari is consistently yummy. You can never go wrong with the Osso Bucco! It is the tastiest and you don't have to wait for a couple of hours like you are making it at home. It also doesn't hurt the joint is literally 0.2 miles away from my house.

2UmSyrSG55JT__q_xucbjA.text: My family and I came in town from LA to visit other family. We decided to stop by here for lunch. Amazing Italian!! Fast service. Food was a little hot (burned the roof of my mouth) but it was amazing. Highly recommended

6maw6kKSH6MOKEiK5S7QcQ.text: I've been coming here for a few years. The food is great. Shawn the cook is fantastic and Peter jr is the best waiter around. The food is always consistent and always delicious.

oK1syX3a__fyQzJGUNM6Bg.text: We enjoyed every part of our meal . The shrimp in our Entrees were gigantic , the scallops were fresh and all tasted great !  The seafood salad was fresh and tasty .   We made a reservation for 7pm on a Fri evening , we were seated within minutes .  We wil be back and have already informed a few of our friends to give Mastrioni's a try .   From the outside it doesnt look as large and spacious as on the inside . We have No complaints as we thought the prices were fair as well . Being from NYC , Im used to great Italian food in little Italy  . Now living in Vegas Mastrioni's is my go to place for a nice Italain meal .

Yi_QVZev6Owz0fHzG-oJFA.text: My husband and  I came here tonight for a late Valentine's day dinner date. Our server, Dane was very upbeat and cheerful, which was already a good sign to me. He was very helpful when we were deciding on an appetizer, but he made the creamy mozzarella cheese with heirloom tomatoes appetizer sound so enticing that we had to order it as well as our original idea, bruchetta.   My huband got the osso bucco which he really enjoyed. I got the seafood comno with angel hair rather than the linguini that comes with it by default with white sauce. I really enjoyed my dish, but towards the end it was harder to enjoy just because I was so full, haha. I want to come again to try out the other dishes and I am sure that everything else is just as delicious.

IoySlb_TJx89amidFGNAcw.text: My wife and I went to Mastrioni's for the first time for lunch on Christmas Eve. When we entered we were told that they were not open until 4 The owner/Chef came over and explained that the kitchen staff was prepping for Dinner but welcomed us to stay for lunch. He personally provided outstanding and attentive service throughout our meal  The Restaurant was beautifully decorated for Christmas with Christmas music by Chris Botti softly playing in the background. Now for the Food. We started with crab cakes and steamed clams. The crab cakes were all about the crab and well seasoned while the clams were lightly cooked in a  delicious spicy broth. I couldn't resist dunking the warm bread.  We then opted for the Halibut and Seabass both served with a lemon butter sauce with capers. I am originally from NY and have lived in Brussels and London but have never had fish that was cooked better then what Mastrioni presented. The fish was succulent, moist and delicious with the sauce the perfect compliment. For dessert we shared a Tiramisu that was one of the best I have enjoyed. Overall this was an outstanding meal and a wonderful Christmas Eve dining experience. I highly recommend that you visit Mastrioni's and it too will be one of your new favorites in Vegas.

XhEU0g3ToVXLsdBf-hal4w.text: Mastrioni's is more than meets the eye, from street-view it can be a bit less desirable but the food makes up for what the restaurant lacks in looks and we all know that what really matters is how your food looks/tastes. The atmosphere is charming with a dash of chatter.   The excellent service is also paired with a delightful wine list but beware of the portions when choosing your food as the most dishes are fairly heavy. To start we got healthy portions of caprese and calamari to share; followed by veal marsala and fettuccine alfredo; topped off with cannolis.  Definitely will be back if in the area.

W2c46opN0RcsmdPQW71HHg.text: Great place for a night out with someone special or a group of friends. Really nice relaxing environment for any occasion. Best sea food in the Las Vegas area hands down. The customer service is excellent. Everyone there makes you feel like you're their favorite customer every time.

ZJLYg8k9s0d-PmpnmFd_Zw.text: Very good!!! Delicious!!! Amazing service!! The alferdo  pasta wow!! And a pretty place;)

W4o9ExVMduP_sgc1WAQEvw.text: The three stars is for the awesome interior design of the restaurant and the friendly staff! Now let's get to the food, the description of the pork dish gave me a beautiful visual but when I got it it was a nightmare. Paper thin slices of pork and three table spoons of mixed veggies and they didn't clean the green beans properly. It was flavorless and a disappointment. My partner got a side of pasta marinara and it was undercooked and had no salt or pepper, no life. I gave this place a try but I will stick to Nora's because they have standards.

wm667MbhTCQ6hINb5dGuYw.text: I was in Vegas visiting family and they told me that I NEED to try this place, so we decided to go there for a Sunday dinner. This place is new nice looking restaurant in a plaza with plenty of parking. We arrive around 5:00 PM and the place was pretty empty, but by 5:45 PM it was completely filled, so you might want to make reservations before going. The service at the restaurant is great, the staff is friendly and welcoming and seems like they will do their best to meet you needs, one person in the group tends to be really picky about things and the staff had zero problems with meeting his requests.  Anyways on to the food, we ordered a total of 4 dishes  Osso Buco served on Fettuccine (5/5 stars) - This item was one of the specials and it was one of the most amazing dishes I ever had, the meat was so soft and tender. it just fell off the bone.  They also provided a small fork so that you can get to the bone marrow or the bone.  it was a little pricey ($45), but well worth it! so I would still give this dish 5/5 stars. It is big enough to share, but DON'T! its too yummy.  1/2 Baked Lobster topped with crab meat, served with papperdelle with seafood sauce (4/5 Stars) - This was also one of the specials, it consisted of a a whole Maine lobster that was split in half, topped with crab meat. The pasta it came with was a seafood sauce that contained clams and shrimp.  All of the seafood was top notch and really fresh. This dish was really good, but didn't stand out as amazing to me. but still worth the $42 price tag.  King Crab Legs (4/5 Stars ) - This dish consisted of 6 mersus sections of the crab leg. which is the largest part of it between the body and the first joint. The Kitchen does most of the work and cracks the shell and the correct point so that you can pull the whole section of meat out without much effort.  The meat its self was VERY fresh, the meat was sweet and soft like it should be. Not dry and briny like a lot of places serve. It is hard to find crab of this quality in most places.  Overall though, don't get this dish if you are really hungry, it is not a lot food for most people, I would say split this as an appetizer. (i don't remember the price)  Cioppino (3.5 stars) - I should start by saying that I this is a dish that I always compare to the best cioppino i've ever had which is at Sotto Mare in San Francisco. This dish was good in terms of quantity and seafood quality. The pasta was also cooked perfectly.  But I felt the dish was a little watery over all, I prefer to have it be a little thicker.  The taste also wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped. This dish was just "ok" for me, I don't think I would order it in the future. The cost was $34 i think or maybe $32?  Overall, I really like this restaurant.  I have added it to my must eat at again list the next time I am in Vegas.  If you are looking for somewhere to eat away from the strip I strongly recommend this place, and if they have the Osso Buco get that!!!  I am basing my 5/5 rating mostly on the Osso Buco that I ordered as well as the service.  But from eating everything I don't think you will be dissappointed with anything you order

_ObAyx5BtzNdEiTmwnAgFQ.text: My husband and I really enjoyed our meal here. We had Kurt waiting on us and although he was very busy he never made us feel neglected. I had lobster ravioli which was very good but not on the menu. Kurt made sure I could have it though:) We had the calamari to start and the New England clam chowder soup. Both were delicious! The playlist had a lot of jazz music several songs that made us reminisce of our wedding day. Great place for a great night.

7Bj1ZZLB4YSnMSWDeDIfag.text: It was our first time, but we loved it. Super quiet and calming atmosphere. Definitely what I needed right now in my life as I am in deeply painful mourning. Jazz music playing was an added bonus. It was fairly slow because we dined on a Monday, but even as it picked up they never sat people right on top of each other. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive. Never allowed for us to be without water or have to flag them down. Our meals were the best Italian we've had in Vegas. We ordered classic spaghetti & meatballs and chicken parmigiana (bill $38 + tax and worth EVERY penny). Truly delightful with flavors, and reminiscent of home-cooked Italian food. It was hands down the best experience I've had OFF the strip. Typically, for this level of quality in every aspect I have to travel to the strip and mingle with tourist traffic, loudness, and hassle. I'm thrilled that I found it here, without valet, hiking into a loud smoke filled place, or having to travel 20 miles home to Summerlin after.   Bottom line: Service 10/10 Food 10/10 Cleanliness 10/10 Atmosphere 10/10 Price point 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel hair pasta with marinara. Yum!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana. So good!
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti &amp; meatballs. Very flavorful and perfectly cooked. Texture was amazing.

mvbrQ6zRNa49WKdfj-LCHQ.text: One of my new favorite places to eat.   The service was excellent and so was the food. The restaurant itself is nice with very modern decor. I wasn't crazy thrilled about the music. It was very "elevator type". The jazzy kind that puts you right to sleep.   Other than that, our waiter was super attentive. A bit eccentric, but was very on top of his tables.   We had: Caesar salad. It was good, but it was pretty overpriced for how small it was. It was the size of a small side salad for $12.  The crab cocktail. Again, it was overpriced for how little of crab you get. It's maybe 1-2 full snow crab legs for $21. That's just silliness.   For the entrees - oddly enough, they're decently priced.  The Shrimp and Scallop Vodka Penne - very yummy. Would recommend on angel hair pasta.  Sea Bass Picatta - Mother, this was good. The Seabass just melts in your mouth...better than chocolate. I love any white fish with a good citrus butter sauce. So freaking excellent.   Overall, everything was good. We were super happy with our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass Picatta - Delicious.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Scallop Vodka - delicious.
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cocktail - well overpriced. Not worth it.

8LruCLIVeHw11hX6SEJCWQ.text: This is one of my go to places for a very nice dinner with great service.  Prices aren't cheap but the portions are generous & always fresh & delicious.

yrwk2NiJRhh-69hNN4-ZBQ.text: I don't understand what the rave is about this restaurant. Don't be fooled by the high praise. Low on taste and definitely high on price. Service was subpar. Wouldn't come back again!

VoGn28IdPee-3CAjVyPnNQ.text: Woohoo! As good as it gets!!  How funny would it be if that was my whole review? But it's not, because I was so blown away by the food and service at Mastrioni's that I have a lot to say! First of all, my server was superb and so was everyone that helped him bring the food to my table. Our drinks were never empty once. I felt so well taken care of as a customer that I literally wrote on the receipt, which is something my mom would do! Garrett was our primary server. He was kind, quick, and attentive. He hit the perfect spot for service between over-bearing and just plain helpful.   I have to admit that I didn't think this would be such an excellent restaurant. I didn't look up the prices and based on the outside I expected it to be cheaper/faster than Olive Garden! I was certainly confused!! This place was pricey, like $30 a plate pricey. I should have paid more attention to the $$ on Yelp, but I just saw it had good reviews and went for it. Beyond the initial shock of looking at the menu, everything that accompanied was spectacular. It is mich bigger than it seems on the outside, the atmosphere is open and dim and perfect for a romantic date night. My boyfriend was in a T-Shirt so we weren't prepared for the romantic part but we were sure ready to eat.  I hate that I didn't take any pictures but I was so busy enjoying myself that the phone didn't get touched until desert. Those cream puffs, though. Yumm! If cream puffs are an obsession of yours as they are mine, you will be pleased. Working backwards, Eric had a shrimp parmigiana which was probably our least favorite thing. It was good but I wouldn't order it again with all the other delicious options. I had the seafood combo linguini with white sauce and it was amazing. The amount of seafood was everything I ever wanted, it was basically half seafood and half noodles. Normally I feel lucky if my seafood linguini comes with a few muscles - this one had that and scallops and octopus and all manner of seafood galore. We had the fried calamari for an appetizer which was great but not different than any other good calamari. We also split a Summerlin Salad made with arugula which is my favorite green. It came out already split, gotta appreciate that extra effort!  I drank a few glasses of moscato which may be messing with my ability to critique, but as of right now I just can't wait to go back to Mastrioni's! I just wish I knew how to pronounce it.

Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli
Photo of Mastrioni's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream Puff LIFE

BhWV5TfPeK75YJKGrXN72Q.text: Atmosphere: Dressy.  Perfect spot to take a loved one.  Favorite Item: Literally everything, but if I have to narrow it down, I love the crab cakes.   Mastrioni's is amazing, our waitress Jenna was spectacular she was extremely helpful and kind. If I could I would eat here everyday.

HcM-HdsTUog_amFEcNne4Q.text: Went there with friends after basketball practice- wow great food. It was very busy on Friday night but the flavor was still great!  We will be back for sure- I could see our Family becoming regulars!   We tried numerous items from the menu and none of them disappointed!

0n8xj_CmYpfSc-4Yho8pvw.text: One of my favorite off the strip hotspots. I've been coming here for years and always leave very pleased, the decor is nice so definitely dress upscale. Some of my favorites include the Chicken Parmagiana, Chicken Vesuvio, and NY Steak Pizziola. All different but absolutely mouthwatering. My friend also raves about their Lobster Ravioli (they only make occasionally as the chefs special). She literally calls ahead to see if they have it that night.   Mastrionis is Family run which is evident from the attention to detail throughout your entire dining experience.   A must try!

WKFsqrH__BT8lsclIm1kbA.text: My mouth waters every time I think about my meal!  The calamari is out of this world.  Go in deep with the bread dipping in the broth - your mouth will water forever after too!

3xeoHMLHzuHRruhXlMCfjQ.text: We are a regular at Mastrioni's, the Food is ALWAYS AMAZING!!!! Pete the owner and Chef is the BEST HANDS DOWN!!!!! The Veal Chop, the Egg Plant, Sea Food Rissoto, WOW!!! You Just Need To Go!!! Make a Reservation!!!!

wCoEkeqZXa6c9eFsoWpbKw.text: Kurt was absolutley awsome.We have been here many times over the years,always with good food and service.I just wanted to give a "shout out" to Kurt, he is a True pro.

5uW5-uNJqpIPwyjoFI3j6Q.text: We came for Valentines's Day dinner and were so glad we did.  It's easy to see what all the hullabaloo is about. This place is gooood.  We made reservations and arrived 10 minutes early.  It being Valentines's Day we knew that it would probably be a little bit crazy getting seated.  There was a little confusion and we waited a bit longer than expected but they were very quick to remedy the situation.  The service here is excellent. Our server was Vince and he was awesome. Super attentive and polite, couldn't ask for better :)   I ordered the chilean sea bass, bruchetta style...holy cow, it was amazing! Husband ordered the surge and turf, which he said was a little more charred than he would have preferred, but it was a ridiculously busy night for them, so we understand. When we brought it to their attention, again they were quick to remedy with a fabulous dessert. We picked the cheesecake (really really good), but since we devoured dinner there's wasn't anymore room and we took it home.    Very nice dinner for just the two of us or with a group of friends. High ceilings, big open room, small bar that you can order food at in the back. A little pricey, but worth it.  We'll definitely be back soon.

SKHMQ1Sl_XcXo0caoMjnGA.text: I'm usually not a fan of Italian restaurants.  I'm more of a spicy ethnic or sushi type of diner; HOWEVER, Mastrioni's is the exception.  So decadent.  We dined here on New Year's Eve (lucky to get a reservation)  Everyone's meal (including my picky 9-year old's) was perfect.  Being that the diet started on 1/1 we gorged on amazing bread, penne with shrimp, scallops and vodka sauce, lovely wines and festive mixed drinks.  Perfection.

RL8SOJcvKN-cNNdpSGnJTQ.text: My first time here saw the reviews and thought I would try as it's right around the corner from my house. The service is 5 star so the rating is for the food I thought I would try the old standard spaghetti and meatballs  the portion is huge with 2 softball size meatballs I was impressed with the plate of food set before me. Then I tasted it the sauce was nice and fresh but horribly sour being italian I know sour sauce. Then I cut into the meatball I saw no sign of onion or garlic or anything but meat it tasted like a round plain burger. Needless to say I was so let down. With a good italian name like that I was so underwealmed. This place could be the best italian restaurant in town but the chef needs to go back to basics a little sugar in the sauce and some sauteed garlic onion basil salt and pepper in the meatball you would have 5 star food to match your 5 star service. I will try them again but will probably get a steak until the red sauce improves

They have a very good seafood selection on the menu and all the food we ordered was amazing!  The halibut is a must try.  The atmosphere was very nice.  I was also impressed with the service.

3ISHF8x3ZR2pRHD221tWOQ.text: My third visit within 1 year,the waiters are like used car salesman, food is over priced and over rated. ZK-mtA0lVG_Jq6kfbq-bNA.text: The food was extremely disappointing. We ordered linguini with clams and I'm pretty sure they were canned clams. The service was ok. Young, inexperienced servers with a ton of enthusiasm who didn't know the difference between black pepper and chili pepper flakes.

aRXGdHQSI7x-iIY9GQwLVQ.text: This restaurant is, without question, the BEST, local Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Beside the consistency in quality dishes, the relaxed atmosphere is upbeat and fun! The owner, Pete, is truly a seasoned and professional restaurant owner with the touch of "Wacky" that keeps the local fans coming back time and time again. The food is second to none, you are NEVER disappointed. The service is outstanding and the prices are very fair! For a special treat, order the Mastrioni salad and if you really want a taste of heaven, order the Caprise salad with peaches.

ZcJJQTA9cgblb7ikzZX1Bg.text: Not impressed at all. Expected good Italian food for the price and given reputation, but I was disappointed to say the least. I can cook Italian better that that on my worst night. We had the pasta with clams, not like others world class chefs make in Las Vegas.

Ep0sfMkSBgPwBykrH9jXLg.text: Staff service is a 10. You don't have to wait on anything, and they'll bring more bread before you run out. The food is great and not a pinch short on spices. I'll be back.

FYk6aPPSb22v310xtRrEhQ.text: Excellent!!!! Food and service was amazing!!!! We sat at the bar so we could see the kitchen and it was very impressive! The chefs were hard at work preparing mouthwatering meals! The staff was very nice and welcoming. This restaurant was by far one of the best I've ever been to in Vegas and I've been in town for 40 years!

KykM8Z0oVsdzOI5zJsamdA.text: First time was amazing! Second time was sad and depressing! njPAndRZM9annIwRRK2Mtw.text: This restaurant came highly recommended, and did provide a competently prepared meal. I enjoyed the chicken parmigiana although the accompanying pasta proved only satisfactory.  I read promising reviews of the lasagna, but they were not serving it that night, which appears to occur regularly. The service was adequate, not exemplary, and I noted they abandoned my group when they were ready for us to leave.  The thirst was memorable. Overall an adequate restaurant, but not living up to the reputation I had heard. Fortunately the company was better, more pleasant, and more memorable than the meal.

mTBaVbAbDSJqEY3lEbzieg.text: I thought I wrote this when I posted my pics from Mother's Day. Ooops, I forgot but here goes. Everything was amazing! Being a server myself and knowing that Mother's day is one of the busiest days of the year, everything was on point! The Veal Marsala was tender and flavorful! We had a shrimp scampi appetizer that could've been a meal! My Mom ordered their version of Spumoni and it was so good she had to have a second one! We've been there several times and will be back soon!
