oH-7sK9-KwD_taUPEpJrrw.text: Impressions. "I'm gonna make him an offer he won't refuse."  Ok, joking aside, I truly believe first impressions are important but don't tell the whole story.  This is one of those times. So here we go.    Walking up to this small strip mall storefront, I was wondering what I was getting myself into but my daughter insisted we eat close to Golden Spoon Yogurt so we could get a good desert.  So in we go.  The dark room reminded me of the Godfather so I started to get the Italian feel. "Cenare"  Being from back east, the first lesson I learned about Italian Restaurants is you can tell a good restaurant by the bread they serve you.  I will admit the west coast doesn't always follow that rule, maybe because few restaurants have the old brick ovens but I was disappointed in the bread served. You could get better bread at Vons.   My next impression, was the menu.  Everything looked good and the standard Italian fare (veal parmagiani, Pastas, etc) was broadened by seafood dishes.  The prices were much higher than I would expect from a strip mall store much to my disappointment.  (see below for part of the reason why).   I was here with my daughter and she ordered the Kids portion of the Penne Marinara.  I opted for spaghetti and meatballs as I didn't want to break the wallet and was craving comfort foods.  The specials sounded great (Lobster Ravioli and Seafood Risotto) but I went with the standard. After all, if an Italian place can't do Spaghetti and Meatballs right, well the rest of the dishes might as well be frozen dinners.   The penne was good, The kids sauce not too spicy but, and here is the pricing issue, the kids portion was enough for an adult.  The adult portion was huge.  The meatballs themselves looked like the Bull won. (Old off color joke, you can send me a private message if you don't get it.) Lets just say they were huge.  They were surprisingly light and flavorful if on the spicy side.  When I make meatballs or eat at some other restaurants, the meatballs are often too dense. These were perfect.  The Spaghetti on the other hand tasted a little overcooked and the sauce, although flavored with spiciness, lacked the garlic I hoped for and was a bit watery.  I usually finish my food but I was able to bring home one of the two meatballs and half the spaghetti and my daughter brought home more than 1/2 her meal.  The service here made this place stand out.  Our waiter was polite, informative about the specials, and attentive.  My drink never sat for more than a minute without him offering to refill the Coke or my daughter's lemonade. In fact, the busboy and another waiter also took time to make sure I was fine on the drinks.  I drink fast so that was a plus.  They brought us butter for the bread on request (otherwise you just get olive oil and balsamic). They also told us about deserts without trying to push them on us.  Overall, except for the price and the dichotomy between spicy and watery sauce, I ended up impressed.  If I could change one thing, I would make the portions 1/2 the size and cut the price by $5.00 but hey, they must do ok to maintain those prices in such a low traffic area.  Buon Appetito

DsE_7H1PIc3voQgo03hezA.text: The food and service here is always very good.  It we a little disconcerting to see the cook grab some pasta with his bare hands and throw it in the boiling water.  He handled several other food items without gloves.  I love the food here but that really disappointed me.

YgpSr31bCAVTF2oKb8Eezg.text: first time i have been here after my girl heard great things about it and i realized its the restaurant for the billboard i have seen on the way home many times on the 215. we had the special app burrata cheese with tomatoes. it was good but not heirloom tomatoes really? rookie mistake..cheaper with reg tomatoes but mistake for sure...burrata is amazing though, can't lie...also had the crab cakes it was a big portion size however, not great flavor and needs some work. had the spagetti and meatballs for dinner, noodles were good but not home made, meatballs were a big portion but not as good as lavo...for dessert the espresso cake, 1 word WOW!!! it was amazing and would go back just for that. also love the off the strip prices, the bottle of wine which was a ruffino was $42 which was a steal. great service as well, can't remember his name at the time but super friendly and helpful.   great little feel inside the restaurant and will go back for that feeling. not the best food but will give it another try for sure. restaurant was packed on a tuesday night so clearly they are doing something right. seems like a local summerlin ritzy crowd. mostly old ppl and we were the only asians in the restaurant other than the ppl who were sat next to us. coincidence? not sure...haha

WtY5yC80RUoAWB8kBDKczA.text: this honestly deserves 1 star but the entree saved it from being such.....3 of us go to lunch today, we sit down and the server comes and asks if theres going to be 2 more (table was set for 5, we originally were going to have 5 but ended up not), like 5-8 minutes go by before he comes back to offer us drinks, so we get drinks. Then he scurries away before we can even ask him about putting something in while we wait, comes back several minutes later and we ask him to put in the calamari...i heard good things about this place specifically the calamari, i love calamari so was really really looking forward to it.   We are snacking on bread and the oil/balsamic mix they give you, its OK...bread isnt anything to write home about...the calamari arrives low and behold it looks plain as can be, as in zero seasoning and quickly flash fried but i give it a shot nonetheless....anddddddd im spot on. $15 for AWFUL calamari, unbelievable. We thought about saying something but just let it go.  So we ordered another appetizer to go along with it, the garlic bread for a whopping $7.....what was it? It was the SAME BREAD they give you for free as much as you want, 5 tiny slices with a little garlic on top and baked....haha next time im bringing my own garlic and just eating it. Unreal.  Entrees made up for it, i ordered the salmon and the others ordered some kind of pasta which he raved about but its compared to the dog crap we were eating for the previous 45 minutes, so its hard to not be better than that. The salmon was ok, but again compared to what we were eating it was heavens grace.  Im definitely not planning a trip back any time soon and would not go out of my way for it, the ambiance inside is beautiful and the place is really really nice looking, but the food sucks.  oh and we were going to ask about the canoli but then we saw it was $10....unless that thing is stuffed with gold, im not paying $10 for a canoli

cVP0LeN6NLy1MRPoE6V4FQ.text: Excellent service and top notch food. We had 5PM reservations and thank God we did. By 5:30PM the place was just about full. Servers were super attentive even during that busy hour.

jcf-Y0OZBd4QgdLzxQW9Bw.text: This is the most underrated restaurant in Summerlin...........their food and service are first class!!

AfbQ8RC_joYgSxn7RfGvCw.text: Superb food with a menu selection second  to none. The party is better than the invitation!

-XATvnX8kPTsrM1hNtbcow.text: Still can't quite decide. Had dinner here. 4 of us. All 4 don't drink. $288+tip so $343 was total in the end. Everything was good. Nothing was blow me away good. What was great was a night out with my wife and our friends. Service was very good. There's really not much in Vegas for a nice sit down meal off the strip and that's why I think it gets all the high marks. Don't get me wrong it wasn't bad. But for the price I'd wayyyy rather Vitners grill or drive to the strip. I wouldn't avoid it. It's worth a visit to try it out, but it won't be where I take mom when she comes to town to visit either.

HAMOs7biMelIpkSI3mCvXg.text: I tried this place when visiting my Friend who lives in Vegas. I was not impressed. I ordered the scampi with linguini and you could tell the shrimp was previously frozen and then cooked too much. The bread was what you could buy in the market, nothing to write home about. The waiter was very attentive and replaced my scampi with mussels and clams in a  broth that tasted mostly like lemon. I was hoping for some garlic flavor but there was little to be had in either the scampi or the mussels/clams. Nice Chianti!

DhTK9WTOv-0ZsZssR02OqA.text: One of our favorite Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. I really enjoyed the fettuccine Alfredo and the service was impeccable  next holiday we will be back again.

PrU8FrbreS2wL9Do_EthdA.text: My friend is Siclian and for years I could only eat italian food when I went to his place cause of how good and authentic. Right down to the homemade vodka sauce.  The egg plant parm here is amazing.  With the proper distribution of cheese through out the whole meal.  This is my new spot, best italian in Vegas off the strip guarantee!!

VX50fx0TONpyVfDlwwgc_Q.text: The Rigatoni Bolognese is amazing! It's my favorite dish is in this place. (Meant to post in 2012. Way delayed post.)

mUdb_KNw76TYfsp0-H9Yxw.text: I loved my meal here at Mastioni's. I did a seafood pasta with a vodka style sauce and came with my mom who was in town from FL.  She did a more garlic, oil type seafood pasta.  Both were awesome.  Dress nice, place is nice but doesn't break the bank.

eZdGImK6RGbDfYtcidcXoA.text: Let me start off by saying this place has absolutely delicious food. However, I cannot give it the full 5 star rating due to one time where my food was a giant ball of oil. The prices are extremely reasonable! Great place to bring a date or the entire family. Quiet, relaxing atmosphere that could either be used for romance or just having a moment of cooling down from the desert heat.

2vLiin-NYs_IkmXoLL7whg.text: After a massage at Massage Nirvana we went here for dinner. Very comfortable atmosphere, yet VERY nice; upscale seating but comfortable attire is a-ok (as we were in cute sweats and tanks). The front house, busser, waiter- EVERYONE very kind and warm.   We were never rushed, which we are used to so it was shocking when our waiter asked if we were ready to fire our entree- awesome!  The food is amazing, I've worked at high-end Italian and this place is just as good if not better. Very generous with the bread, we got the Key Lime Pie Martini(and a Peach Martini, she preferred the K.L.P) and Very Berry Martini- both were delicious.   House salads as appetizers, I got the balsamic which I found perfectly balanced. And I got the pasta with red sauce and sausage, my friend went a lil healthier and got pasta and broccoli, though her plate was good, well, mine was heaven. Even though we were stuffed (large portions) we got Cheesecake and the Tiramisu. Well, the tiramisu was light and fluffy- tasted like they had just made it, and the cheesecake was rich and yummy.   The plates average 15-18 (nicer meals like Veal is higher 25-30), price is fitting for the food, the bill was about $120- worth it!  This is the place for my pasta (or seafood) kick when I am visiting Las Vegas.

5IjGhIVN1cBzfUCRIMtkNw.text: Amazing food but a tad pricey. I had the seafood linguine, which was great. Service was good. You can get the same quality food at other places for a bit cheaper, but if you love locally owned Italian spots you will love this place.

PRsvMUcXzVaTXopz_jgfRA.text: Great little spot up in Summerlin. It looks like just a sandwich shop from the outside but once inside it is gorgeous and they serve the best italian food in vegas. The seafood salad is the most freshest seafood I have ever had and you don't even need dressing on it. Make sure to grab one of the chicken dishes. They are extremely moist and so juicy.

6cB308XvR1ygxSPVsQIA3g.text: Our first visit and definitely not the last.  Very friendly staff and our server, Dane, was excellent.... friendly, attentive and professional.  We had the baked ravioli and spaghetti and meatballs.  Both meals were delicious with generous portions.  The meatballs were some of the best I have ever tried.  Dane gave further explanation on a couple of the wines we were looking at and suggested one that we really enjoyed.  Nice selection of wines in varied price ranges.  We thought the menu was a bit pricey, but the ambiance and service, as well as the quality of our meal justified this.  We will be back, and bring our friends next time.

gQb3oNiU-gTJzfhkVWgvXQ.text: The ambience was nice.  The service was good, better than last time.  But the food was not acceptable this time so we won't be going back.  We took our son who is a chef in another city. He said the saute cook was flaring up the fire under the saute pan for dramatic effect and probably ruining the food.  Sure enough my Alaskan salmon was served very overcooked and as soft as Atlantic salmon.  My husband's halibut was served almost raw.  He should have sent it back but didn't.  It's a shame, we really wanted to like this place.

a8CWJRWt2_Vfms6Wir3Xtg.text: Awesome service for a great little Italian place! Justin is so funny and witty and made our small group of 3 laugh and enjoy a birthday celebration! Great dinner!

dG4Jj2CNSXNMECUtQ51oiA.text: Tonight was my sisters birthday and five of us arrived at a little after 5P for dinner.  We loved every minute of it. Xalan was the server and honestly is as good as it gets with service. The other wait staff that cleared and brought food were equally as good.  As hard core old fashion Italians we loved the food! Dad-Sea Bass perfectly cooked. Mom-Baked Ziti, delicious, birthday sister Veal Parm, yummy, Sister Eggplant Parm, great and I had the Linguini and White Clams, delicious! Desert all good, yes the cream puffs incredible, the cannoli brought back memories of our from Italy Grandma, and Tiramisu great.  Wine very good. Thank you for a good meal, great service and making my sisters 21st birthday for the 31st time a special occasion for us!

c1P9R-Vs9wRcjfj3iPO6Nw.text: The only reason why am giving this restaurant a four out of five instead of a five out of five rating is because of the pretentious/weird/not the most inviting attitude from the hostess (hopefully she is not the owner but acted full of herself enough to possibly be the owner or related to)----on the other hand ....Kurt and Danny were AMAZING and my party and I will be back because of them and the food!!!! Thanks guys!!! You made the experience!!!!!!

wngJXHnVN1UjOKU6uuDlzQ.text: wonderful service, family owned charm. food is authentic Italian, just like my family's cooking! my home away from home!

c-ISUrmamSMizvYKF0hynw.text: Giving this place 3 stars is a lot for the experience that I had. Let me start by saying the food here is excellent! In addition the speed of service is also great. My complaint here is not the food so much as the ambiance and a specific server. I honestly wish I had kept the receipt with the servers name on it bc I couldn't tell you what it is. However I know he is an older man who wears his glasses around his neck. The experience I had with this server was terrible. I will start by saying he is very educated in the specials and the menu and was able to suggest many meals to us before we even opened the menu. However, when myself or anyone at my table asked about how a certain item is he just said it was great and almost seemed like he was annoyed. Now let me say, I am also a server and know sometimes tables can be annoying but obviously I work for tips and know that my guests spend a lot of money to come out to eat and I should show them great customer service. We began the meal by ordering the caprese salad which was on the pricey side it was $17 for about 4 pieces of buffalo cheese and about 5 tomatoes none the less it was delicious. Typically when the food is ordered the server will bring the oil and balsamic vinegar prior to or when the meal is delivered. This server didn't, which is fine everyone forgets things from time to time. What upset me was that when my 15 year old brother asked him for balsamic vinegar he asked for balsamic vinaigrette which he soon corrected himself. The server responded with "I got it I know what you mean you're food just came out" with an attitude. Strike one. I didn't like that response again coming from a server my response would've been absolutely I apologize I didn't think your food would come out so fast or something along those lines. Ok, strike one I'll let it go. A little while down the meal an older "bougie" woman was sitting behind us with one of the chefs. Now keep in mind, I'm Pacific Islander and have a sleeve of tattoos, typically I get judged by ones who think they are of a higher class. None the less, I can definitely afford to be eating at this restaurant. Anyway, she sat with the chef and continuously stared at my family and myself and was making comments to the chef and our server. Whatever I also let it go, it was my younger brothers birthday and I wasn't going to let some random woman ruin it. But what upset me was when she muttered something to my server he looked back at her laughed and said "I would respond but I don't want to offend anyone else in this room." Clearly I knew he was talking about my table, because I know he wasn't talking about the 4 elderly people having a quiet dinner in the corner behind us or the two business people eating beside us. I found it to be rude but again said nothing just thought ok strike two. Now what really tipped me over the edge to where I just had to pay out and leave because again I didn't want to ruin my 15 year old brothers birthday; I asked the busser before asking for the check if the restaurant does anything for birthdays. He said they do bring it out but you have to pay for the dessert. I had a cake at home for him so I didn't want to pay for a dessert my brother is a kid and I know kids like to feel special on their birthday that was all. So again coming from someone who works in the industry I thought let me double check with my server because sometimes the bussers don't know. I checked again and advised the server I asked the busser and this is what he told me. The server annoyingly looked at me and said "yes you have to pay, did you want something"? I said no it's fine he doesn't need the dessert it was just the matter of if you did do something complimentary it would be a nice touch to the night and make him feel special. My server looked at me and said "no we don't sooooo the check"? I said ok yeah sure lets close out. After he brings out the tab before running my card he picks up a dinner candle off another table, puts it in my brothers face and shouted "we have a birthday" laughed, picked up the check and proceeded to close us out. Aside from wanting to knock him out at this point because he was clearly mocking me i felt extremely bad for my younger brother who was completely embarrassed. Needless to say he did NOT blow it out. The experience was completely rude and I was completely baffled to have been treated the way our server treated us. The food was great and for four of us to eat was $150. Not bad for a nice restaurant but not cheap for shitty service. I didn't ask for a manager and I was going to write a note to the server explaining how humiliating he made us feel. Instead I left him 20% which now I regret due to him making our time there regrettable, however as I stated before the food was impeccable and speed of service was great so I tipped based on that. However I will not be returning to this establishment due to this server and felt the need to share my experience.

zv2qlo0yWAe1Z2YxnP-rTg.text: This is a nice restaurant.  Went there Friday night. The place was quite busy and it has a nice atmosphere. Our server Nick was on top of things for the most part. My only criticism has to do with how our entrees were served.  Each person in our four person group received their meal separately.  Weird. I mean how hard is it to serve four people at the same time.  The food was very good, from pasta, chicken and veal.  The tilapia picatta was not very tasty.  Fresh fish but way too many capers.  The prices were too high, nearly Strip prices.  $45 for a veal chop is overpriced in my opinion.  Our check was $165 for one appetizer, four entrees, 4 beers, and two sodas.  Just too expensive for a restaurant in a strip mall.  For that reason we will likely skip a second visit.
